Source_Ja: 今日は調査の進め方についてトレーニングします。
Target_En: I will be teaching you how to conduct research today.
Translation_En: Today we will train on how the investigation is going forward.

Source_Ja: オンライン調査みたいなものですか？
Target_En: Like just searching online?
Translation_En: Is it like an online survey?

Source_Ja: それも含みます。
Target_En: Yes and no.
Translation_En: It also includes.

Source_Ja: まず、出所が正規のところであるかどうか確認しないといけません。
Target_En: First of all we need to make sure the sources are legitimate.
Translation_En: First of all, you need to check if the source is correct.

Source_Ja: ブログとかコラムなどはだめということですか？
Target_En: So no blogs or editorial?
Translation_En: Do you want to blog or column?

Source_Ja: そのとおり。
Target_En: Exactly.
Translation_En: as well.

Source_Ja: 最初に見るところは政府のホームページです。
Target_En: The first place I would look at is government websites.
Translation_En: The first thing to see is the government’s website.

Source_Ja: 政府の数字は、一般的に正確で信用性が高いものです。
Target_En: They typically have accurate data that is trustworthy.
Translation_En: Government figures are generally accurate and reliable.

Source_Ja: 他に良いサイトは？
Target_En: What other websites would be good?
Translation_En: What other good site?

Source_Ja: 大手の銀行、会計事務所、市場調査会社などの企業データも活用できます。
Target_En: You can also check out major institutions like banks, accounting companies, and market research companies.
Translation_En: You can also use corporate data such as major banks, accounting offices, and market research companies.

Source_Ja: どうしてですか？
Target_En: Why those?
Translation_En: Why is it?

Source_Ja: こうした企業は有名で、たいてい質の良い市況報告を発行しています。
Target_En: They are well known and typically publishes good market reports.
Translation_En: These companies are well-known and mostly publish good quality market status reports.

Source_Ja: でも、市況報告は無料でないこともあります。
Target_En: But some market reports aren't free.
Translation_En: However, market reporting is not free.

Source_Ja: なので、無料データで探します。
Target_En: So stick to the ones that are free.
Translation_En: So we’re looking for it for free data.

Source_Ja: でも、もし、有料データで良さそうなのがあったら？
Target_En: What if it seems the report is useful?
Translation_En: But what if there was a good deal with the data?

Source_Ja: 私に相談してください。
Target_En: You can consult with me then.
Translation_En: Please consult me.

Source_Ja: でも、君がやるのはほとんど予備調査だよ。
Target_En: But a lot of the research you will be doing is preliminary research.
Translation_En: But what you do is almost a preliminary investigation.

Source_Ja: 経営陣に見せるような調査ではありません。
Target_En: So it won't be presented to upper management.
Translation_En: It is not an investigation to the management.

Source_Ja: わかりました。
Target_En: I see.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: 市況報告書を購入するようなケースはあるのですか？
Target_En: Would there be cases when we would purchase market reports?
Translation_En: Is there any case to buy a market report?

Source_Ja: 詳しい実現可能性調査をするようなときには購入が必要になります。
Target_En: We will need them when we conduct detailed feasibility studies.
Translation_En: You will need to make a comprehensive analysis of the possibility of purchase.

Source_Ja: そういう調査は上層部へ報告されるので、専門の第３者企業に認証された情報でなければなりません。
Target_En: These will be presented to the upper management so we need to show that the information is validated by professional third-party companies.
Translation_En: Such research is to the top department, so it must be information certified by a professional third-party company.

Source_Ja: わかりました。
Target_En: Got it.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: ベンさん、こんにちは、またお会いできて嬉しいです。
Target_En: Hi Ben, it's nice to see you again.
Translation_En: Hello Ben, I am glad to see you again.

Source_Ja: こちらこそお会いできて嬉しいです。
Target_En: Nice to see you as well.
Translation_En: I am glad to see you here.

Source_Ja: ビジネスの方はいかがですか。
Target_En: Business has been good?
Translation_En: What about the business?

Source_Ja: 休暇のシーズンでちょっと活気がないですが、それが普通です。
Target_En: It's been a bit slow with the holiday season but that's normal.
Translation_En: It’s not a little busy during the holiday season, but that’s normal.

Source_Ja: 今日はお越しいただいてありがとうございます。
Target_En: Again thank you for coming in today.
Translation_En: Thank you for being here today.

Source_Ja: 先週送って頂いた提案についてお話したかったんです。
Target_En: I wanted to discuss the proposal you sent me last week.
Translation_En: I wanted to tell you about the proposals you sent last week.

Source_Ja: はい、マーケットリサーチに関する件ですね。
Target_En: Yes, the one regarding the market research.
Translation_En: Yes, it’s about market research.

Source_Ja: 社内で内容を検討したのですが、ちょっと我々が求めていたものとは違っていた感じがあります。
Target_En: I reviewed the contents internally and felt that it wasn't quite something we were looking for.
Translation_En: I thought about the content within the company, but it was a little different from what we wanted.

Source_Ja: もう少し具体的にお話して頂けますか。
Target_En: Can you be a bit more specific?
Translation_En: Can you tell me a bit more specifically?

Source_Ja: リサーチがもっと多くのトピックを掘り下げるのを期待していました。
Target_En: We were hoping that the research will cover more topics in depths.
Translation_En: I was expecting the research to hide more topics.

Source_Ja: しかしおおむねすでに私たちが知っている情報をカバーしていました。
Target_En: But it basically covers information we already know.
Translation_En: But above all, we covered the information we already know.

Source_Ja: 会社への聞き取り調査など、もっと実地調査を期待されていましたか？
Target_En: Were you expecting more field work like interviewing companies?
Translation_En: Did you expect more research to the company?

Source_Ja: はい、そうです。
Target_En: That's correct.
Translation_En: Yes Yes Yes.

Source_Ja: その場合、私共のサービスの料金体制が変わってきます。
Target_En: If that's the case, the cost structure for our service would be different.
Translation_En: In this case, the tax system for our services will change.

Source_Ja: それでは一律料金ではなくなるということですか？
Target_En: So it won't be a flat price?
Translation_En: Does it mean that they are not all paid?

Source_Ja: 組み合わせになりますね。
Target_En: It will be a combination.
Translation_En: It will be combined.

Source_Ja: ですから基本料金の上に、実地調査を行う期間中に月々の依頼料がかかります。
Target_En: So there will be the base price plus a monthly retainer fee for the duration of the field work.
Translation_En: Therefore, on the basis of the fee, you will pay a monthly fee during the period of real-world investigation.

Source_Ja: また、旅費と毎日の食費もかかります。
Target_En: Also, travel expense and a daily meal allowance would have to be covered as well.
Translation_En: It also costs travel and daily food.

Source_Ja: そうですか。
Target_En: I see.
Translation_En: Yes is?

Source_Ja: 上司と話し合うので、その料金体制で別の提案を出して頂けますか？
Target_En: How about you give me another proposal with that cost structure so I can discuss it with my boss.
Translation_En: Do you talk to your boss, and can you make a different proposal in the tax system?

Source_Ja: はい、すぐにご用意できます。
Target_En: Yeah I can whip that up quickly.
Translation_En: Yes, I can prepare you immediately.

Source_Ja: 週末までに改訂した提案をお渡しします。
Target_En: I think I can get you a revised proposal by the end of the week.
Translation_En: We will submit an amended proposal by the end of the week.

Source_Ja: 大変ありがたいです。
Target_En: That would be great.
Translation_En: I am very grateful.

Source_Ja: できるだけ早く送ってください。
Target_En: Please send it to us as soon as you can.
Translation_En: Please send it as soon as possible.

Source_Ja: そうします。
Target_En: Will do.
Translation_En: I do it.

Source_Ja: では、今日はお越しいただきありがとうございました。
Target_En: Well, thank you for coming today.
Translation_En: Thank you for being here today.

Source_Ja: 機会を頂き、ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you for the opportunity.
Translation_En: Thank you for the opportunity.

Source_Ja: ベンです。
Target_En: This is Ben speaking.
Translation_En: It is Ben.

Source_Ja: ベンさん、こんにちは、A社のデニスです。
Target_En: Hi Ben this is Dennis from Company A.
Translation_En: Mr. Ben, hello, I am a company of Dennis.

Source_Ja: ああ、デニスさん、こんにちは。
Target_En: Oh, hi Dennis.
Translation_En: Mr. Denis, hello to you.

Source_Ja: お元気でしたか？
Target_En: How have you been?
Translation_En: Was you well?

Source_Ja: 元気にしていました、ありがとうございます。
Target_En: I've been good thank you.
Translation_En: I was well, thank you.

Source_Ja: 最後にお話したのはいつでしたっけ？
Target_En: When was the last time we talked?
Translation_En: When was the last time I talked to you?

Source_Ja: ２年ほど前に御社の保険を更新した時だったと思います。
Target_En: I think it was around two years ago when we renewed your insurance.
Translation_En: I thought it was about two years ago when I renewed your insurance.

Source_Ja: ああ、そうでしたね。
Target_En: Oh right.
Translation_En: Oh yeah, it was so.

Source_Ja: 今日お電話したのもその件なんです。
Target_En: And I'm calling in regards to that.
Translation_En: That’s what I called you today.

Source_Ja: えっ、もう更新の時期ですか？
Target_En: Oh is it time for a renewal already?
Translation_En: Is it time for updating?

Source_Ja: そうなんですよ。
Target_En: That's right.
Translation_En: Yes is it.

Source_Ja: 来年御社の販売量が拡大するかどうかお聞きしたかったんです。
Target_En: I just wanted to ask if your sales volume will be increasing in the next year.
Translation_En: I would like to ask if the company’s sales will increase next year.

Source_Ja: それが保険料を算出する要素になるんですよ。
Target_En: That will factor into calculating the insurance rate.
Translation_En: This will be a factor in calculating the insurance fee.

Source_Ja: 私たちの輸出事業のことですか？
Target_En: You mean for our export business?
Translation_En: What about our export business?

Source_Ja: はい、そうです。
Target_En: Yes that's correct.
Translation_En: Yes Yes Yes.

Source_Ja: そうですね、現在の販売高は400万ドル前後です。
Target_En: Well, we are doing around four million in sales right now.
Translation_En: Yes, the current sales rate is 4 million dollars.

Source_Ja: 来年は600万ドルに拡大すると見込んでいます。
Target_En: We anticipate that will increase to six million next year.
Translation_En: It is expected to expand to $6 million next year.

Source_Ja: 割引料金にしてもらえますかね？
Target_En: Do you think we can get a discounted rate?
Translation_En: Can you get a discount fee?

Source_Ja: そう思いますよ。
Target_En: I think so.
Translation_En: I think so.

Source_Ja: 御社はこれまで一度も保険請求をなさっていません。
Target_En: You guys haven't had any insurance claims since you started.
Translation_En: The company has never claimed insurance.

Source_Ja: つまりローリスクとみなされるんですよ。
Target_En: So you guys would be deemed low risk.
Translation_En: This means that you are considered to be a risk.

Source_Ja: 割引料金をご提供できると思います。
Target_En: I think I can get you guys a lower rate.
Translation_En: I can offer you a discount fee.

Source_Ja: それは素晴らしい。
Target_En: That would be great.
Translation_En: It is great.

Source_Ja: 料金に関しては来週またご連絡いたします。
Target_En: I'll get back to you next week in regards to the rate.
Translation_En: We will contact you again on the price next week.

Source_Ja: 分かりました。
Target_En: Sounds good.
Translation_En: I understood.

Source_Ja: どうもありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you very much.
Translation_En: Thank you very much.

Source_Ja: さようなら。
Target_En: Goodbye.
Translation_En: Goodbye to you.

Source_Ja: それでは。
Target_En: Bye now.
Translation_En: And then.

Source_Ja: はい、ブルースです。
Target_En: Hi this is Bruce.
Translation_En: Yes, it is Bruce.

Source_Ja: ちょっと私の部屋に来てくれますか？
Target_En: Can you come to my office?
Translation_En: Can you come to my room?

Source_Ja: はい、すぐに伺います。
Target_En: Yes, I'll be right there.
Translation_En: Yes, I will ask you immediately.

Source_Ja: お呼びでしょうか？
Target_En: You wanted to see me?
Translation_En: Could you call?

Source_Ja: うん、そこにかけて。
Target_En: Yeah, have a seat.
Translation_En: Yes, take it there.

Source_Ja: あるイベントでプレゼンをやるんだが、うちの会社の紹介をしなくてはいけないんだ。
Target_En: I'm actually doing a presentation at an event and will need to introduce our company.
Translation_En: I’m going to be presenting at an event, but I’m going to be presenting our company.

Source_Ja: それが、来週なんだよ。
Target_En: It's happening next week.
Translation_En: That is the next week.

Source_Ja: 今年既に君が作ってくれたプレゼンを見直していたんだが、書き換えが必要なところがあるんだ。
Target_En: I was reviewing the presentation you made for me earlier this year and realized that it needs to be updated.
Translation_En: I've already reviewed the presentations you've made this year, but there's something you need to replace.

Source_Ja: それなら、もちろんできますよ。
Target_En: Sure I can do that.
Translation_En: So you can, of course.

Source_Ja: 会社プレゼンの新しいバージョンが総務部から出ているか調べてくれるかい？
Target_En: Can you check if there's a new version of the company presentation from the administration department?
Translation_En: Can you check if the new version of the company’s presentation is out of the headquarters?

Source_Ja: はい、大抵ホームページの社内コンテンツに新しいのをアップしています。
Target_En: Yeah, they usually post new ones on the internal website.
Translation_En: Yes, we usually upload new content to our website.

Source_Ja: 更新版が出ているかチェックしてみます。
Target_En: I'll check if they have an updated one.
Translation_En: Let’s check if the update is available.

Source_Ja: 前回のプレゼンと資産の数字も変わっているんだ。
Target_En: There's also some changes to our assets since the last presentation.
Translation_En: The previous presentations and assets are also changing.

Source_Ja: そうですね、売却資産と企業買収のところに変更があります。
Target_En: Right, there have been some changes with selling off assets and acquiring companies.
Translation_En: Yes, there is a change in the sale of assets and corporate acquisition.

Source_Ja: プレゼンの変更箇所のリストを送るよ。
Target_En: I'll send a list of changes for the presentation.
Translation_En: Send a list of changes to the presentation.

Source_Ja: それだと助かります。
Target_En: That will be helpful.
Translation_En: That will help.

Source_Ja: 今日帰るまでに原稿を仕上げられる？
Target_En: Do you think you can make me a draft by the end of today?
Translation_En: Can you complete the book until you get back today?

Source_Ja: できると思います。
Target_En: I think so.
Translation_En: I think I can.

Source_Ja: 内容を加えたり削除したりするだけなので、すぐできるでしょう。
Target_En: It's just adding and removing content so it should be quick.
Translation_En: Just add or delete the content, so you can immediately.

Source_Ja: 良かった。
Target_En: Great.
Translation_En: It was good.

Source_Ja: できたら知らせてくれ。
Target_En: Let me know when you finish.
Translation_En: Notify me if you can.

Source_Ja: はい、原稿ができましたらすぐにお送りします。
Target_En: Yeah, I'll send over a draft as soon as I finish.
Translation_En: Yes, if you can, I will send you immediately.

Source_Ja: サムさんこんにちは、頼みごとをしてもいいかな？
Target_En: Hi Sam, can you do me a favor?
Translation_En: Hello Sam, can I ask you?

Source_Ja: もちろんです。
Target_En: Sure.
Translation_En: of course.

Source_Ja: 政府の方との会議の手配をして欲しいのだけど。
Target_En: I need you to arrange a meeting with someone from the government.
Translation_En: I want to arrange a meeting with the government.

Source_Ja: どなたか特に面会したい方はいらっしゃいますか？
Target_En: Is there a specific person you want to see?
Translation_En: Does anyone want to visit you especially?

Source_Ja: 研究開発の助成金についてアドバイスをくれる人を探しているんだ。
Target_En: I'm looking for someone that can give us advice on subsidies for research and development.
Translation_En: I am looking for someone to give advice on research and development grants.

Source_Ja: 我々のプロジェクトに使える政府のプログラムがあるか知りたいんだよね。
Target_En: I want to see if there are any government programs that we can use for our project.
Translation_En: You want to know if there is a government program that can be used for our projects.

Source_Ja: 多分助成金を支給してくれる政府主導のプログラムがあると思うんです。
Target_En: I think there might be some government-run programs that provides grants.
Translation_En: I think there is a government-led program that may provide grants.

Source_Ja: 政府に知り合いがいるので彼が適切なアドバイスをくれるんじゃないかなと思いますよ。
Target_En: I know someone in the government so maybe he can direct me in the right direction.
Translation_En: If you know the government, I think he will give you the right advice.

Source_Ja: では君に任せるよ。
Target_En: I'll leave this to you then.
Translation_En: I will take it on you.

Source_Ja: 来週会議ができるか調整してみて。
Target_En: Try to see if you can arrange a meeting for next week.
Translation_En: Try to adjust the meeting next week.

Source_Ja: もしくは再来週でもいいよ。
Target_En: Or even the week after.
Translation_En: Or again next week.

Source_Ja: 承知しました。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: 弊社からは誰が出席する予定ですか？
Target_En: Who will be attending from our side?
Translation_En: Who is planning to attend from the company?

Source_Ja: ベンさんと私です。
Target_En: It will be Ben and myself.
Translation_En: Ben and I.

Source_Ja: 君も参加した方が良いかもしれないね。
Target_En: Actually, maybe you should join too.
Translation_En: You may also be better to participate.

Source_Ja: 会議の手配をしているのは君なんだから。
Target_En: Since you are the one arranging the meeting.
Translation_En: It is you who organizes the meeting.

Source_Ja: 承知しました。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: では、予定を空けておきます。
Target_En: I will keep my schedule open.
Translation_En: So let me leave the plan.

Source_Ja: とにかく会議が確定できたらお知らせいたします。
Target_En: Anyways, I'll let you know once I can confirm this meeting.
Translation_En: We will inform you if the meeting is confirmed.

Source_Ja: 確認が取れたら教えてくれ。
Target_En: Let me know when you do.
Translation_En: If you get confirmation, tell me.

Source_Ja: はい、見せてください。
Target_En: Ok, show it to me.
Translation_En: Yes, please show me.

Source_Ja: で、どう思われますか？
Target_En: So, what do you think?
Translation_En: So what do you think?

Source_Ja: ええ、できてますね。
Target_En: Yes, it's working.
Translation_En: Yes, you can it.

Source_Ja: で、それを加えてこうしたと？
Target_En: So you did this by adding that?
Translation_En: What if you added this?

Source_Ja: ええ、溶液に一度くぐらせ全体を温めないと乳化しなかったんです。
Target_En: Yes, I had to run it through a solution and then heat it though, otherwise it won't emulsify.
Translation_En: Yes, I didn’t go through the solution once and heated it all.

Source_Ja: この状態が保たれていますね。
Target_En: It's maintaining its state.
Translation_En: This condition is preserved.

Source_Ja: すごい、やりましたね！
Target_En: My goodness, you finally did it!
Translation_En: Great, you did it!

Source_Ja: これは技術的驚異ですよ。
Target_En: This is a technological marvel.
Translation_En: This is a technical surprise.

Source_Ja: よくやりました、健さん。
Target_En: Well done, Ken.
Translation_En: I did it well, Mr. Kane.

Source_Ja: 誇りに思います。
Target_En: I am so proud of you.
Translation_En: I am proud.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you.
Translation_En: Thank you.

Source_Ja: 本当に長く大変な作業でした。
Target_En: It was really long and laborious.
Translation_En: It was really a long and hard work.

Source_Ja: これは特許化しないと。
Target_En: We need to patent this.
Translation_En: This must be patented.

Source_Ja: 前にやったことはありますか？
Target_En: Have you done it before?
Translation_En: Have you ever done it before?

Source_Ja: いいえ、一度も。
Target_En: No, never.
Translation_En: No, even once.

Source_Ja: では、これはいい勉強の機会になりますから、やりましょう。
Target_En: Ok, this is going to be a great learning experience for you, so do it.
Translation_En: So this will be a good opportunity to study, so let’s do it.

Source_Ja: どこから始めればよいでしょうか？
Target_En: Where do I start?
Translation_En: Where should I start?

Source_Ja: 特許弁護士の情報をメールしますね。
Target_En: I'll email you our patent attorney's info.
Translation_En: Please send information to the patent lawyer.

Source_Ja: でもその前に、カレンに先行特許検索について話してください。
Target_En: But before that, talk to Karen about searching for existing patents.
Translation_En: But before that, talk to Karen about the patent search.

Source_Ja: 徹底的に調査して、同じもの、また似たものがないことを確認する必要があります。
Target_En: You need to search thoroughly to make sure nobody has the same thing, or even something similar.
Translation_En: You need to thoroughly investigate and make sure that there is nothing the same or similar.

Source_Ja: カレンに条件について聞いてみてください、彼女は何度もやっていますから。
Target_En: Ask Karen about the criteria, she's done this many times.
Translation_En: Ask Karen about the conditions, because she has done it many times.

Source_Ja: 分かりました、申請プロセスはどのくらいかかりますか。
Target_En: Ok, and how long is the filing process?
Translation_En: I know how long will the application process take?

Source_Ja: えっと、証明するための研究が必要になります。
Target_En: Well you need some studies for proof.
Translation_En: We need research to prove.

Source_Ja: 実験ログはありますか？
Target_En: Do you have the experiment log?
Translation_En: Do you have a experimental log?

Source_Ja: 書きなぐったものがあちこちに。
Target_En: It's really scribbled and all over the place.
Translation_En: It is written everywhere.

Source_Ja: じゃ、これがうまくいくことをしっかり確かめるためにも、綺麗な状態のものを別に作りたいかも知れません。
Target_En: Well, maybe you want to run another one with a clean slate, might as well to be absolutely certain this works.
Translation_En: So, you may also want to make something in a beautiful state to make sure this is going well.

Source_Ja: どのくらいで出来ますか？
Target_En: How long will that take you?
Translation_En: How long can you?

Source_Ja: 分からないですが、一ヶ月くらいでしょうか。
Target_En: I don’t know, about a month?

Source_Ja: それは確かに楽しそうね。

Source_Ja: 仕事をするのを忘れないようにね！
Target_En: Make sure you don't forget to work!

Target_En: The first morning, everyone is tense because they've spent the last few days preparing their booths and setting up their products.

Source_Ja: みんな気を緩めているだろ。

Source_Ja: それは素晴らしいわねエリック。

Source_Ja: ハンズオンの実演もやるんだけど、とても面白いんだ。

Source_Ja: 順応しないといけないのは確かだね。

Target_En: You know they are very different from our generation.

Source_Ja: 私にとっても学ぶ機会になってるよ。

Target_En: But they come off a little bit entitled and lazy.

Source_Ja: 言いたいことわかるよ。

Source_Ja: 我らの世代は、出世のために仕事に時間も労力も費やしてきただろう。
Target_En: Our generation is willing to invest our time and effort in order to build our careers.
Translation_En: Our generation will have spent time and effort on work for birth.

Source_Ja: 一般的に我々は自分自身の仕事、会社の為に献身的なんだ。
Target_En: We were generally committed to our jobs and the companies we work for.
Translation_En: We are generally dedicated to our own work, our company.

Source_Ja: そうだよ、私は25年間ずっとそうやってきた。

Target_En: But the millennials don't seem as committed as we are.

Target_En: They tend to leave for new opportunities after a few years.

Source_Ja: 何を優先させるかというのも違うよね？

Target_En: With the bad economy and the job insecurities the millennials have experienced, they don't expect things to stay the same.
Translation_En: Millennials are experiencing crisis and job instability, so they do not expect that the same situation will continue in any way.

Source_Ja: 彼らが頻繁に職を変えるのはそれが理由かい？
Target_En: Is that the reason they tend to switch jobs more frequently?
Translation_En: That’s why they’re changing jobs often.

Source_Ja: 多分ね、でも私の勘違いかもしれないけど。
Target_En: Maybe, but I could be mistaken.
Translation_En: Maybe, but it may be my mistake.

Source_Ja: 今年うちに雇われた従業員は真面目そうだけどね。
Target_En: The ones we hired this year seem pretty decent though.
Translation_En: Employees employed this year are serious.

Source_Ja: そうだね。
Target_En: I agree with you.
Translation_En: Yes is.

Source_Ja: 彼らが違う世代なんだという事を受け入れないといけないんだよ。
Target_En: I need to accept the fact that they are totally different generation.
Translation_En: You have to accept that they are different generations.

Source_Ja: そして少し大目に見てあげないと。
Target_En: And I need to cut them some slack.
Translation_En: I have to look at him a little bigger.

Source_Ja: マリッサとケイラブの働きぶりを見たけど、彼らはとても真面目だよ。
Target_En: I have supervised Marissa and Caleb, and they work really hard.
Translation_En: I have seen Marissa and the work of Cairo, but they are very serious.

Source_Ja: ただ数年後には彼らも我々の元を去ってしまうのか心配だけど。
Target_En: I am just afraid they will leave us in a few years.
Translation_En: I am worried that in a few years they will leave us.

Source_Ja: それは私も心配だね。
Target_En: That's my fear too.
Translation_En: I am worried about that too.

Source_Ja: 彼らは失うには勿体ない人材だよ。
Target_En: They are too good to let go.
Translation_En: They are not good people to lose.

Source_Ja: それは、もう一つ考えなければいけない事だね。
Target_En: That's another thing to consider.

Source_Ja: どうにかして従業員の離職率を低めて、定着率を上げる方法を見つけないといけないな。
Target_En: We have to figure out ways to reduce turnover and increase employee retention.
Translation_En: Somehow you need to find a way to lower the employment rate and increase the fixation rate.

Target_En: Does that mean I have to be the coolest boss to make them like me?
Translation_En: What does it mean to be a boss?

Source_Ja: ならなくてもいいけど、なるとプラスにはなるね。
Target_En: You don't have to, but it probably will help.
Translation_En: You can’t do it, but it’s going to be a plus.

Source_Ja: でも君は君のままでいいよ。
Target_En: But you just have to be you.

Source_Ja: もうすでに君は若い従業員にとって素晴らしい見本だよ。
Target_En: You are a great role model for them already.

Source_Ja: 有難う。
Target_En: Thank you for saying that.
Translation_En: and thank you.

Target_En: Now let me get back to being an awesome boss and help those young people.
Translation_En: Now again, I will be the greatest boss to help the young people.

Target_En: We're almost running out of copy paper.
Translation_En: Copy paper will soon disappear.

Source_Ja: そうですか、気づいていませんでした。
Target_En: Oh, I didn't notice.
Translation_En: Yes, I didn’t realize.

Target_En: I'll order now.
Translation_En: I will order it right now.

Source_Ja: 今週中に届くかな。
Target_En: Do you think they'll come this week?
Translation_En: It will arrive during this week.

Source_Ja: 週末までにたくさん印刷するものがあるんだよ。
Target_En: I need to print out lots of things by weekend.

Source_Ja: いつも注文した翌日に届くので、大丈夫でしょう。
Target_En: They usually deliver the next day, so it should be fine.
Translation_En: It will always come the next day you order, so it’s okay.

Source_Ja: でも、念のために、注文の際に確認しておきますね。
Target_En: But I'll double check when I order, just in case.
Translation_En: But I will check it when you order.

Source_Ja: よろしく頼む。
Target_En: Appreciate it.
Translation_En: Welcome to please.

Source_Ja: ついでに、大きめの封筒も少し頼んでくれるかな。
Target_En: Can you also order large envelopes together?
Translation_En: I would like to ask you for a little big cover.

Source_Ja: 分かりました。
Target_En: Sure.
Translation_En: I understood.

Source_Ja: 他には何かいりますか？
Target_En: Anything else?
Translation_En: Do you want something else?

Source_Ja: いや、それだけだ。
Target_En: No, that's it.
Translation_En: No, that’s all.

Source_Ja: じゃ、頼んでおきますね。
Target_En: Ok, it will be done soon.
Translation_En: So I will ask you.

Source_Ja: ありがとう。
Target_En: Thanks.
Translation_En: thank you.

Source_Ja: すみません、森さん、ちょっといいですか？
Target_En: Excuse me, Mori-san, can I ask you something?
Translation_En: Sorry, Forest, is it a good thing?

Source_Ja: はい、何でしょう。
Target_En: Yes, how can I help?
Translation_En: Yes, what is it.

Source_Ja: 客先に出すこのメール文、これでいいでしょうか？
Target_En: Could you check my e-mail letter to the client?
Translation_En: You can send this email to the customer, is this?

Source_Ja: えーと、ここ、語順をこういうふうに入れ替えた方がいいと思いますけど。
Target_En: Hmm, here, I think you should change the word order, like this.
Translation_En: I think it is better to replace the word in this way.

Source_Ja: えっ、今のすごい早いですね。
Target_En: Wow, it’s so quick.
Translation_En: Well, it’s very fast right now.

Source_Ja: コピペショートカットキーを使ったのよ。
Target_En: I used copy-and-paste short cut keys.
Translation_En: I used a short cutting key.

Source_Ja: コントロールキーとCでコピーして、コントロールとVでペーストするんです。
Target_En: You can press control key and C to copy, and then paste it with control and V keys.
Translation_En: Copy with Control Key and C and paste with Control and V.

Source_Ja: へー、ショートカットキーは便利ですね。
Target_En: Ah, short cuts are useful, aren’t they?
Translation_En: The short cutting key is helpful.

Source_Ja: 森さんは、パソコンでメール打つのも早いですよね。
Target_En: You type e-mails so fast on the PC, don’t you?
Translation_En: It’s easy to send emails on your computer, right?

Source_Ja: 僕は携帯メールは早く打てるんですけどね。
Target_En: I can send text messages on my mobile very fast.
Translation_En: I’m getting my mobile emails quickly.

Source_Ja: 中村さんたちはスマホ世代だから、フリック入力は早いのよね。
Target_En: You are in the smartphone generation, so you use flick input skilfully.
Translation_En: We are a cell phone generation, so it’s quick to enter.

Source_Ja: 私は、携帯だと画面の文字が小さくてメガネなしには良く見えないし。
Target_En: I can’t see small letters on my mobile screen without reading glasses.
Translation_En: I think the screen is small and I can’t look good without glasses.

Source_Ja: スマホなら画面拡大できますよ。
Target_En: But you can zoom in on the letters on a smartphone.
Translation_En: The phone can expand the screen.

Source_Ja: うーん、それでも、なんか使いにくい。
Target_En: I know, even so, I can’t see the whole picture.
Translation_En: Yes, yet it’s hard to use.

Source_Ja: キーは２つ一緒に打っちゃうし、パソコンの方が楽だわ。
Target_En: And my finger catches two keys at the same time, so I prefer to type on PC.
Translation_En: There are two keys together, and the computer is easier.

Source_Ja: 僕のうちにはもう、ラップトップはないですよ。
Target_En: We no longer use laptops in my family.
Translation_En: I no longer have a laptop.

Source_Ja: ふーん。
Target_En: Hmm.
Translation_En: and the.

Source_Ja: みなさん、おはようございます。
Target_En: Good morning, everyone.
Translation_En: My friends, good morning.

Source_Ja: 会議を始めますよ。
Target_En: Could I have your attention, please?
Translation_En: We will start the meeting.

Source_Ja: ご出席ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you all for coming.
Translation_En: Thank you for your presence.

Source_Ja: さあ本題に入りましょう。
Target_En: Let's get down to business.
Translation_En: Let’s go into the topic.

Source_Ja: このミーティングは社内での紙の消費量を減らすことについて話し合うのが目的です。
Target_En: The goal of this meeting is to talk about reducing paper consumption in our office.
Translation_En: The meeting aims to discuss how to reduce paper consumption within the company.

Source_Ja: アレックス、この件について意見はありますか？
Target_En: Alex, what's your opinion on this?
Translation_En: Alex, do you have any opinions about this?

Source_Ja: 素晴らしいアイディアだと思います。
Target_En: I think it's a great idea.
Translation_En: I think it is a great idea.

Source_Ja: 我が社は昨年コピー用紙の購入に10,000ドル以上費やしました。
Target_En: We spent more than 10,000 dollars on purchasing printer paper last year.
Translation_En: Our company spent more than $10,000 on the purchase of copies paper last year.

Source_Ja: インクカートリッジやペーパークリップ、フォルダーを含まずにこの金額です。
Target_En: That doesn't even include printer ink, paper clips, and folders.
Translation_En: This amount does not include ink, paper clips, and folder.

Source_Ja: ペーパーレス化を進めることで多額のお金を節約できるでしょう。
Target_En: We would save huge sums of money by going paperless.
Translation_En: You will be able to save a lot of money by developing paperless.

Source_Ja: それに書類の保管に場所を取られすぎていますし。
Target_En: We also dedicate too much storage space to paperwork.
Translation_En: There is too much space to store the documents.

Source_Ja: そうですね、私もそう思っていました。
Target_En: Yes, that's exactly what I was thinking.
Translation_En: Yes, I thought that too.

Source_Ja: フランシスコ、他にこの件について意見はありますか？
Target_En: Francisco, do you have any other thoughts on this?
Translation_En: Francis, do you have any other opinions about this?

Source_Ja: まだ言及されていない利点があるとすれば環境にも優しい点です。
Target_En: One advantage we haven't talked about is the environmental benefits.
Translation_En: If there are benefits that are not mentioned yet, they are environmentally friendly.

Source_Ja: 私たちが書類をデジタル式で保存するようになればゴミも少なくなるでしょう。
Target_En: We'll produce less waste if we start saving our paperwork digitally.
Translation_En: If we keep the documents in digital form, there will be less waste.

Source_Ja: それも私が取り組みたいと思っていたことです。
Target_En: That's also something I wanted to work on.
Translation_En: That is also what I wanted to do.

Source_Ja: アダム、あなたはどう思いますか？
Target_En: What do you think, Adam?
Translation_En: Adam, what do you think?

Source_Ja: 紙の使用を直ちに完全に止めるのは多分難しいでしょう。
Target_En: It will probably be hard to go completely paper free at once.
Translation_En: It may be difficult to stop the use of paper completely immediately.

Source_Ja: 少しずつ進めるしかないでしょうね。
Target_En: I think we'll probably have to take baby steps.
Translation_En: You just have to move a little by a little.

Source_Ja: 部によって書類作成へのニーズがまちまちなので、それぞれの部が部内の紙の使用量を管理すべきでしょう。
Target_En: Each division should manage their paper usage since they all have different needs for documentation.
Translation_En: Because the needs for document creation are different by the department, each department should control the use of paper within the department.

Source_Ja: 新たに発生する書類をみんながデジタル式で保存することが第一歩かもしれません。
Target_En: We could probably start by having everyone save new paperwork digitally.
Translation_En: It can be the first step for everyone to save new documents in digital form.

Source_Ja: その後、だれかが過去の書類もデジタル式コピーに変換すればいいのです。
Target_En: Then, someone could convert the old paperwork into digital copies.
Translation_En: After that, someone should convert the past documents into a digital copy.

Source_Ja: 最初のうちは苦労すると思いますが、ファイルの中で書類が行方不明になるのも防げるかもしれませんし。
Target_En: I think it would take a lot of work in the beginning, but it might help prevent papers getting misplaced in files.
Translation_En: In the beginning, it may be difficult, but it may also prevent the documents from disappearing in the file.

Source_Ja: なるほど。
Target_En: That seems like a good idea.
Translation_En: So much.

Source_Ja: どんな選択肢があるか技術チームに掛け合ってみましょう。
Target_En: I'll meet with the tech team to see what our options are.
Translation_En: Let us know what the technical team has to do.

Source_Ja: いろいろなソフトウェアを比べてどれが最適か評価しないといけないですからね。
Target_En: We'll need to evaluate different softwares to see which will work best.
Translation_En: You need to evaluate which software is the best in comparison.

Source_Ja: それから実装やトレーニングにかかるコストを算出できますね。
Target_En: Then we can calculate how much the implementation and training will cost.
Translation_En: You can then calculate the cost of implementation and training.

Source_Ja: 次のミーティングでは詳細をさらに議論できると思います。
Target_En: I think we can discuss these details further next meeting.
Translation_En: In the next meeting we will be able to discuss more details.

Source_Ja: 話を進めて技術チームから複数のソフトウェア案を見せてくれる方にお越しいただきましょう。
Target_En: I'll go ahead and bring in someone from the tech team to show you the different software options.
Translation_En: Let us talk to you and show you a number of software suggestions from the technical team.

Source_Ja: みなさん、お疲れ様でした！
Target_En: Great meeting, team!
Translation_En: Congratulations all of you!

Source_Ja: 由衣さん、久しぶり！
Target_En: Yui, it's been a long time!
Translation_En: Dress for a long time!

Source_Ja: あ、キースさん、本当久しぶり！
Target_En: Hi, Keith, yeah, it's been ages!
Translation_En: Oh, Kiss, I’ve been seeing you for a long time!

Source_Ja: そうそう、例の大型プロジェクト、由衣さんの案が採用だって？
Target_En: Oh, by the way I heard your proposal got approved for that large-scale project.
Translation_En: Yes, is it a big project, the project of Mr. Dress?

Source_Ja: わあ、もう聞いてます？
Target_En: Wow, you've heard about that all ready?
Translation_En: Are you listening to it already?

Source_Ja: うん、この間ブラウン課長が話してたよ。
Target_En: Yes, Mr. Brown was talking about that the other day.
Translation_En: Yes, Mr. Brown talked about it recently.

Source_Ja: おめでとう。
Target_En: Congratulations!
Translation_En: Congratulations to.

Source_Ja: ありがとう。
Target_En: Why thank you.
Translation_En: thank you.

Source_Ja: あの鬼のブラウン課長に認めて貰えるのはすごいと思うよ。
Target_En: It's amazing that you got recognized from Mr. Brown, the section chief with a heart of stone.
Translation_En: I think it’s great to be able to recognize that braun boss.

Source_Ja: しー、それ聞こえたら大変。
Target_En: Shhh, what if he catches you calling him that.
Translation_En: It’s hard to hear it.

Source_Ja: キースさんって、前ブラウン課長のプロジェクトチームに居たんだっけ。
Target_En: Oh right, Keith, you were in his project team before.
Translation_En: Mr. Keys was in the project team of the former Brown Director.

Source_Ja: うん、なんか怖そうに見えるかもしれないけど、出来る人だよ。
Target_En: Yup, he might look somewhat intimidating, but he's an able person.
Translation_En: You may seem scared, but you can.

Source_Ja: それもあって、ちょっとプレッシャー感じてるんだ。
Target_En: That's one of the reasons I feel a bit nervous.
Translation_En: I also feel a bit of pressure.

Source_Ja: ああ、かなり大きい案件だしね。
Target_En: Well, I guess, it's a pretty big project, too.
Translation_En: Oh, that’s a pretty big case.

Source_Ja: 来週までに人員計画出して、人事にも確認取らなきゃで、あー、もう既に忙しくて。
Target_En: I have to draft a staffing plan by next week, get approval from HR, aghh, I already have a lot to do.
Translation_En: You have to plan the staff for the next week, and you have to check the staff for the next week, you’re already busy.

Source_Ja: 由衣さん、落ち着いて。
Target_En: Relax, Yui.
Translation_En: Clothes, be calm.

Source_Ja: あのね、それ事前に人事の安田さんに話し通しとくと全然楽だから。
Target_En: Look, it'll get much easier if you run it by Ms. Yasuda in HR beforehand.
Translation_En: I think it’s easy to talk to Anita before that.

Source_Ja: あと、ブラウン課長のとこは残業気をつけてね。
Target_En: But you should be careful if you do overtime when you work under Mr. Brown.
Translation_En: At the same time, Mr. Brown’s head of state is careful.

Source_Ja: ありがと、頑張ってみる。
Target_En: Thanks, I'll try my best.
Translation_En: Thank you, I will try hard.

Source_Ja: ああ、ここでのんびりコーヒー飲んでる場合じゃないかも。
Target_En: Well, I guess I shouldn't even be here having coffee.
Translation_En: Maybe you’re going to be drinking coffee here.

Source_Ja: こら、おしゃべりな同僚と気分切り替えるのも必要でしょ？
Target_En: Hey, you should also refresh yourself with a chatty coworker, right?
Translation_En: You need to change feelings with your friends, right?

Source_Ja: そうだ、ひと休みするって事で、金曜日はかなり忙しい？
Target_En: Oh yeah, speaking of taking a break, are you super busy on Friday?
Translation_En: Do you want to go on a vacation, Friday is busy?

Source_Ja: えっと、１９日だよね？
Target_En: let's see, you mean the 19th?
Translation_En: It is 19 days, right?

Source_Ja: んーどうかな、明日どれくらい進むかによるけど。
Target_En: Well, I really can't tell, depends on how far along I get tomorrow.
Translation_En: It depends on how long it will go tomorrow.

Source_Ja: なんで？
Target_En: What about it?
Translation_En: Why to?

Source_Ja: 早めに上がれそうなら、お祝いに俺が奢るっての、どう？
Target_En: If you can get off early, how about I buy you a drink and toast to your success.
Translation_En: If I get up early, what if I want to celebrate?

Source_Ja: やった、ゴチになります！
Target_En: Yay, I like that idea!
Translation_En: I have done it, it will be crazy!

Source_Ja: あの角のバルとか、安いとこでよければだけど。
Target_En: If you don't mind going to a cheapie place like that Spanish bar at the corner, though.
Translation_En: If you want a bar or a cheap bar.

Source_Ja: 全然いい、気合い入れて定時に終わらせる。
Target_En: Doesn't matter at all, I'll push myself to get the work done on time.
Translation_En: It’s good, I’m happy to finish it in time.

Source_Ja: 仕事終わりにラインすればいい？
Target_En: Should I LINE you when I'm done?
Translation_En: Do I have a line at the end of work?

Source_Ja: 俺、ラインあんまり見ないから、携帯メールの方がいいかな。
Target_En: I don't check my LINE very often so I think a text message to my mobile is better.
Translation_En: I don’t look at the line, so I’m better using a cell phone.

Source_Ja: あの既読とか付いて返信しなきゃいけない気がするの、苦手なんだよね。
Target_En: I don't really like that massages get marked as read, and these makes you feel like you have to reply right away.
Translation_En: I don’t feel like you have to read and answer it, right?

Source_Ja: あ、ブラウン課長はいつもラインで、スタンプも送ってくるよ。
Target_En: Oh, Mr. Brown always uses LINE and he sends messages with stickers, too.
Translation_En: Oh, the chief Brown is always on the line and sends the stamps.

Source_Ja: まじで！？
Target_En: No way!!
Translation_En: seriously?

Source_Ja: まじまじ、結構お茶目なとこあるよ。
Target_En: Seriously, he does silly things sometimes.
Translation_En: Seriously, there’s a lot of tea.

Source_Ja: そうだ、ブラウン課長も誘ってみない？
Target_En: Yeah, why don't we ask Mr. Brown to join us?
Translation_En: Would you like to invite Mr. Brown?

Source_Ja: うわー、それはちょっとまだハードル高いかも。
Target_En: Oh no, that is too much of a challenge for me right now.
Translation_En: Maybe it’s a bit too hard.

Source_Ja: 打ち解ければ結構いい人だし、今後仕事もしやすいと思うけど。
Target_En: He's quite a nice guy once you get to know him and I think it'll help you when you work together.
Translation_En: I think he’s a good man, and I think it’s easy to work.

Source_Ja: うーん、ちょっと考えさせて。
Target_En: Well, let me think about that.
Translation_En: Oh yeah, let me think a little.

Source_Ja: とにかく無理そうなら早めに連絡ちょうだい。
Target_En: Anyway, if you can't make it, can you text me ASAP?
Translation_En: If you can, please contact us early.

Source_Ja: 了解。
Target_En: You got it.
Translation_En: to understand.

Source_Ja: もしもし、御社の「日本の自動車部品業界」という英文出版物を購入したいのですが。
Target_En: Hello, I’d like to buy your English publication called “Japanese Auto Parts Industry”.
Translation_En: If you want to buy your company’s English publication “Japan Automotive Parts Industry”.

Source_Ja: はい、ただいま最新版の購入予約を受け付けております。
Target_En: Certainly, you can pre-order the latest edition at the moment.
Translation_En: Yes, we are now receiving the latest version of the purchase reservation.

Source_Ja: 発売予定はいつですか？
Target_En: When will it be out?
Translation_En: When is the release scheduled?

Source_Ja: 5月1日です。
Target_En: May the 1st.
Translation_En: It is 1 May.

Source_Ja: そうですか、いくらですか？
Target_En: Okay, how much is it?
Translation_En: Yes, how much is it?

Source_Ja: 消費税を含めまして１冊10万円です。
Target_En: 100,000 yen per copy including the consumption tax.
Translation_En: The consumer tax is 100,000 yen.

Source_Ja: じゅっ、10万円！？
Target_En: H-hundred thousand yen!?

Source_Ja: はい。
Target_En: Yes.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: どうしてそんなに高いんですか？
Target_En: Why is it so expensive?
Translation_En: Why is it so expensive?

Source_Ja: どうしてと言われましても・・・
Target_En: I don’t know why...
Translation_En: Whatever it is said...

Source_Ja: すみません、私にはお答えできません。
Target_En: Sorry but I’m not in a position to answer that.
Translation_En: Sorry, I can’t answer you.

Source_Ja: そんなに高いと、ちょっと買えないなあ。
Target_En: Hmm, we can’t afford such an expensive book.
Translation_En: So expensive, you can’t buy a bit.

Source_Ja: バックナンバーでしたら、永田町にある国会図書館で閲覧できますよ。
Target_En: You can browse our back issues at the National Diet Library in Nagata-cho.
Translation_En: If you have the back number, you can see it at the Congress Library in Yogyakarta.

Source_Ja: そうですか。
Target_En: Ah, okay.
Translation_En: Yes is?

Source_Ja: じゃあ、見てから決めます。
Target_En: I may have a look first and then decide.
Translation_En: I will decide after you see it.

Source_Ja: とりあえず、パンフレットだけ送っていただけますか？
Target_En: Can you send me the brochure for now?
Translation_En: Can you just send me a panflet?

Source_Ja: はい。
Target_En: Of course.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: ご住所をお願いします。
Target_En: May I have your address, please?
Translation_En: Please give your address.

Source_Ja: 港区赤坂 xx-xx A社 調査部 村上宛にお願いします。
Target_En: It’s Research Department, Company A, xx-xx Akasaka, Minato-ku, attention to Murakami, please.
Translation_En: Please contact the port district赤坂 xx-xx A company investigation department.

Source_Ja: わかりました。
Target_En: No Problem.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: どうも。
Target_En: Right.
Translation_En: and thanks.

Source_Ja: じゃ、これで失礼します。
Target_En: Thank you, bye.
Translation_En: So I apologize for this.

Source_Ja: お電話ありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you for your call.
Translation_En: Thank you for the phone.

Source_Ja: まとめとして、我が社は人々の暮らしを改善できるような意義あるイノベーションに取り組んでいます。
Target_En: Overall, our company is focused on meaningful innovation that will improve people's lives.
Translation_En: In summary, our company is working on meaningful innovations that can improve people’s lives.

Source_Ja: ご清聴ありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you for your attention.
Translation_En: Thank you for listening.

Source_Ja: 少々ご質問にお答えします。
Target_En: I have a few minutes to answer questions.
Translation_En: I will answer a bit of your question.

Source_Ja: はい、後ろの列の方。
Target_En: Yes, you in the back row.
Translation_En: Yes, the back line.

Source_Ja: お名前は？
Target_En: What's your name?
Translation_En: What is your name?

Source_Ja: 高橋です。
Target_En: I'm Takahashi.
Translation_En: The high bridge.

Source_Ja: 社内での役割変更は頻繁ですか？
Target_En: How often do people switch roles in your company?
Translation_En: Are there frequent changes within the company?

Source_Ja: もし従業員が新しいことに挑戦したい場合、異動は簡単でしょうか？
Target_En: If your employees want to try something new, is it easy for them to switch teams?
Translation_En: If employees want to challenge something new, is it easy to move?

Source_Ja: もちろんです！
Target_En: Of course!
Translation_En: of course!

Source_Ja: しかしながら、良い質問ですね。
Target_En: Great question, by the way.
Translation_En: But it is a good question.

Source_Ja: 私たちは企業としてイノベーションに向けた努力をしていますので、従業員が良い刺激を得ることを良しとしています。
Target_En: As a company, we strive for innovation, so we want to make sure our employees are inspired.
Translation_En: As a company, we are striving towards innovation, so we are happy that our employees get a good stimulation.

Source_Ja: つまり、従業員の社内異動を奨励していますが、みんな最低6ヶ月間はひとつのチームに留まってもらうようにしています。
Target_En: This means that we are more than happy to have people switch teams, but we try to keep everyone on one team for at least 6 months
Translation_En: That is, we encourage employees to move within the company, but we ensure that everyone remains in one team for at least six months.

Source_Ja: 異動による混乱が起こらず、従業員が良い仕事をし続ける限り、なんの問題もないと思っています。
Target_En: As long as the change isn't disruptive and the employee continues to produce quality work, we certainly don't have a problem with it.
Translation_En: I don’t think there’s any trouble as long as the employees continue to do a good job.

Source_Ja: 次の質問をどうぞ。
Target_En: Next question?
Translation_En: Please ask the next question.

Source_Ja: はい、あちらの方。
Target_En: Yes, you over there.
Translation_En: Yes, the one there.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、水野と申します。
Target_En: Hello, my name is Mizuno.
Translation_En: I say hello to the water.

Source_Ja: 武田さんがA社で働く上で一番の長所と思われる点はなにかお聞きしたいです。
Target_En: I was wondering, what is your favorite part about working at Company A?
Translation_En: I would like to ask you what I think is the greatest advantage of working in a company.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you!
Translation_En: Thank you.

Source_Ja: 水野さん、ご質問ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you for your question, Ms. Mizuno.
Translation_En: Mr. Waterman, thank you for your question.

Source_Ja: ひとつだけ選ぶのは難しいですね！
Target_En: It's hard to pick just one thing!
Translation_En: It’s hard to choose just one!

Source_Ja: 人と環境にとても恵まれている点でしょうね。
Target_En: I would say I really enjoy the people and the environment.
Translation_En: It is very good for people and the environment.

Source_Ja: みんな一生懸命働いていますし、それが自分自身を向上させキャリアを積む良いモチベーションになっています。
Target_En: Everyone works hard, and it's very motivating to push myself and further my career.
Translation_En: Everyone is working hard and it becomes a good motivation to improve yourself and build a career.

Source_Ja: A社で働き始めてから人として随分成長しましたし、ここで過ごした時間にとても感謝しています。
Target_En: I've had so much personal growth since I started with Company A, and I'm very grateful for my time here.
Translation_En: I have grown a lot as a person since I started working in a company and I am very grateful for the time I spent here.

Source_Ja: 社会人としての良いスタートを切るにはA社以外になかったと思います。
Target_En: I can't imagine starting my career anywhere else.
Translation_En: I think it was not a good start for a company.

Source_Ja: 前列の方、最後の質問をどうぞ。
Target_En: Person in the front row can ask the last question.
Translation_En: Please ask the last question.

Source_Ja: 今現在採用したい技能や人材はどういうものでしょうか。
Target_En: What would you say is a missing skill or need you're looking to fill right now?
Translation_En: What are the skills and personnel you want to employ now?

Source_Ja: 現在マーケティングチームがソーシャルメディアマーケティングへの充分な基礎的知識を備えた人材を探しています。
Target_En: Right now, I know the marketing team is looking for more people who have a good, fundamental knowledge of social media marketing.
Translation_En: Currently, the marketing team is looking for people with sufficient basic knowledge for social media marketing.

Source_Ja: 残念ながら、これでプレゼンテーションの終了時刻となりました。
Target_En: Unfortunately, this is the end of the scheduled time for this presentation.
Translation_En: Unfortunately, this is the end time for the presentation.

Source_Ja: 皆さん、私どもの会社に関心を寄せていただきありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you again, everyone, for your interest in our company.
Translation_En: Thank you all for your interest in our company.

Source_Ja: 履歴書をお持ちの方は、こちらにご提出ください。
Target_En: If you brought a resume, please hand it in up here.
Translation_En: Anyone who has a resume please submit here.

Source_Ja: もし他に質問があれば、短い時間ですがお答えします。
Target_En: I'll stick around for a few minutes if you have any further questions.
Translation_En: If you have any other questions, it’s a short time to answer.

Source_Ja: 来月からの新しいプロジェクトについては聞いていますか？
Target_En: Have you heard about the new project starting next month?
Translation_En: Have you heard of a new project next month?

Source_Ja: はい、社内向けのニュースレター作成ですよね。
Target_En: Yes, about starting internal newsletters.
Translation_En: Yes, you’re creating a newspapers for the company.

Source_Ja: そうです。
Target_En: That's right.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: 毎月、技術トレンドや新しい研究について情報発信をしていきます。
Target_En: We will try to offer the information on technology trends and new researches every month.
Translation_En: Every month, we publish information about the technology trends and new research.

Source_Ja: 技術分野は特に限られてないんですよね。
Target_En: We can talk about any technological fields without limitation, can't we?
Translation_En: The field of technology is not limited.

Source_Ja: そうですね、当社に関連のある分野であれば。
Target_En: Yes, as long as those fields are relevant to us.
Translation_En: Yes, if you are in a field related to us.

Source_Ja: ただ、現在うちで力を入れている分野からなるべく情報収集してください。
Target_En: However, I appreciate it if you could get information on the fields where we focus most as the company.
Translation_En: Simply collect as much information as possible from the area you are currently in power.

Source_Ja: と言うことは、スマート家電関連に目を向けるのがいいということになりますね。
Target_En: Then, we'd better look at something related to smart appliances.
Translation_En: That means you should look at the smart home connections.

Source_Ja: そうですね。
Target_En: Correct.
Translation_En: Yes is.

Source_Ja: 洗濯機や食洗器などに関連のある技術がいいですね。
Target_En: The technologies related to washers and dishwashers are pretty good.
Translation_En: Technically related to the washing machine and the washing machine.

Source_Ja: あとは、テレビ関連の技術でしょうか。
Target_En: Maybe technologies for TV too.
Translation_En: What about television-related technology?

Source_Ja: テレビやオーディオ機器などエンターテイメント要素のあるものも視野に入れておいてください。
Target_En: Please keep an eye on the areas related to entertainment such as TVs and audio systems.
Translation_En: Keep things with entertainment elements, such as TV and audio equipment, in the sight.

Source_Ja: 更に、当社とM工科大学の産学協同関係を活かした情報も載せていただけると良いかと。
Target_En: Also, it would be great if you could include some info from our industry-university collaboration with M Engineering University.
Translation_En: In addition, you may also be able to post information about the cooperation between our company and M Technical University.

Source_Ja: M工科大の先端技術研究は面白いですからね。
Target_En: The advanced technology researches at M Engineering University are very interesting.
Translation_En: Advanced Technical Research is interesting.

Source_Ja: 本当に。
Target_En: I know.
Translation_En: in truth.

Source_Ja: 機密保持に関しては大丈夫でしょうか。
Target_En: How is it in terms of the confidentiality?
Translation_En: Is it OK with respect to confidentiality?

Source_Ja: 当社との協同契約内の範囲であれば、社内への発信は大丈夫だということです。
Target_En: As long as it is included in our collaboration contract, we can share it within the company.
Translation_En: If it is within the scope of the cooperation agreement with our company, the transmission to the company is OK.

Source_Ja: ならば、安心です。
Target_En: Glad to hear.
Translation_En: If so, I am calm.

Source_Ja: そこがちょっと気にかかってましたので。
Target_En: I was worried about that a little bit.
Translation_En: I was somewhat concerned about it.

Source_Ja: ページ数としては、10ページまでのほうが、忙しい社員の皆さんにも読んでもらえると思っています。
Target_En: As for the volume, I think 10 pages are the max since everyone is too busy to read a lot.
Translation_En: As a page number, I think you can read up to 10 pages for people who are busy.

Source_Ja: そうですね、あんまり量が多いと読む気をなくされてしまいますから。
Target_En: I agree, people would lose interest if there is too much info.
Translation_En: Oh yeah, I’m not sure you’ll get too much to read.

Source_Ja: それから、英語版も作るという話を聞いていたのですが、それは？
Target_En: I've heard about making the English version, but is it happening too?
Translation_En: I’ve heard that I’ve got an English version, but what?

Source_Ja: 現時点では、日本語版のみで、ということになりました。
Target_En: At this point, we will only do Japanese.
Translation_En: At present, it is only in Japanese version.

Source_Ja: 英語版も作るとなると、翻訳者の手配も含め時間がかかりますからね。
Target_En: If we try to make the English version, it will take more time including the time to find translators.
Translation_En: The English version will also take time to prepare a translator.

Source_Ja: まずは定期的に刊行することを目標としたいので。
Target_En: I would like to make our current goal is to publish them regularly.
Translation_En: First, I want to publish regularly.

Source_Ja: 確かに、最初から意気込み過ぎて長続きしなくなるのはよくありませんよね。
Target_En: I see, it is not good if we run out of gas by trying to do too much at the beginning.
Translation_En: Of course, it’s not good to be too excited from the beginning and not to last a long time.

Source_Ja: そうなんですよ。
Target_En: Right.
Translation_En: Yes is it.

Source_Ja: まずは、日本語を話す社員向けにニュースレターを定着させるのが優先です。
Target_En: Our priority now is to establish the existence of internal newsletters for Japanese-speaking employees.
Translation_En: First, the priority is to set newsletters for employees who speak Japanese.

Source_Ja: 研究開発部以外の皆さんが技術に興味を持ってくれるようなきっかけにしたいですね。
Target_En: I wish this could be the reason for non-R-and-D people to get more interested in technologies.
Translation_En: Other than the research and development department will be interested in technology.

Source_Ja: それによって新しい商品のアイデアも出てくると思うんですよね。
Target_En: I think people would come up with more ideas about new products because of it.
Translation_En: You will also think that the idea of a new product will come out.

Source_Ja: 営業の人たちも、技術的なトークが出来ることはプラスになると思いますし。
Target_En: It'll also be an advantage for the sales people if they can talk about technologies.
Translation_En: I think the businessman will also be able to do technical talks.

Source_Ja: 日本語版が定着し海外支社のほうから要望があれば、英語版はその時に考えましょう。
Target_En: Once the Japanese version is established and if our overseas office makes a request, we will think about the English version then.
Translation_En: If the Japanese version is fixed and there is a request from a foreign branch, consider the English version at that time.

Source_Ja: そうしましょう。
Target_En: Good idea.
Translation_En: Let us do it.

Source_Ja: ニュースレターの担当には、うちのグループの若い子を数名考えています。
Target_En: I am thinking about appointing some of younger employees in our group to work on newsletters.
Translation_En: The newspapers are thinking about a number of young people in our group.

Source_Ja: 実際のインタビューやライティングは彼らに任せます。
Target_En: I will have them do the actual interviews and writing.
Translation_En: Real interviews and lighting will be assigned to them.

Source_Ja: じゃ、田中さんは監修者ということですね。
Target_En: Then you will be the supervisor.
Translation_En: Thus, Tanja is a supervisor.

Source_Ja: そうですね。
Target_En: Exactly.
Translation_En: Yes is.

Source_Ja: では、また担当者が決まったら名前を教えてください。
Target_En: Please let me know when you pick the people.
Translation_En: Then, if you decide, tell me your name.

Source_Ja: はい、このプロジェクトうまく成功させましょう。
Target_En: Yes, let's make this project a success.
Translation_En: Let this project be successful.

Source_Ja: はい、お願いします。
Target_En: Definitely.
Translation_En: Yes please.

Source_Ja: もしもし、E社です。
Target_En: Hello, this is E Company.
Translation_En: If it is a company.

Source_Ja: もしもし、こちらG社研究開発部の森田と申します。
Target_En: Hello, this is Morita from the R and D at Company G.
Translation_En: If I do, I will say that this is the G-Research and Development Department.

Source_Ja: あ、森田さん、お世話になっております。
Target_En: Oh hi, Mr. Morita, good to hear from you.
Translation_En: Mr. Shandong, I’m going to help you.

Source_Ja: 商品開発の山田が電話を待っていたようですので、少々お待ちください。
Target_En: It looks like Yamada from the product development has been waiting for your call, so please hold.
Translation_En: The product development company Yamaha seems to have been waiting for the phone, so wait a little.

Source_Ja: はい。
Target_En: Sure.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: もしもし、森田さん、山田です。
Target_En: Hi Mr. Morita, this is Yamada.
Translation_En: If you are Yama, you are Yama.

Source_Ja: お世話になってます。
Target_En: How are you?
Translation_En: I am taking care of you.

Source_Ja: 例の商品プロトタイプの件でお電話しました。
Target_En: I am calling you regarding those product prototypes.
Translation_En: For example, I called for a prototype.

Source_Ja: あ、待ってましたよ、ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Oh, I was waiting, thank you.
Translation_En: I was waiting, thank you.

Source_Ja: それで、どんな調子ですか？
Target_En: And how do they look?
Translation_En: So how is it?

Source_Ja: 試しに２、３個作ってみましたが、いい感じです。
Target_En: We made a couple just to test out, and they look good.
Translation_En: I tried two or three, but it feels good.

Source_Ja: そうですか、それは良かった。
Target_En: Oh, that's good.
Translation_En: Yes, it was good.

Source_Ja: それで、お見せしたいと思っているのですが、こちらまでお越しいただけますでしょうか。
Target_En: So I would like to show you those, and I wonder if you could come over here.
Translation_En: So I want to show you, can you come here?

Source_Ja: あ、いいですよ。
Target_En: Of course, I can.
Translation_En: Oh, it is OK.

Source_Ja: こっちに持って来ていただくのは大変だと思うので。
Target_En: I think it will be hard for you to bring them here.
Translation_En: I think it’s hard to bring you here.

Source_Ja: そうなんですよ、結構重たいので。
Target_En: Yes, they are pretty heavy.
Translation_En: Yes, because it is very heavy.

Source_Ja: そうですよね、スペック的に無理言ってますから。
Target_En: I know, we are being unreasonable in terms of specifications.
Translation_En: Yes, I can’t say it speculatively.

Source_Ja: いえいえ、それはいいんですが。
Target_En: No no, that's not a problem.
Translation_En: No, that’s good.

Source_Ja: プロトタイプなので、移動中に壊れる可能性がありまして。
Target_En: It's just that they are only prototypes that they might break while being transported.
Translation_En: As a prototype, it is likely to be broken during the movement.

Source_Ja: あ、正式な商品じゃないから、そこまでパッケージングに力は入れてないですよね。
Target_En: Oh right, since they are not officially products yet, you have not focused on the packaging much.
Translation_En: It’s not a formal product, so you don’t have the power to pack.

Source_Ja: ええ、パッケージングはまた別枠になりますから。
Target_En: Exactly, packaging will be another matter.
Translation_En: Yes, the packaging will be another frame.

Source_Ja: じゃ、来週あたりお伺いしましょうか。
Target_En: Then I will visit you next week or so.
Translation_En: Would we ask you next week?

Source_Ja: 火曜日以外ならいつでもいいですよ。
Target_En: We are good anytime except for Tuesday.
Translation_En: Any time except Tuesday.

Source_Ja: 私のほうが月曜に予定があるので、じゃ、水曜ということで。
Target_En: I have somethng on Monday, so how about Wednesday?
Translation_En: I’m planning on Monday, so on Wednesday.

Source_Ja: いいですよ。
Target_En: It works.
Translation_En: Well is.

Source_Ja: お昼前に来ていただければ、一緒にランチミーティングも出来ますが。
Target_En: If you can come over before lunch, we can have a lunch meeting together.
Translation_En: If you come before lunch, you can also get lunch together.

Source_Ja: そうですね、久しぶりに他のエンジニアの方ともお話したいので、そうします。
Target_En: Sounds good, since I would like to talk to other engineers, I'll do that.
Translation_En: Yes, I’d like to talk to other engineers for a long time, so I’m going to do it.

Source_Ja: じゃ、10時半頃にということでいいですか？
Target_En: So is around ten thirty good?
Translation_En: Do you think it is about 10:30?

Source_Ja: ええ、お願いします。
Target_En: Yes, sure.
Translation_En: Yes please.

Source_Ja: あ、一つ忘れていましたが、今回お願いしたのとは別の商品のプロトタイプが必要となりそうなんです。
Target_En: Oh, I forgot to tell you one thing, but we might need prototypes for another product that is not the same as this one.
Translation_En: Oh, I’ve forgotten one thing, but this time I asked you would need another prototype.

Source_Ja: ほお。
Target_En: Okay?
Translation_En: and the.

Source_Ja: 来週、仕様書をお持ちしていいですか？
Target_En: Can I bring the spec for it next week?
Translation_En: Can I have a list next week?

Source_Ja: 可能かどうか見ていただけると助かるんですが。
Target_En: It would be helpful if you could tell me it's feasible or not.
Translation_En: It will help you to see if it is possible.

Source_Ja: 分かりました、お持ちください。
Target_En: I see, please bring it with you then.
Translation_En: I understand, please take it.

Source_Ja: では、そうさせていただきます。
Target_En: Will do.
Translation_En: So let me do that.

Source_Ja: 毎回無理言ってすいません。
Target_En: I apologize for being unreasonable all the time.
Translation_En: I'm sorry that I can't say every time.

Source_Ja: いいですよ、実はエンジニアたちはプロトタイプ作りを楽しみにしてるんですよね。
Target_En: Not a problem, actually engineers enjoy making prototypes.
Translation_En: Well, indeed, the engineers are looking forward to making prototypes.

Source_Ja: 商品の形が見えるのって面白いですからね。
Target_En: It is fun to see what the actual product looks like.
Translation_En: It is interesting to see the form of the product.

Source_Ja: そうですか、では来週楽しみにしています。
Target_En: Good to hear, then I will see you next week.
Translation_En: Yes, I’m looking forward to next week.

Source_Ja: こちらこそ。
Target_En: See you then.
Translation_En: This is here.

Source_Ja: もしもし、請求書について伺いたいのですが？
Target_En: Hello, I'd like to inquire about an invoice.
Translation_En: If you want to ask about the bill?

Source_Ja: 担当の者におつなぎいたしますので少々お待ち下さい。
Target_En: I will transfer you to the person in charge so please hold a moment.
Translation_En: I will contact you, so please wait a little.

Source_Ja: はい、担当の平井と申します。
Target_En: Hello, my name is Hirai and I am in charge.
Translation_En: Yes, I say that I am the pioneer.

Source_Ja: 先日送られてきた請求書のことでお伺いしたいのですが、よろしいですか？
Target_En: I'd like to ask you something in regards to an invoice that was sent a few days ago, are you okay to talk now?
Translation_En: I would like to ask you about the bill that I received last day, please?

Source_Ja: はい、請求書番号はお手元にございますか？
Target_En: Yes, do you have the invoice number in hand?
Translation_En: Do you have your bill number in your hand?

Target_En: Yes, it is 157784.
Translation_En: Yes, it is 157784.

Source_Ja: 少々お待ち下さい、はい、どうぞ。
Target_En: Please wait a bit, ok go on.
Translation_En: Please wait a little, yes, please.

Source_Ja: この二行目にあるタンクの注文ですが、型番が間違って送られてきたので、注文自体をキャンセルしたのですが。
Target_En: It's in regards to the order on the tank in the second row, and a wrong model was sent to us and I'd like to cancel the order itself.
Translation_En: The second line of the tank order, but because the type number was sent incorrectly, I cancelled the order itself.

Source_Ja: 確認いたしますので少々お待ち下さい。
Target_En: I will look into it so please hold a moment.
Translation_En: I will check you, please wait a little.

Source_Ja: 申し訳ありません、注文された型番の方を後日速達でお送りさせて頂いたようなのですが、そちらに届いておりませんか？
Target_En: I'm very sorry about that, we actually send off an expedited shipment of the model you ordered but have you received it?
Translation_En: I'm sorry, I've been sending you the ordered number later, but you don't get it to you?

Source_Ja: いや、届いたんだけど、結局必要な期日までに間に合わなかったので、オンラインでキャンセルさせて頂きました。
Target_En: Yes, it arrived but we didn't end up getting it by the date we needed it so I cancelled it online.
Translation_En: No, I got it, but I didn't get it in time, so I cancelled it online.

Source_Ja: 申し訳ありませんでした。
Target_En: I'm very sorry for the inconvenience.
Translation_En: I apologized.

Source_Ja: ではお手数ですがそちらの商品を再度こちらに返品いただけますでしょうか？
Target_En: I'm very sorry but will it be possible to return the product back to us again?
Translation_En: So, can you return your goods here again?

Source_Ja: これで二個目ですよ、こちらも忙しいのでそちらから取りに来ていただけませんか？
Target_En: This is the second time, we're busy too so can you send someone over to pick it up?
Translation_En: This is the second time I’m busy, so can you get me here?

Source_Ja: かしこまりました、こちらで郵送会社の手配をいたしますので恐れ入りますが返品の準備だけよろしくお願いします。
Target_En: Okay, I will make an arrangement with the postal office so it would be appreciated if you can prepare the return.
Translation_En: I'm sorry, I'm going to order the mailing company here, so I'm sorry, but please be ready for the return.

Source_Ja: わかりました。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: それから、新しい請求書はメールで送信していただけますか？
Target_En: Also, can you send me the new invoice by email?
Translation_En: Can I send my new invoice by email?

Source_Ja: かしこまりました。
Target_En: Of course.
Translation_En: I was stunned.

Source_Ja: それではメールアドレスの確認を再度お願いいたします。
Target_En: Please allow me to reconfirm your email.
Translation_En: Please confirm your email address again.

Source_Ja: あと、クレジットカードで支払いできますか。
Target_En: Also, can I pay by credit card?
Translation_En: Can I pay with a credit card?

Source_Ja: はい、大丈夫です。
Target_En: Yes, that won't be an issue.
Translation_En: Yes, it is okay.

Source_Ja: では返品の確認が出来次第、こちらより再度お支払いに関してのお電話を差し上げますので、よろしくお願いします。
Target_En: So once we confirm the return, I will call you once again in regards to the payment so please keep note of that.
Translation_En: So as soon as the return is confirmed, we will call you again about your payment, so please.

Source_Ja: はい、ではよろしくお願いします。
Target_En: Okay, thank you.
Translation_En: Yes, please please.

Source_Ja: 社のウェブサイトを立ち上げてはどうかと思うのですが、どう思いますか？
Target_En: I'm thinking of setting up a website for the company but what do you think?
Translation_En: I want to start the company’s website, what do you think?

Source_Ja: 近々作らなければとは思っていたんだけど、あまり詳しい者もいないようだし、後回しになっていた議題だね。
Target_En: I was just thinking that we should make one soon, but we don't have anyone that knows a lot about it and is something that we've been pushing back.
Translation_En: I thought I had to do it soon, but it seems that there are not so many people who know it, and that's what I've been talking about later.

Source_Ja: この辺は田舎だしお年寄りも多いから、まだまだ紙媒体の広告に頼りがちだけど、そろそろ作った方が良さそうだ。
Target_En: This area is rural and there are a lot of seniors so we still tend to rely on print advertisement but I think it is about time we made one.
Translation_En: This area is rural and there are many elderly people, so there is still a lot to rely on paper media advertising, but it’s better time to make it.

Source_Ja: あまり詳しくはないので、シンプルなデザインにはなると思いますが、作成してみようと思います。
Target_En: I'm not that well versed so the design will be simple but I'm thinking of trying to make one.
Translation_En: I don't know much about it, so I think it's a simple design, but I'm going to try it.

Source_Ja: そうか、頼んだよ。
Target_En: Okay, I'll leave it to you.
Translation_En: Yes, I asked you.

Source_Ja: 井上さんも手伝ってあげてくれるかい？
Target_En: Inoue-san, can you help him?
Translation_En: Would you like to help me Mr. Moore?

Source_Ja: わかりました。

Source_Ja: わかりました。

Source_Ja: それぐらいなら大丈夫だと思います。

Source_Ja: 美味しいですよ！

Source_Ja: じゃ、一杯付き合えるな。

Source_Ja: 相変わらず強引ですね、部長。

Translation_En: It’s always as hard, Mr.

Source_Ja: お前も飲むのは嫌いじゃないだろうに。

Source_Ja: 場所と相手によりますよ。

Source_Ja: ええ、喜んでください。

Source_Ja: 私は結構繊細で、人を選ぶタイプなので。
Target_En: I'm quite sensitive and particular about people.

Source_Ja: はは、俺相手にそんだけの口がきければ上等だよ、海瑠。

Source_Ja: そうですね、８年の長きに亘って。

Target_En: No one can think as positive as you do, Kiichi.

Source_Ja: お前が経営企画に引っ張られた時、あそこがエリートコースだから営業抜けさせたんだ。
Target_En: When you got promoted to the corporate planning, I let you leave the sales because you'd get into the fast lane there.
Translation_En: When you were pulled into the management project, there was the elite course, and I made it out of business.

Source_Ja: ４年で異動希望、それもマーケに出すなら、手放すんじゃなかった。
Target_En: If I knew that you were going to request a transfer in four years to marketing too, I wouldn't have let you go.

Source_Ja: はは、楽しんでいただけると思います。

Target_En: Anyway, you don't mind the soba place we used to go, do you?

Source_Ja: いいですね。

Target_En: It's okay if you go ahead, Kiichi.

Source_Ja: 了解 。

Source_Ja: 二十日くらい出てたな。

Source_Ja: もしそれが良さそうだったら、候補者リストの山に入れる。
Target_En: If that seems okay then I'll put them in the shortlist pile.

Source_Ja: やってみるよ。
Target_En: I'll give it a try.

Source_Ja: 見てみよ。

Source_Ja: わぁ、この人いいね。

Source_Ja: 彼は、輸送会社で物流コーディネーターとして働いてたって。
Target_En: He used to work at a shipping company as a logistics coordinator.

Source_Ja: どれどれ。

Source_Ja: カバーレターに変な文章があるんだよ。

Source_Ja: しかも僕より年上だ。

Source_Ja: それって気まずくならない？

Source_Ja: それはほんと、君次第だよ。

Target_En: I mean Elaine is a lot older than me.

Source_Ja: いいとこ突くね。
Target_En: Good point.
Translation_En: Good to go.

Source_Ja: 考えてみるよ。
Target_En: I'll think about it.
Translation_En: I will think.

Source_Ja: 大概は直感でしょ。
Target_En: A lot of it is about gut feeling.
Translation_En: Probably an intuition.

Source_Ja: 実際その人に一回会ったら、大抵その人が採用したい人かそうじゃないかってわかるよ。
Target_En: Once you actually meet the person, you can usually tell if this is the person you want to hire or not.
Translation_En: In fact, once you meet the person, you’ll usually know that he’s someone you want to hire.

Source_Ja: 彼らに会うのが待ちきれないよ！
Target_En: I can't wait to meet them!
Translation_En: I can’t wait to see them!

Source_Ja: まぁ、まず君の候補者リストに入らないといけないんだけどね！
Target_En: Well, they will have to get on your shortlist first though!
Translation_En: First, you have to enter your list of candidates.

Source_Ja: もしもし、Kファブリックのリッキー ライオンと申します。
Target_En: Hi, this is Ricky Lyon from K fabrics.
Translation_En: K Factory’s Ricky Lion.

Source_Ja: アヤナ ウィリアムソンさんはいらっしゃいますか？
Target_En: May I please speak to Ayana Williamson?
Translation_En: Are you here with Ariana Williamson?

Source_Ja: はい、私ですが。
Target_En: This is she.
Translation_En: Yes, but I am.

Source_Ja: 今日店舗でオーダーされた品についてお電話させて頂いています。
Target_En: I am calling about the order you placed at our store earlier today.
Translation_En: Today we call you for the goods ordered in the store.

Source_Ja: お客様が希望されていた布がバックオーダーになっていると倉庫から連絡が入りました。
Target_En: I just got a word from our warehouse that the fabric you want is actually back-ordered.
Translation_En: The customer's requested clothes were ordered back by the warehouse.

Source_Ja: バックオーダーとはどういう意味ですか？
Target_En: What does back order mean?
Translation_En: What does Back Order mean?

Source_Ja: 品物が手に入らないという事ですか？
Target_En: Am I not getting it at all?
Translation_En: Does it mean you don’t get any goods?

Source_Ja: ええっと、バックオーダーとは一時的に品切れになってしまい、オーダーが遅れてしまう事です。
Target_En: Well, back order means the item is temporarily out of order causing a delay on your order.
Translation_En: The order is temporarily terminated and the order is delayed.

Source_Ja: でも、店舗の従業員はちゃんと私のオーダーを取ってくれましたよ。
Target_En: But the store associate I saw earlier placed an order for me.
Translation_En: But the staff of the store took my order.

Source_Ja: 希望されていた品はとても需要が高いものでして。
Target_En: The particular pattern you want is in high demand.
Translation_En: The goods desired are very demanded.

Source_Ja: うちの店舗と倉庫の間できちんとコミュニケーションが取れてなかったようです。
Target_En: And obviously there was miscommunication between our store and the warehouse.
Translation_En: There was no good communication between our store and our warehouse.

Source_Ja: ご迷惑をお掛けしまして、本当に申し訳ございません。
Target_En: I am sincerely sorry for the disappointment.
Translation_En: I really apologize for your trouble.

Source_Ja: あーあ、あの布が手に入るのをとても楽しみにしていたんですよ。
Target_En: Oh no, I was really looking forward to getting the fabric.
Translation_En: I was looking forward to getting that cloth.

Source_Ja: 他のお店もすべて品切れだったんです。
Target_En: None of the other stores had it in stock either.
Translation_En: All the other stores were closed.

Source_Ja: 在庫が入るのはいつかわかりますか？
Target_En: Do you happen to know when it will be in stock?
Translation_En: Do you know when the stock will come?

Source_Ja: 倉庫のマネージャー曰く、あと一か月は入らないそうです。
Target_En: The warehouse manager believes it won't be another month or so.
Translation_En: The warehouse manager says it will not be in for a month.

Source_Ja: その間、私の方でも別の卸売業者から品を購入できないかと全力を尽くしています。
Target_En: Meanwhile, I am doing my best to source it from a different vendor for you.
Translation_En: In the meantime, I do my best to make sure I can’t buy goods from any other wholesaler.

Source_Ja: でもなかなか見つからないもので。
Target_En: But I do not have much luck.
Translation_En: But that is not quite found.

Source_Ja: 先ほど申し上げたように、人気商品の為ほとんどの店は品切れ状態のようです。
Target_En: As I mentioned already, most places have run out of them due to its popularity.
Translation_En: As previously stated, the majority of the stores for popular goods seem to be out of goods.

Source_Ja: 一か月も待てません。
Target_En: Well, I can not wait another month.
Translation_En: I don’t wait a month.

Source_Ja: 私が希望している品と似た感じのはありますか？
Target_En: Do you have any pattern that is very similar to the one I want?
Translation_En: Do you feel the same as what I want?

Source_Ja: 今手元で見本を開いているところです。
Target_En: I am actually opening up our sample book right now.
Translation_En: I am now opening the book in my hand.

Source_Ja: ターコイズが背景のペイズリー柄のものですよね？
Target_En: You wanted the paisley one with turquoise background, right?
Translation_En: Turquoise is a puzzle of the background, isn’t it?

Source_Ja: はい、柄は緑、白、紺色です。
Target_En: Yes, the patterns are green, white, and navy blue.
Translation_En: Yes, the sheets are green, white, and colorful.

Source_Ja: ほぼ同じの物が一つありますよ。
Target_En: I have one that's almost identical.
Translation_En: There is almost the same thing.

Source_Ja: 違うのは背景の色のみです。
Target_En: The only difference is the background color.
Translation_En: The difference is only the color of the background.

Source_Ja: ティール色ですが、柄の色は全く同じです。
Target_En: It's teal, but the colors of the patterns are exactly the same.
Translation_En: The colour is the same, but the colour is the same.

Source_Ja: じゃあそれをお願いします。
Target_En: Well, I would like to go ahead and get it then.
Translation_En: So please do that.

Source_Ja: 残念な事に、うちの店舗には在庫がありません。
Target_En: Unfortunately, we don't have it in stock at our store right now.
Translation_En: Unfortunately, there is no stock in our store.

Source_Ja: ですが、スライデルにある店舗にはあるそうです。
Target_En: But it seems that the store in the town, Slidell, has some.
Translation_En: There is a store in Slide.

Source_Ja: こちらへ配達して貰う事も、お客様の方で取りに行かれるのも可能です。
Target_En: I can have it delivered here or you can go pick it up yourself.
Translation_En: It is also possible that you can deliver it to your customers.

Source_Ja: ご都合の良い方をどうぞ。
Target_En: Whichever works better for you.
Translation_En: Give the good one that suits you.

Source_Ja: 自分で運転して取りに行きます。
Target_En: I think I am going to drive up there to pick it up.
Translation_En: I will drive myself and take it.

Source_Ja: 本当に申し訳ございませんでした。
Target_En: I apologize again.
Translation_En: I really apologize.

Source_Ja: またのお越しをお待ちしております。
Target_En: I hope you will consider us again for your future shopping.
Translation_En: We are waiting for your visit again.

Source_Ja: ジャック、前期は本当に良い仕事をしたわね。
Target_En: Jack, you really did an amazing job last quarter.
Translation_En: Jack, you did a really good job at the beginning.

Source_Ja: いやあ照れます。
Target_En: You flatter me.
Translation_En: No, I will light.

Source_Ja: めちゃくちゃ忙しかったですけど、なんとか終わらせました。
Target_En: It was hectic, but we made it through.
Translation_En: I was very busy, but I finished it.

Source_Ja: 本当に大変だったわね、でもよくやったわ！
Target_En: Yes it was, but you did it, and you did it well.
Translation_En: It was really hard, but I did it well!

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you for saying so.
Translation_En: Thank you.

Source_Ja: あなたは我が社のために売り上げを増やして大きな利益を出したわね。
Target_En: You brought up sales and made a huge profit for the company.
Translation_En: You have increased sales for our company and made great profits.

Source_Ja: いやあ、あなたや部の人たちのサポートがなかったらそうはいかなかったと思います。
Target_En: Well, actually if it wouldn't have had the support from you and the entire department, I cold have never done it.
Translation_En: Without the support of you and the members of the community, it would not be so.

Source_Ja: 人がよすぎるわね、ジャック
Target_En: You're too kind Jack.
Translation_En: You are too much, Jack.

Source_Ja: そういえば、良いニュースがあるのよ。
Target_En: Actually, I have some really good news.
Translation_En: In other words, there are good news.

Source_Ja: 信じられないと思うけど。
Target_En: You aren't going to believe this.
Translation_En: I think it is unbelievable.

Source_Ja: 何ですか？
Target_En: What?
Translation_En: What is?

Source_Ja: どうしたんですか？
Target_En: What's going on?
Translation_En: What happened?

Source_Ja: 取締役会があなたにボーナスを出すことに決めたのよ！
Target_En: The board has decided to give you a bonus!
Translation_En: The board has decided to give you a bonus!

Source_Ja: 本当ですか！
Target_En: What!?
Translation_En: Is it true!

Source_Ja: わあ、嬉しいです、キム。
Target_En: Oh that's great Kim.
Translation_En: I am happy, Kim.

Source_Ja: いくらなんですか？
Target_En: How much?
Translation_En: How much is it?

Target_En: 3,000 dollars.
Translation_En: Three thousand dollars.

Source_Ja: うわあ、多すぎますよ、キム。
Target_En: Oh my god, that's too much Kim.
Translation_En: It’s too much, Kim.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you so much.
Translation_En: Thank you.

Source_Ja: すごく嬉しいです。
Target_En: This is amazing.
Translation_En: I am very happy.

Source_Ja: 本当にあなたが頑張ったからよ、ジャック。
Target_En: Well, you've certainly earned it Jack!
Translation_En: You really did it, Jack.

Source_Ja: 今日は金曜日だし、みんなで出かけてお祝いしようかと思ってたんだけど。
Target_En: Say, it is Friday, I was thinking that all of us could go out and celebrate.
Translation_En: Today is Friday and we all wanted to go and celebrate it.

Source_Ja: いいですね。
Target_En: Oh yeah, for sure.
Translation_En: Well well well.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、Ａ社のバッグを取りに来ました。
Target_En: Hi there, I'm picking up some bags for Company A.
Translation_En: Hello, I came to pick up the company’s bag.

Source_Ja: お名前を伺えますか？
Target_En: Can I get your name please?
Translation_En: Can I tell your name?

Source_Ja: サム リーです。
Target_En: It's Sam Lee.
Translation_En: It is Sam Lee.

Source_Ja: 注文番号も伺っていいですか？
Target_En: Can I also get your order number?
Translation_En: Can I ask my order number?

Target_En: Yes, it is 47238.
Translation_En: Yes, it is 47238.

Source_Ja: はい、バッグはご用意できております。
Target_En: Okay, yes we have the bags ready for you.
Translation_En: The bag is ready for you.

Source_Ja: あとはグレッグがご対応させていただきます。
Target_En: I'll have Greg take care of the rest for you.
Translation_En: Then Greg will take care of you.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、サムさんですね。
Target_En: Hi there, you must be Sam.
Translation_En: Hello, you are Sam.

Source_Ja: グレッグと申します。
Target_En: I'm Greg.
Translation_En: I say Greg.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、私はＡ社のサム リーと申します。
Target_En: Hi there I'm Sam Lee from Company A.
Translation_En: Hello, I am a company of Sam Lee.

Source_Ja: 名前は存じてましたが、お顔を拝見できてよかったです。
Target_En: It's nice to put a face to the name.
Translation_En: I know your name, but I am glad to see your face.

Source_Ja: バッグはすぐに積めるように搬入デッキに用意してあります。
Target_En: So I have your bags ready for loading at the loading bay.
Translation_En: The bag is ready to be charged immediately.

Source_Ja: 向かう前にこの請求書にサインをお願いします。
Target_En: Before we head out, can you just sign this invoice?
Translation_En: Please sign this invoice before you go.

Source_Ja: いいですよ。
Target_En: Yes I can.
Translation_En: Well is.

Source_Ja: はい、では向かいましょう。
Target_En: Okay, let's head out now.
Translation_En: Yes, let’s go toward.

Source_Ja: バッグはかなり重いのでそちらの車に積むのに小型フォークリフトを使いますね。
Target_En: So the bags are pretty heavy so I will use a small forklift to load it into your car.
Translation_En: The bag is quite heavy, so you can use a small forklift to charge your car.

Source_Ja: どちらの車ですか？
Target_En: Which car is yours?
Translation_En: Which car is it?

Source_Ja: あそこの黒いSUVです。
Target_En: It's the black SUV over there.
Translation_En: There is a black SUV.

Source_Ja: わかりました、トランクを開けていただけますか？
Target_En: Alright, can you open the trunk?
Translation_En: Can I open my bag?

Source_Ja: フォークリフトでバッグを運んで、直接積みます。
Target_En: I'll bring the bags over with the forklift and directly load it in.
Translation_En: Carry the bag in the forklift and charge it directly.

Source_Ja: もちろんです。
Target_En: Sure.
Translation_En: of course.

Source_Ja: どうもありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you very much.
Translation_En: Thank you very much.

Source_Ja: もしもし。
Target_En: Hello.
Translation_En: if if if.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、シアトル事務所のサム リーです。
Target_En: Hi, this is Sam Lee from the Seattle office.
Translation_En: Hello, I am Sam Lee from the Seattle office.
