Source_Ja: あら、こんにちは。
Target_En: Oh, hello there.
Translation_En: Hello and Hello.

Source_Ja: リスクアセスメントレポートを取り寄せてもらえないかと思って。
Target_En: I was wondering if you can get me a risk assessment report.
Translation_En: I think you can get a risk assessment report.

Source_Ja: もちろんです。
Target_En: Of course.
Translation_En: of course.

Source_Ja: その会社の詳細を送ってもらえますか？
Target_En: Can you send me the details of the company?
Translation_En: Can you send me the details of the company?

Source_Ja: はい、送れます。
Target_En: Yes I can.
Translation_En: Yes I can send it.

Source_Ja: どういった情報がそちらで必要か教えてください。
Target_En: Can you tell me what information I need to give you?
Translation_En: Tell me what information you need there.

Source_Ja: レポートを取り寄せるためには、会社名、住所、電話番号、そしてウェブサイトが必要です。
Target_En: So in order to get the report, I'll need the company name, address, phone number, and website
Translation_En: The report requires company name, address, telephone number, and website.

Source_Ja: それだけですか？
Target_En: Will that be it?
Translation_En: Is it all that?

Source_Ja: はい、これで全部です。
Target_En: Yes, that will be it.
Translation_En: Yes, this is all.

Source_Ja: わかりました、今送りますね。
Target_En: Okay, I will send that over right now.
Translation_En: I know, I will send you now.

Source_Ja: レポートを取り寄せるのにどのくらいの時間がかかりますか？
Target_En: How long will it take to get the report?
Translation_En: How long will it take to get a report?

Source_Ja: ２、３日かかると思います。
Target_En: I think it will take a few days.
Translation_En: I think it will take two or three days.

Source_Ja: レポートが届いたらご連絡します。
Target_En: I'll let you know once I get the report.
Translation_En: We will contact you when we receive the report.

Source_Ja: それはよかった、どうもありがとうございます。
Target_En: Great, thank you very much.
Translation_En: It was good, thank you.

Source_Ja: 連絡をお待ちしています。
Target_En: I'll look forward to hearing from you.
Translation_En: We are waiting for your contact.

Source_Ja: ではよろしくお願いします。
Target_En: Have a good one.
Translation_En: So please please.

Source_Ja: ではまた。
Target_En: Bye now.
Translation_En: and again.

Source_Ja: おはよう、健さん。
Target_En: Good morning, Mr. Ken.
Translation_En: Good Morning Mr. Kane.

Source_Ja: おはよう、スティーブ。
Target_En: Good morning, Steve.
Translation_En: Good morning Steve.

Source_Ja: 君をデスクに案内したあと、オフィスのツアーをしようか。
Target_En: Let me take you to your work desk and then I will give you a tour of the office.
Translation_En: Do you want to take a trip to the office after I’ll take you to the desk?

Source_Ja: スティーブ、ここが君のデスクで、仕事は毎朝8時から5時までだよ。
Target_En: Here is your desk and work starts from 8am to 5pm every day, Steve.
Translation_En: Steve, this is your desk and work is every morning from 8:00 to 5:00.

Source_Ja: わあ、とても素敵ですね！
Target_En: Oh, very nice!
Translation_En: Oh, you are so nice!

Source_Ja: 荷物はここに置いて、行こうか。
Target_En: Drop your belongings here, and let’s go!
Translation_En: Keep your baggage here and go.

Source_Ja: はい、準備できました、健さん。
Target_En: OK, I am ready Mr. Ken.
Translation_En: You are ready, Mr. Kane.

Source_Ja: あそこにいるのが上級金融アナリストのスージーだ。
Target_En: That is Suzy over there and is our senior financial analyst.
Translation_En: There is a senior financial analyst.

Source_Ja: 今後彼女と一緒に仕事するようになるから挨拶しにいこう。
Target_En: You will be working with her in the future so let’s go say hi to her.
Translation_En: I’m going to work with her so I’m going to say goodbye to you.

Source_Ja: スージー、うちの部に新しく加わったスティーブだ。
Target_En: Suzy, this is Steve, our department’s new addition.
Translation_En: Steve, the new one to join us.

Source_Ja: ようこそ、スティーブ。
Target_En: Welcome on board, Steve.
Translation_En: Welcome to Steve.

Source_Ja: はじめまして！
Target_En: I am very glad to see you!
Translation_En: Congratulated to!

Source_Ja: ここで働くことができてとても光栄です。
Target_En: I am very happy to be here.
Translation_En: It is a great honor to be able to work here.

Source_Ja: 助けが必要な時は知らせてね。
Target_En: Just let me know whenever you need me.
Translation_En: Tell me when you need help.

Source_Ja: 喜んでアドバイスするから。
Target_En: I am glad to be of any assistance.
Translation_En: I am glad to advise.

Source_Ja: 何がどこにあるか分かるよう、スティーブにオフィスのツアーをしてるんだ。
Target_En: I am giving Steve a tour of the office so that he knows his way around.
Translation_En: I’m going to go to Steve’s office to find out where he is.

Source_Ja: そう、あ、健、自動販売機がどこにあるか教えてあげて。
Target_En: Ok, oh and please do teach him where the vending machines are located Ken.
Translation_En: Oh yeah, tell me where the automatic sales machine is.

Source_Ja: じゃあまた、スティーブ！
Target_En: See you later, Steve!
Translation_En: And then again, Steve!

Source_Ja: はい、スージーさん。
Target_En: OK, Suzy.
Translation_En: Yes Mr. Susi

Source_Ja: 廊下の突き当りが製造エリアだ。
Target_En: At the end of the hallway is the Production area.
Translation_En: The corridors are a manufacturing area.

Source_Ja: うちの会社の70パーセントの商品がこの施設で作られていて、それ以外は全て海外のもっと小さな製造施設で製造しているんだ。
Target_En: Seventy percent of our merchandise is produced right here in this facility and we also have one smaller manufacturing facility overseas that handles the rest of the production.
Translation_En: 70 percent of our company’s goods are manufactured in this facility and all other are manufactured in smaller manufacturing facilities abroad.

Source_Ja: 君は製造マネージャーのジョンとやりとりすることになるよ。
Target_En: You will be dealing with John, the Production manager.
Translation_En: You will be working with the manufacturing manager John.

Source_Ja: 今彼はミーティング中だから、後から紹介するよ。
Target_En: I will introduce you to him later because he is in a meeting at the moment.
Translation_En: He is at the meeting, so I will present him later.

Source_Ja: はい、その方の名前覚えておきます。
Target_En: Right, I need to remember that name.
Translation_En: Yes, I remember his name.

Source_Ja: 面接で言ったように、毎日の仕事の一環として、君には銀行とやりとりしてうちの資金の記録をとってもらいたいんだ。
Target_En: Like I said during the interview, one of your daily jobs is to deal with the bank to keep track of our financial resources.
Translation_En: As I said in the interview, as part of your daily job, I want you to deal with the bank and take a record of our funds.

Source_Ja: 毎朝インターネットで会社のアカウントにアクセスして、金融データを確認してほしい。
Target_En: Every morning, you will access our account through the Internet to get financial information.
Translation_En: You need to access your company’s account on the Internet every morning to check your financial data.

Source_Ja: ログインとパスワードが必要になりますよね？
Target_En: I should have a login and password, right?
Translation_En: You need login and password, right?

Source_Ja: ああ、僕から銀行に電話して君が新しい従業員だと伝えておくよ。
Target_En: Yes, I will call our bank and inform them that you are our new employee.
Translation_En: I’ll call the bank and tell you that you’re a new employee.

Source_Ja: 次の仕事は海外に電話して必要な情報を得ることだ。
Target_En: Your next task is to call overseas to get other necessary information.
Translation_En: The next job is to call abroad and get the necessary information.

Source_Ja: 海外オフィスからどういった情報が必要なんですか？
Target_En: What kind of data do I need to get from our people overseas?
Translation_En: What information do you need from a foreign office?

Source_Ja: 彼らの現在と未来のプロジェクトの金融データだよ。
Target_En: You will need financial data about their current and future projects.
Translation_En: The financial data of their present and future projects.

Source_Ja: 僕が提供すべき情報はありますか？
Target_En: Do they need any information from me?
Translation_En: Do I have any information to provide?

Source_Ja: ああ、君が彼らと一緒に予算を決めないといけないから、その情報をファックスかメールで送って、話をする必要がある場合は出社してすぐに電話しないといけない。
Target_En: Yes, you need to work with them on their budgets so you can fax or e-mail them the information and if you need to talk to them, call them as soon as you get in.
Translation_En: Oh, you have to decide your budget with them, so you have to send the information by fax or e-mail and, if you need to talk, go out and call them immediately.

Source_Ja: 向こうは8時間進んでるから。
Target_En: Remember that they are eight hours ahead of us.
Translation_En: There is eight hours ahead.

Source_Ja: 君と僕が毎週の終わりに見直しできるように、各海外プロジェクトに関するファイルを作ってくれるかな。
Target_En: Make sure that you create a file for each overseas project so you and I can review them at the end of every week.
Translation_En: You and I can make a file about each project abroad so that we can review it at the end of each week.

Source_Ja: 初めのうちは、僕と一緒にもっと頻繁に見直してもらえますか？
Target_En: In the beginning, can you review the files with me more often?
Translation_En: Can you get to see me more often at the beginning?

Source_Ja: 仕事を正しくやっているかを確認したいので。
Target_En: I just want to make sure that I do my job correctly.
Translation_En: I want to make sure you are doing the job right.

Source_Ja: いいとも、質問があればいつでもどうぞ。
Target_En: Yes, come see me whenever you have questions.
Translation_En: If you have any questions, please go anytime.

Source_Ja: 会社辞めちゃうなんて、信じられない。
Target_En: I can't believe that you're leaving us.
Translation_En: I can’t believe that the company will leave.

Source_Ja: そう、ここに君がいないと変な感じになるだろうね。
Target_En: Yeah, it will be very weird without you here.
Translation_En: It would be strange without you here.

Source_Ja: 私も、こんなに早くこうなるとは思ってなかったわ。
Target_En: I didn't expect that this will happen so soon.
Translation_En: I didn’t think that would happen so quickly.

Source_Ja: でも、君の人生だからね。
Target_En: Well, it's your life.
Translation_En: Because of your life.

Source_Ja: やってみたらいいわよ。
Target_En: You should go for it.
Translation_En: Let me try it.

Source_Ja: そうよね？
Target_En: Why not?
Translation_En: Yes not?

Source_Ja: 正直、僕だったら君のやることはできないと思うな。
Target_En: Honestly, I don't think I could do what you are doing.
Translation_En: To be honest, don’t think you can’t do it.

Source_Ja: 外国に引っ越すっていう意味？
Target_En: You mean moving to a different country?
Translation_En: Does it mean to move abroad?

Source_Ja: もちろんそれもそうだけど。
Target_En: Of course there's that.
Translation_En: Of course that too.

Source_Ja: 自分の本当の夢を追うためにこんな大企業を去るってこと。
Target_En: I mean leaving this big company to pursue your real dream.
Translation_En: Leaving such a big company to pursue your real dreams.

Source_Ja: そうね、私もこのことは夫とたくさん話し合わなければならなかったわ。
Target_En: I know, I had to argue a lot with my husband about this.
Translation_En: I had to talk a lot about this with my husband.

Source_Ja: ねえ、スペシャル・カクテルはもう飲んだ？
Target_En: Hey, did you try the special cocktail?
Translation_En: Have you already drunk the cocktail?

Source_Ja: あなたのために、特別に注文してあげたわよ。
Target_En: I ordered it just for you.
Translation_En: I ordered it specifically for you.

Source_Ja: 私のためにパーティーを計画してくれて、ありがとう。
Target_En: Thank you for organizing this party for me.
Translation_En: Thank you for planning a party for me.

Source_Ja: 君のためなら当然だよ。
Target_En: You totally deserve this.
Translation_En: It is natural for you.

Source_Ja: どうせみんな、パーティーは大好きだしね。
Target_En: We love parties anyway.
Translation_En: Everyone loves the party.

Source_Ja: 職場でできるときは、特にね。
Target_En: Especially when we can have it right where we work.
Translation_En: Especially when you are at work.

Source_Ja: 私みんなの分もカクテルもらってきてあげる。
Target_En: Let me go and grab some cocktails for you guys.
Translation_En: I will give you a cocktail for everyone.

Source_Ja: 何か食べ物もほしい？
Target_En: Do you want something to eat, too?
Translation_En: Do you want some food?

Source_Ja: 私そんなにおなか空いていない。
Target_En: I'm not that hungry.
Translation_En: I am not so hungry.

Source_Ja: えー、何かきっとほしくなるわよ、そうしないと今夜飲めないわよ。
Target_En: Oh, trust me, you will need something otherwise you can't drink tonight.
Translation_En: I’m sure I’ll want something, otherwise I can’t drink it tonight.

Source_Ja: 分かった、じゃああなたが好きなのなんでもいいからお願い。
Target_En: Alright, just bring me anything you like.
Translation_En: I know what you like, please.

Source_Ja: すぐ戻るね！
Target_En: I will be right back!
Translation_En: We will come back soon!

Source_Ja: 新しい仕事は、楽しみ？
Target_En: Are you excited about your new job?
Translation_En: Are you delighted with new jobs?

Source_Ja: よく分かんない。
Target_En: I'm not sure.
Translation_En: I do not know well.

Source_Ja: いいことも悪いこともありそうな気がして。
Target_En: I think there will be some good points and bad.
Translation_En: I feel good or bad.

Source_Ja: そうだね、でも本当、よかったじゃない。
Target_En: Yeah, I'm really happy for you though.
Translation_En: Yes, but it was really good.

Source_Ja: ここで働いているから何不自由ないと、周りには思われているけれど、実際はそうじゃないからね。
Target_En: People think that we have everything just because we work here, but you know that's not true.
Translation_En: I think it’s hard to work around, but it’s not really so.

Source_Ja: ありがとう、そう言ってくれて。
Target_En: Thanks for saying that.
Translation_En: Thank you, tell me that.

Source_Ja: ただ、これからもときどき俺たちに近況報告するのは忘れないでね。
Target_En: Just don't forget to let us know how you're doing now and then.
Translation_En: Do not forget to report to us from time to time.

Source_Ja: 幸いインターネットがあるから、ね。
Target_En: Thank goodness we have internet, right?
Translation_En: Fortunately there is internet.

Source_Ja: うん、インターネットがあれば、世界は狭いから。
Target_En: Yes, it's a small world with internet.
Translation_En: If there is internet, the world is small.

Source_Ja: ぜひ遊びに来てね、私がインドにいるうちに。
Target_En: You should come and visit me while I'm in India.
Translation_En: I want you to go here while I am in India.

Source_Ja: ぜひ行きたいよ。
Target_En: I would love to visit.
Translation_En: I want to go.

Source_Ja: 私もその旅行、一緒に行っていい？
Target_En: Can I join for that trip, too?
Translation_En: Can I go on this trip with me?

Source_Ja: はい、食べ物と飲み物よ。
Target_En: Here's your food and drinks.
Translation_En: Yes, food and drinks.

Source_Ja: ありがとう。
Target_En: Thanks so much.
Translation_En: thank you.

Source_Ja: おいしそう。
Target_En: This looks amazing.
Translation_En: It is delicious.

Source_Ja: どうも皆さん、おはようございます。
Target_En: Hello everyone, and good morning.
Translation_En: Thank you guys, good morning.

Source_Ja: 皆さん既にご存知のように、本会計年度、弊社は赤字です。
Target_En: As you all know by now, the company is in the red for this fiscal year.
Translation_En: As you already know, in this financial year, the company has a deficit.

Source_Ja: それに伴って、皆さんに悪いお知らせがあります。
Target_En: Because of this, I have some bad news.
Translation_En: In addition, we have a bad news for you.

Source_Ja: 残念ながら今年の休暇中のボーナスが減額されることになりました。
Target_En: Unfortunately, we will be reducing our usual holiday bonuses for this year.
Translation_En: Unfortunately, this year’s holiday bonus will be reduced.

Source_Ja: 経理部よりボーナス減額が必要との知らせが入り、どうも私たちはどうすることもできないようです。
Target_En: The financial department has notified me that this is necessary, and it seems like there is nothing much we can do about it.
Translation_En: The accounting department has been informed that we need a bonus reduction, so we don’t think we can do anything.

Source_Ja: どのくらいの減額になるのでしょうか。
Target_En: How much of a reduction are we talking about?
Translation_En: How much will it be reduced?

Source_Ja: 今年のボーナスは、20％の減額になります。
Target_En: There will be a 20% cut to this year's holiday bonuses.
Translation_En: This year’s bonus will be reduced by 20%.

Source_Ja: それに加えて、２ヶ月後にボーナスが支払われることになります。
Target_En: Also bonuses will be paid in two months.
Translation_En: In addition, the bonus will be paid after two months.

Source_Ja: ただ、一時解雇は無いのでご留意ください。
Target_En: But please be aware that there will be no layoffs.
Translation_En: Please note that there is no temporary dismissal.

Source_Ja: それは良かったです。
Target_En: That is good to hear, I guess.
Translation_En: That was good.

Source_Ja: 他に何か支出削減はありますか。
Target_En: Will there be any other spending cuts?
Translation_En: Is there any other cost reduction?

Source_Ja: はい、実はあります。
Target_En: Actually, yes there will be.
Translation_En: Yes, it is actually there.

Source_Ja: 弊社は追って通知があるまでは、すべての出張を一時中断します。
Target_En: Our company will be suspending all business travel temporarily until further notice.
Translation_En: We will interrupt all trips until there is a notification.

Source_Ja: なるほど、それはいつから有効になる事ですか。
Target_En: I see, when will this go into effect?
Translation_En: So, when will it be effective?

Source_Ja: 即時です。
Target_En: This is effective immediately.
Translation_En: It is immediately.

Source_Ja: ですから、もし出張予定が有りましたらキャンセルをお願い致します。
Target_En: So please cancel any travel plans you may have in the near future.
Translation_En: If there is a plan for a trip, please cancel it.

Source_Ja: それはとても不利ですね。
Target_En: This is rather inconvenient.
Translation_En: It is very negative, right?

Source_Ja: 本当にそうですよね。
Target_En: Yes, it certainly is.
Translation_En: It really is so, right?

Source_Ja: 実は私たちは二月に台湾のB社を訪れる予定があったのです。
Target_En: Actually, we had plans to visit Company B in Taiwan in February.
Translation_En: In fact, we were scheduled to visit Taiwan’s B company in February.

Source_Ja: 彼らは昨年からとても大事なビジネスパートナーでした。
Target_En: They've been valuable business partners over the past year.
Translation_En: They have been a very important business partner since last year.

Source_Ja: 彼らとのミーティングをキャンセルせざるをえないのは、とても残念です。
Target_En: It's unfortunate I will have to cancel this meeting with them.
Translation_En: It is unfortunate that we can cancel the meeting with them.

Source_Ja: そうですね、この支出削減が短い期間だといいのですが。
Target_En: Well, we hope these funding cuts will only be for a short term.
Translation_En: Hopefully this cost decrease will be a short time.

Source_Ja: また何か情報が入り次第、皆さんと共有致します。
Target_En: I will notify you all as soon as I have any more information.
Translation_En: We will share with you as soon as you get some information.

Source_Ja: 皆さんにご迷惑をおかけして大変申し訳ございません。
Target_En: Apologies to everyone for the inconvenience.
Translation_En: I am sorry to bother you all.

Source_Ja: 承知いたしました、良いニュースが入るのを楽しみにしています。
Target_En: Ok, hope to hear a good news from you soon.
Translation_En: I know, I am looking forward to the good news.

Source_Ja: 加藤さん、こんばんは。
Target_En: Hello Mr. Kato, good evening.
Translation_En: Mr. Katowice, hello to me.

Source_Ja: こんばんは、荒木さん。
Target_En: Good evening Mr. Araki.
Translation_En: Good afternoon, Mr. Dress.

Source_Ja: 知っているとは思うけど、年に二回各社員の評価をする為に面談をしているんだ。
Target_En: As you know, we have meetings twice per year to review the performance of each employee.
Translation_En: I know, but I do interviews twice a year to evaluate each employee.

Source_Ja: この五日間で君の課内の全ての社員と面談をする予定なんだ。
Target_En: We are planning to meet with all of the employees in your department over the next five days.
Translation_En: I am planning to interview all of your staff in the past five days.

Source_Ja: そうなんですね。
Target_En: I see.
Translation_En: Yes is.

Source_Ja: 緊張する必要はないよ。
Target_En: There is no need to be nervous.
Translation_En: You don’t need to be nervous.

Source_Ja: では始めようか。
Target_En: Shall we get started?
Translation_En: So let’s start.

Source_Ja: はい、お願いします。
Target_En: Yes, please continue.
Translation_En: Yes please.

Source_Ja: わかった。
Target_En: Okay sure.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: 最近同僚との関係はどうだい？
Target_En: So how is your relationship with your coworkers lately?
Translation_En: What about your relationship with your colleagues recently?

Source_Ja: 同僚とは協力し合えていると思います。
Target_En: I feel that I cooperate well with my coworkers.
Translation_En: I think we are working together with our colleagues.

Source_Ja: 私はオフィスの皆とコミュニケーションを取ってよく意見を共有しあったりしています。
Target_En: I communicate with everybody in my office, and we regularly share ideas between each other.
Translation_En: I often communicate with all of my offices and share my opinion.

Source_Ja: 何か言っておきたい同僚との問題はある？
Target_En: Are there any issues with coworkers you’d like to mention?
Translation_En: Do you have any problems with your colleagues?

Source_Ja: いえ、特にないです。
Target_En: No, none at all.
Translation_En: No, not especially.

Source_Ja: 皆とても親切で面倒見が良いんです。
Target_En: Everybody is very friendly and helpful.
Translation_En: Everyone is very friendly and careful.

Source_Ja: それは良かった。
Target_En: That's good to hear.
Translation_En: It was good.

Source_Ja: 同僚間で協力することを勧めているいるからね。
Target_En: We encourage collaboration between coworkers.
Translation_En: I encourage you to collaborate with colleagues.

Source_Ja: 過去６ヶ月の自分の実績には満足しているかい？
Target_En: Have you been happy with your personal performance over the past 6 months?
Translation_En: Are you satisfied with your achievements in the last six months?

Source_Ja: はい、最近では上手くいっていると思います。
Target_En: Yes, I feel that I have been doing well lately.
Translation_En: Yes, I think it’s going well recently.

Source_Ja: 2年間この会社で働いてきましたし仕事にも慣れました。
Target_En: I've been with the company for two years and I've got used to my job.
Translation_En: I have been working in this company for two years and I have become accustomed to work.

Source_Ja: それにこの６ヶ月間は、社外でエクセルのクラスを取り続けてきました。
Target_En: Also over the past six months I've been taking classes outside of work to learn excel.
Translation_En: Over the past six months, I have continued to take Excel classes outside the company.

Source_Ja: そのおかげで効率よく仕事が進むようになり新しい情報を同僚に共有しています。
Target_En: This has helped improve my efficiency at work and I'm sharing my new information with my coworkers.
Translation_En: Thanks to this, the work progresses effectively and we share new information with our colleagues.

Source_Ja: そっか、クラスを取ってることはとても素晴らしいね。
Target_En: I see, that's great that you are taking these classes.
Translation_En: It’s great to have a class there.

Source_Ja: そのインフォメーションがオフィスの役に立ってることは確かだよ。
Target_En: I'm sure that information is helpful to the whole office.
Translation_En: This information is helpful for the office.

Source_Ja: 何か自分の弱点や将来改善していきたい点はあるかい？
Target_En: Do you have any weaknesses or things you'd like to improve on in the future?
Translation_En: Do you want to improve your weaknesses or future?

Source_Ja: 期日に間に合わなかったり短い期間でやらなければない事がたくさんあるとストレスが溜まってしまうんです。
Target_En: Well, often I get stressed if I miss a deadline or if I have too much work to do in a short amount of time.
Translation_En: There are a lot of things you don’t have to do in time or in a short period of time.

Source_Ja: ストレスと上手く付き合っていくことが私の課題かと思います。
Target_En: Managing my stress better is definitely something I would like to work on.
Translation_En: I think it’s my challenge to get along with stress.

Source_Ja: そうだね、ストレス管理をする事は大切だね。
Target_En: Yes, managing stress is important.
Translation_En: Yes, it is important to manage stress.

Source_Ja: 実は僕職場でのストレス管理についての本を持っているんだ。
Target_En: Actually, I have a book on managing stress in the workplace.
Translation_En: I have a book about stress management at work.

Source_Ja: もしかしたら君の役にたつかもよ。
Target_En: It may be helpful to you.
Translation_En: Maybe it will help you.

Source_Ja: 明日僕のオフィスに来てくれれば貸してあげるよ。
Target_En: Why don’t you stop by my office tomorrow and I'll lend it to you.
Translation_En: If you come to my office tomorrow, I will borrow you.

Source_Ja: 嬉しいです、ありがとうございます。
Target_En: That would be great, thank you so much!
Translation_En: I am happy, thank you.

Source_Ja: もちろん。
Target_En: No problem at all.
Translation_En: of course.

Source_Ja: 最後に一つだけ質問するよ。
Target_En: Ok, I have one final question.
Translation_En: I will ask you only one question in the end.

Source_Ja: 何かA社での勤務についての悩みや質問はあるかね？
Target_En: Do you have any concerns about working here at Company A, or any questions for me?
Translation_En: Do you have any questions or concerns about your job?

Source_Ja: 特にないです。
Target_En: No I don't.
Translation_En: Not especially.

Source_Ja: ここで働くのを楽しんでいるので長い間勤務できたら良いなと考えています。
Target_En: I enjoy working here and hope I can stay for a long time.
Translation_En: I am delighted to work here, so I hope you can work for a long time.

Source_Ja: そう言ってくれると嬉しいよ！
Target_En: That's great to hear!
Translation_En: I am glad you tell me that!

Source_Ja: 時間を取ってくれてありがとう、デスクに戻っていいよ。
Target_En: Well, thank you for your time, you can go back to your desk now.
Translation_En: Thank you for taking time, I can go back to the desk.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you.
Translation_En: Thank you.

Source_Ja: ビクター、何をしてるの？
Target_En: Hey Victor, what are you working on?
Translation_En: Victor, what are you doing?

Source_Ja: 先週から退職貯蓄の設定をしてるんだよ。
Target_En: I've been setting up my retirement from the past week.
Translation_En: I have set up retirement savings since last week.

Source_Ja: 君はどう設定した？
Target_En: How do you have your savings for retirement set up?
Translation_En: How did you set up?

Source_Ja: 僕は全部A社の株に投資してるよ。
Target_En: All of mine is invested into Company A stock.
Translation_En: I’m investing in all of the company’s shares.

Source_Ja: A社は給与の4％までの貯蓄分には同額を補助してくれるから。
Target_En: Company A matches everything that we put in up to four percent.
Translation_En: The company will provide the same amount of savings up to 4% of its salary.

Source_Ja: ビクター、君はどうしてるの？
Target_En: How about you, Victor?
Translation_En: Victor, what do you do?

Source_Ja: うん、幾らかはA社の株に行くようにしてるよ。
Target_En: Yes, some of mine goes into Company A stock.
Translation_En: Yes, some of them are going to the company’s shares.

Source_Ja: ただ、自社株だけに投資したせいで、退職後の夢に敗れてしまった人々は沢山いるからね。
Target_En: However, many people have watched their retirement dreams disappear because they invested only in the company stock of their employer.
Translation_En: Just because they invested in their own shares, there are many people who lost their dreams after retirement.

Source_Ja: そういうわけで今調整しているところなんだよ。
Target_En: That's why I've been working on mine.
Translation_En: That’s why you’re adjusting it now.

Source_Ja: 君も分散させたほうがいいよ。
Target_En: You've got to diversify, Tim.
Translation_En: You should also disperse it.

Source_Ja: だけどお金は個人的な事じゃないか。
Target_En: Well, I think money is a very personal matter.
Translation_En: But money is personal.

Source_Ja: それに口出ししようっていうの？
Target_En: Are you trying to get into my business?
Translation_En: Are you trying to speak out?

Source_Ja: いやいや、そうじゃないよ。
Target_En: No, no, no, not at all.
Translation_En: No No No No No No No No.

Source_Ja: 気をつけたほうがいいよって言いたかっただけだよ、ティム。
Target_En: I'm just looking out for you, Tim.
Translation_En: I just wanted to say you should be careful, Tim.

Source_Ja: ほとんどの人が君と同じようにするけど、長期的にみると効率よくないからさ。
Target_En: Most people do exactly what you do, but in the long term, it doesn't make sense.
Translation_En: Most people do the same as you, but in the long run it’s not effective.

Source_Ja: 僕もそうしてたんだけど、色々調べ始めたんだよ。
Target_En: I was doing it too, but I started doing some research.
Translation_En: I did so, but I started to investigate a lot.

Source_Ja: そうか、じゃあどうしたらいいの？
Target_En: Well then, what do you suggest?
Translation_En: Yes, then what should I do?

Source_Ja: いいかい、もしA社が失敗したら株の価値はなくなって全てを失うことになるだろ？
Target_En: Here's the thing, if Company A fails, we lose everything and the stock will be worthless.
Translation_En: If a company fails, the stock will not be worth and you will lose everything.

Source_Ja: ターゲットデート・ミューチュアルファンドがいいよ。
Target_En: Go with a target-date mutual fund.
Translation_En: You have a target dating mutual fund.

Source_Ja: 何それ？
Target_En: What's that?
Translation_En: What is that?

Source_Ja: 株や債券やその他の投資を組み合わせたファンドだよ。
Target_En: It's a fund holds a mix of stocks, bonds, and other investments.
Translation_En: A combination of shares, bonds and other investments.

Source_Ja: 投資戦略に合わせて、時間が経つにつれてその組み合わせが徐々に変わっていくんだ。
Target_En: Over time, the mix gradually shifts according to the fund's investment strategy.
Translation_En: In line with the investment strategy, the combination will gradually change over time.

Source_Ja: ターゲットデートファンドは特定の退職日が頭にある人のためにデザインされた長期投資ファンドだよ。
Target_En: Target date funds are designed to be long-term investments for individuals with particular retirement dates in mind.
Translation_En: Target Dating Fund is a long-term investment fund designed for those who have a specific retirement date in mind.

Source_Ja: へえ、調べてみよう。
Target_En: Wow, I'll have to check it out.
Translation_En: Well, let’s check it.

Source_Ja: 自分でやってるの、それとも会計士を雇った？
Target_En: Do you do that by yourself, or did you hire an accountant?
Translation_En: Do you do it yourself or do you hire an accountant?

Source_Ja: 自分でやってるよ。
Target_En: I've been doing it myself.
Translation_En: I do it myself.

Source_Ja: おはようございます、こちら倉庫担当のハリーですが、どのようなご用件ですか？
Target_En: Good morning, this is Harry from the warehouse, how may I help you?
Translation_En: Good morning, here is the store manager Harry, but what do you do?

Source_Ja: おはようございます、ハリーさん、こちらマーケティング部のチャーリーです。
Target_En: Good morning Harry, this is Charlie from the Marketing department.
Translation_En: Good Morning, Mr. Harry, here is Charlie from the marketing department.

Source_Ja: 新年のカレンダーが届いたかどうか知りたいのですが。
Target_En: I would like to know whether the new year calendar has arrived or not?
Translation_En: I want to know if the new year’s calendar has arrived.

Source_Ja: 申し訳ないです、メールにも書いた通り、新年のカレンダーが届くのは遅れるかもしれません。
Target_En: I'm sorry, as I wrote in the email the new year calendar might arrive late.
Translation_En: Sorry, as I wrote in the email, the new year’s calendar may be late.

Source_Ja: あらら、じゃ、うちのオフィスにはいつ納品されますか？
Target_En: Oh, so when it will be delivered to our office?
Translation_En: When will we be delivered to our office?

Source_Ja: 業者によると一月の頭ごろには届くということです。
Target_En: Our vendor said it will be delivered around early January.
Translation_En: According to the provider, it will arrive in the beginning of January.

Source_Ja: カレンダーが届いたらお電話いただけますか？
Target_En: Would you please call me later when the calendar arrive?
Translation_En: Can I call you when the calendar arrives?

Source_Ja: もちろん、そうします。
Target_En: Sure, I will.
Translation_En: Of course, I will do that.

Source_Ja: 確認のためですが、200部注文されましたよね？
Target_En: Just to make sure, you ordered 200 pieces right?
Translation_En: I’ve been ordering 200 pieces, right?

Source_Ja: ええ、そうです。
Target_En: Yes, that's right.
Translation_En: Yes yes yes.

Source_Ja: 分かりました、あと、カレンダーは業者から一括してではなく、幾つかのバッチに分けて送られる予定だということもお伝えしておきますね。
Target_En: Okay, I would also like to tell you that our vendor will not send the calendar to your office at once, but divided into several batches.
Translation_En: I know, then I will tell you that the calendar will not be shared by the supplier, but will be distributed into several bats.

Source_Ja: なので、200部注文されたとしたら、まず50部ほどお渡しできます。
Target_En: So, maybe if you ordered 200 pieces, I can give you around 50 pieces at first.
Translation_En: If you have ordered 200 pieces, you can first deliver 50 pieces.

Source_Ja: それから、次の日に業者からまた送られてきたら、さらに50部お渡しできます。
Target_En: And then, if our vendor send it again the next day, I can give you another 50 calendars.
Translation_En: Then, if you get sent again from the supplier the next day, you can deliver another 50 pieces.

Source_Ja: これは、全国の支社にもカレンダーを届ける必要があるからなんです。
Target_En: This is because we also need to deliver the calendar to our branch offices throughout the country.
Translation_En: This is because it is necessary to deliver calendar to the country’s branches.

Source_Ja: それに、支社に届ける時間が必要なので。
Target_En: And we need time for delivery to our branch offices.
Translation_En: It also takes time to deliver to the company.

Source_Ja: はい、分かりました。
Target_En: Okay, I understand that.
Translation_En: Yes, I understand it.

Source_Ja: とにかくカレンダーが用意できたら教えてください。
Target_En: Just please inform me when the calendars are ready.
Translation_En: Please tell me if the calendar is available.

Source_Ja: もうすでに遅れてますから。
Target_En: Because it's already late.
Translation_En: Because it is already late.

Source_Ja: 分かりました。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: I understood.

Source_Ja: 他に何かお手伝いできますか？
Target_En: Is there anything else I can help you?
Translation_En: Can I help you anything else?

Source_Ja: いや、それだけです。
Target_En: No, that's all.
Translation_En: No, that’s all.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you.
Translation_En: Thank you.

Source_Ja: どういたしまして。
Target_En: You're welcome.
Translation_En: How to go.

Source_Ja: 皆さん、こんにちは。
Target_En: Good afternoon everyone.
Translation_En: Hello all of you.

Source_Ja: まずは、明けましておめでとうございます。
Target_En: First of all, happy new year.
Translation_En: First and foremost, congratulations.

Source_Ja: ここにいる皆さんに、今年のアイデアを出してほしいと思います。
Target_En: I would like everyone here to give ideas for this year.
Translation_En: I hope you are here to give me an idea for this year.

Source_Ja: 各従業員の、今年のパフォーマンスを改善するためのアイデアです。
Target_En: Ideas for each employees to improve their performance this year.
Translation_En: It is an idea for each employee to improve performance this year.

Source_Ja: シンプルなアイデアでいいですよ、複雑なものは必要ありません、皆が自分のパフォーマンスを向上出来れば、会社のパフォーマンスも良くなりますから。
Target_En: Simple ideas are welcome, we don't need complicated ideas, if everyone can improve their own performance, our company will perform better too.
Translation_En: It’s a simple idea, it doesn’t need complicated things, because if everyone can improve their performance, the company’s performance will also improve.

Source_Ja: アイデアとしては、どうやって売り上げを伸ばすかとか、顧客へのサービスをどう改善するかなどですね。
Target_En: The ideas could be how to improve the sales or how to improve the service to our customers.
Translation_En: The idea is how to expand sales and how to improve customer service.

Source_Ja: 何かコメントはありますか？
Target_En: Any comment guys?
Translation_En: Do you have any comments?

Source_Ja: アイデアを提出するのはいつですか？
Target_En: When we must give our ideas?
Translation_En: When will you present an idea?

Source_Ja: 今日はもう金曜の夕方なので、月曜の朝というのはどうでしょう。
Target_En: Today is Friday evening, so how about Monday morning?
Translation_En: Today is Friday afternoon, so what about Monday morning?

Source_Ja: そうすれば週末、休み中にじっくり考えられますよね。
Target_En: So we can think over the weekend while we're having our holiday.
Translation_En: You can think about it during the weekend, right?

Source_Ja: 分かりました、大丈夫です。
Target_En: Okay, no problem.
Translation_En: I understand, it’s okay.

Source_Ja: ここにいる皆も賛成だと思いますが。
Target_En: I guess everyone here also agree.
Translation_En: I think everyone here is in agreement.

Source_Ja: じゃ、月曜の朝9時にまた集まりましょう、いいですね、皆さん？
Target_En: So Monday morning we meet again at 9, is that okay everyone?
Translation_En: So we’ll meet again on Monday morning at 9 a.m., okay guys?

Source_Ja: はい。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: 分かりました。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: I understood.

Source_Ja: すみません、私は来週の月曜にクライアントとアポがあるんです。
Target_En: Sorry, I have an appointment with client next week on Monday.
Translation_En: Sorry, I will have a client and app on Monday next.

Source_Ja: もっと遅く、３時頃に集まれますか？
Target_En: Can we meet later at around 3 pm?
Translation_En: Are you going to get together at 3 a.m?

Source_Ja: いいですよ、または、アイデアを書き出してフェリックスに渡してくれてもいいです。
Target_En: No problem, or you can just submit your ideas in writing and give it to Felix.
Translation_En: Well, or you can write your idea and give it to Felix.

Source_Ja: ええ、僕は構わないですよ。
Target_En: Yes, I don't mind.
Translation_En: Yes, I don’t care.

Source_Ja: アイデアを僕に渡してくれたら、僕のアイデアと一緒にまとめておくよ。
Target_En: Just submit your ideas to me, and I will compile it together with my ideas.
Translation_En: If you give me the idea, I will bring it together with my idea.

Source_Ja: 分かりました、じゃ、フェリックスに渡します。
Target_En: Okay then I will submit it to Felix.
Translation_En: I’m sure I’ll give it to Felix.

Source_Ja: 助かります。
Target_En: Thank you.
Translation_En: I will help.

Source_Ja: はい、じゃ、皆さん月曜に会いましょう。
Target_En: Okay, then, see you guys on Monday.
Translation_En: So we’ll see you on Monday.

Source_Ja: ではまた。
Target_En: See you.
Translation_En: and again.

Source_Ja: 失礼します。
Target_En: See you.
Translation_En: I apologize.

Source_Ja: では。
Target_En: See you.
Translation_En: And then.

Source_Ja: こんにちは。
Target_En: Good afternoon.
Translation_En: Hello to you.

Source_Ja: こんにちは。
Target_En: Good afternoon.
Translation_En: Hello to you.

Source_Ja: ダイアナさんとお会いしたいのですが。
Target_En: May I meet Ms. Diana?
Translation_En: I want to see Diana.

Source_Ja: はい、どちらの方ですか？
Target_En: Sure, where are you from?
Translation_En: Yes, who is it?

Source_Ja: ABC会社のウィリーと申します。
Target_En: I'm Willy from ABC company.
Translation_En: Willy of the ABC company.

Source_Ja: ダイアナとはお約束していらっしゃいますか？
Target_En: Have you made an appointment with her?
Translation_En: Do you promise to Diana?

Source_Ja: はい、もう約束してます。
Target_En: Yes, I've made an appointment already.
Translation_En: Yes, I already promise.

Source_Ja: わかりました、少々お待ちください。
Target_En: Okay, please wait a moment.
Translation_En: I know, please wait a little.

Source_Ja: どうも。
Target_En: Thank you.
Translation_En: and thanks.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、ウィリー。
Target_En: Hi, Mr. Willy.
Translation_En: Hello to Willy.

Source_Ja: ああ、ダイアナさん。
Target_En: Oh, Ms. Diana.
Translation_En: Oh my Diana.

Source_Ja: ようこそ、どうぞ、入って。
Target_En: Welcome, please come in.
Translation_En: Welcome, please enter.

Source_Ja: どうも。
Target_En: Thank you.
Translation_En: and thanks.

Source_Ja: お元気ですか？
Target_En: How are you?
Translation_En: Are you well?

Source_Ja: 元気よ、あなたは？
Target_En: Good, how are you?
Translation_En: You are well, you?

Source_Ja: 大丈夫です、どうも。
Target_En: Good, thank you.
Translation_En: It is okay, thank you.

Source_Ja: どうぞおかけになって、もうちょっとお待ちください。
Target_En: Please have a seat and wait for a moment here.
Translation_En: Please go and wait a little more.

Source_Ja: 他の人たちにも、ミーティングに参加するよう声をかけてきます。
Target_En: I will ask the others to join the meeting.
Translation_En: I would also invite others to participate in the meeting.

Source_Ja: はい。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、シンシアです。
Target_En: Hello, I'm Cynthia.
Translation_En: Hi, I am a synthesis.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、ウィリーといいます、はじめまして。
Target_En: Hello, I'm Willy, nice to meet you.
Translation_En: Hello Willy, I am happy.

Source_Ja: では、ミーティングを始めましょう。
Target_En: So, let's start our meeting.
Translation_En: Let’s start the meeting.

Source_Ja: そちらの提案書を確認させていただきましたが、これが御社の最低価格ですか？
Target_En: We have reviewed your proposal, is this the best price you can give to us?
Translation_En: I’ve checked your proposal, is this your lowest price?

Source_Ja: はい、実は、10パーセントオフにできます。
Target_En: Yes, actually, we can give you 10 percent discount.
Translation_En: Yes, in fact, you can get 10 percent off.

Source_Ja: 実は他社からもお見積もりをいただいておりまして、そちらの方が御社よりも安いんですよ。
Target_En: Actually we received another quotation from another source, and they give us better price than your company.
Translation_En: In fact, you’ve got an estimate from other companies, and you’re cheaper than your company.

Source_Ja: そちらの価格の方が安くて、御社より多くの値引きもしてくれるそうなんです。
Target_En: Their price is cheaper and also they offered us more discount than you.
Translation_En: The price is cheaper and you will get more off than your company.

Source_Ja: どのくらいの値引きか教えていただくことはできますか？
Target_En: May I know how much discount they give?
Translation_En: Can you tell me how much price?

Source_Ja: 15％オフをいただいています。
Target_En: They offered us 15 percent discount.
Translation_En: 15 per cent off.

Source_Ja: わかりました、では、ウチも同じ割引を致します。
Target_En: Okay, so I will give you the same discount they offered to you.
Translation_En: I know, we’re going to make the same discount.

Source_Ja: そうですか、良かった。
Target_En: Okay, good.
Translation_En: Yes, it was good.

Source_Ja: では、社内で提案書についてさらに話し合って、できるだけ早くご返事します。
Target_En: We will discuss your proposal further internally and will revert to you as soon as possible.
Translation_En: So we will discuss more on the proposal within the company and respond to you as soon as possible.

Source_Ja: わかりました、良いご返事をお待ちしています。
Target_En: Okay, I will be waiting for your positive response.
Translation_En: I know, I'm waiting for your good answer.

Source_Ja: では、これで失礼します。
Target_En: Please excuse me then.
Translation_En: So I apologize for this.

Source_Ja: ご足労ありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you very much for coming.
Translation_En: Thank you enough.

Source_Ja: いえ、何かご質問がありましたら、ご遠慮なくご連絡ください。
Target_En: No problem, if you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.
Translation_En: If you have any questions, please contact us.

Source_Ja: はい、どうも。
Target_En: Sure, I will, thank you.
Translation_En: Yes thank you.

Source_Ja: では、失礼します。
Target_En: Okay then, see you.
Translation_En: So I apologize.

Source_Ja: また。
Target_En: See you.
Translation_En: and again.

Source_Ja: もしもし。
Target_En: Hello?
Translation_En: if if if.

Source_Ja: もしもし、ライアンだけどクリス？
Target_En: Hi Chris, it's Ryan.
Translation_En: If you were Ryan, Chris?

Source_Ja: おー、そうだよ。
Target_En: Oh, hey man.
Translation_En: Oh yeah yeah yeah.

Source_Ja: ねえ、すごく悪いんだけど、今朝のミーティング、代わりに出てくれないか？
Target_En: Listen, could you do me a massive favor and cover this morning's meeting?
Translation_En: No, it’s a bad thing, but you’re going to get out this morning meeting instead?

Source_Ja: なんでだよ、どうしたの？
Target_En: Why, what's the matter?
Translation_En: Why is it, what happened?

Source_Ja: 今駅に向かってるとこなんだけど、大きな水たまりの上を車がスピード出して走ってきて、ずぶ濡れにされちゃったんだよ。
Target_En: On the way to the station just now, a car sped through a massive puddle and absolutely soaked me.
Translation_En: Now we are going to the station, but the car runs out on a large waterfall and runs out and is very wet.

Source_Ja: 家に帰って着替えないと、こんな感じでクライアントになり得る相手に会うのは無理だ。
Target_En: I've got to go home and change, I can't meet a potential client like this.
Translation_En: If you don’t get home and dress, you can’t see someone who can become a customer in this way.

Source_Ja: いやー、それは大変だ。
Target_En: Oh man, that's terrible.
Translation_En: No, it is hard.

Source_Ja: 今、そういうことは罰金の対象になるのは知ってるよね、ナンバープレートは覚えてる？
Target_En: You know they can get fined for that now, did you catch their number plate?
Translation_En: Now you know that it will be subject to a penalty, do you remember the number plate?

Source_Ja: いや、残念ながらあっという間の出来事だったから。
Target_En: No, unfortunately it all happened too fast.
Translation_En: Unfortunately, it was a very quick event.

Source_Ja: ま、何にしても、この状態で間に合うのは絶対無理だ。
Target_En: But anyway, there's no way I'm going to make it in on time now.
Translation_En: No matter what, you can’t get in time in this situation.

Source_Ja: 分かったよ、僕がクライアントに会っておくから心配するな。
Target_En: Okay, don't worry I can meet with the client.
Translation_En: Don’t worry, I’m going to see your client.

Source_Ja: 提案書と他の資料は共有ドライブに全部入ってるよな？
Target_En: The proposal and other documents are all on the shared drive, right?
Translation_En: The proposals and other documents are all in a shared drive, right?

Source_Ja: ああ、全部そこにある。
Target_En: Yeah, it's all there.
Translation_En: Oh, everything is there.

Source_Ja: もし分からないことがあったら電話してくれればいい。
Target_En: You can ring me if anything's not clear.
Translation_En: If you don’t know anything, call me.

Source_Ja: 心配するな、帰って乾かして来いよ。
Target_En: No worries, go and get yourself dried off.
Translation_En: Don’t worry, go back and get dry.

Source_Ja: ありがと、借りは返すよ。
Target_En: Thanks man, I owe you one.
Translation_En: Thank you, I will return the loan.

Source_Ja: 期待しとこう。
Target_En: I'll hold you to that!
Translation_En: Let’s expect.

Source_Ja: どんな風になったか教えてくれよ。
Target_En: Let me know how it all goes, okay.
Translation_En: Tell me how it happened.

Source_Ja: もちろん。
Target_En: Will do.
Translation_En: of course.

Source_Ja: じゃ、後で。
Target_En: Alright, see you later.
Translation_En: And then later.

Source_Ja: じゃあ。
Target_En: Bye.
Translation_En: And then.

Source_Ja: もしもし、サム？
Target_En: Hi Sam.
Translation_En: What if Sam?

Source_Ja: ああ、クリス、こんにちは。
Target_En: Oh, hi Chris.
Translation_En: Oh Chris, hello to you.

Source_Ja: お元気ですか？
Target_En: How are you doing?
Translation_En: Are you well?

Source_Ja: 元気だよ。
Target_En: I'm good.
Translation_En: You are well.

Source_Ja: あ、そうだ、先週、息子さんのご結婚おめでとうございます。
Target_En: Oh, by the way, congratulations on your son's wedding last week.
Translation_En: Congratulations on my son’s marriage last week.

Source_Ja: どうもありがとう。
Target_En: Thank you very much.
Translation_En: Thank you very much.

Source_Ja: でね、明日の予定を再確認したかったんだ。
Target_En: So I just wanted to double check our schedule tomorrow.
Translation_En: I wanted to check the planning for tomorrow again.

Source_Ja: 明日、９時頃着のフライトだったよね？
Target_En: You will be flying in around 9 o'clock tomorrow, right?
Translation_En: I was on a flight tomorrow at 9 p.m., right?

Source_Ja: はい、そうです。
Target_En: Yes, that's right.
Translation_En: Yes Yes Yes.

Source_Ja: 了解、じゃあ僕が迎えにいって、現場まで車で連れて行きますよ。
Target_En: Okay, so I will pick you up, then drive to the site.
Translation_En: You know, I’m going to take you and take you to the scene by car.

Source_Ja: 車で２時間くらいかかるから。
Target_En: The drive will take around two hours.
Translation_En: It takes about 2 hours by car.

Source_Ja: それに現場視察でさらに２時間程かかると思う。
Target_En: And I think the site inspection will take another two hours.
Translation_En: It will also take more than two hours to check the site.

Source_Ja: 君の帰りのフライトは午後5時だよね？
Target_En: Your flight is at 5 o'clock in the afternoon, right?
Translation_En: Your return flight is at 5 p.m., right?

Source_Ja: そうです。
Target_En: That's right.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: 時間足りますよね？
Target_En: We should have enough time, right?
Translation_En: We have enough time, right?

Source_Ja: うん、そう思うけど。
Target_En: Yeah, I think so.
Translation_En: Yes, I think that.

Source_Ja: 国内線だからそんなに早く空港に行かなくてもいいし。
Target_En: It's a domestic flight so you don't have to get to the airport so early.
Translation_En: It’s important that you don’t get to the airport so quickly.

Source_Ja: １時間前に空港に着いていれば大丈夫でしょ。
Target_En: You should be fine as long as you get there one hour earlier.
Translation_En: If you arrive at the airport a hour ago, it’s okay.

Source_Ja: 良かった。
Target_En: Great.
Translation_En: It was good.

Source_Ja: じゃあ、準備万端ですね。
Target_En: Think we are all set then?
Translation_En: So you are ready.

Source_Ja: 調査用具を忘れずにね。
Target_En: Don't forget to bring your inspection gear.
Translation_En: Do not forget the research equipment.

Source_Ja: はい。
Target_En: Right.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: ヘルメット、ベスト、安全長靴がいるよ。
Target_En: You'll need your helmet, vest, and steel-toed boots.
Translation_En: There is a helmet, the best and safe shoes.

Source_Ja: 雨になるかもしれないから、雨具もいるかも。
Target_En: It might rain so you should dress appropriately.
Translation_En: It may be rain, so there may be rain.

Source_Ja: ああ、リマインドどうも！
Target_En: Thanks for the reminder!
Translation_En: Thank you Rihanna!

Source_Ja: 明日お会いしましょう。
Target_En: I'll see you tomorrow.
Translation_En: Let us see you tomorrow.

Source_Ja: 楽しみにしているよ。
Target_En: I'll look forward to it.
Translation_En: I am looking forward to.

Source_Ja: じゃあ、これで。
Target_En: Bye for now.
Translation_En: So now this.

Source_Ja: この会計年度で何か買いたい物はある？
Target_En: Do you need to buy anything for this fiscal year?
Translation_En: Is there anything you want to buy in this year?

Source_Ja: 例えば？
Target_En: Like?
Translation_En: For example?

Source_Ja: 事務用品とか。
Target_En: Like office supplies.
Translation_En: of office equipment.

Source_Ja: マウスや充電コードみたいな物。
Target_En: Like a mouse, charger cable, things like that.
Translation_En: It’s like a mouse and a charging code.

Source_Ja: 経費がまだ残ってるから、買う物があるなら今買って。
Target_En: We still have some leftover budget so if you need to buy anything then buy it now.
Translation_En: If you have something to buy, buy it now.

Source_Ja: ああ、なるほど。
Target_En: Oh, I see.
Translation_En: Oh, as much as well.

Source_Ja: モニターをもう一台買っていいですか？
Target_En: Can I get another monitor?
Translation_En: Can I buy another monitor?

Source_Ja: もちろん構わないよ。
Target_En: Sure why not.
Translation_En: Of course it doesn’t matter.

Source_Ja: でも本当に必要なの？
Target_En: Do you really need it though?
Translation_En: But is it really needed?

Source_Ja: はい、実はそうなんです。
Target_En: Yeah I do actually.
Translation_En: Yes, it is actually so.

Source_Ja: リサーチやデータ入力のために必要なんです。
Target_En: I need it when I do research or enter data.
Translation_En: It is necessary for research and data input.

Source_Ja: スクリーンが２台あれば2つのものを同時に見られるので、今よりずっと便利になりますよ。
Target_En: It will be a lot more convenient if I have two screens so I can look at two things at the same time.
Translation_En: If you have two screens, you can see two things at the same time, so it will be much easier than now.

Source_Ja: じゃないとAltとTabを押し続けることになっちゃいます。
Target_En: Otherwise, I'll have to keep alt tabbing.
Translation_En: Otherwise, you will continue to push the Alt and Tab.

Source_Ja: わかったよ。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: 近頃はモニターもだいぶ安いしね。
Target_En: Monitors are pretty cheap these days.
Translation_En: Nowadays, the monitor is very cheap.

Source_Ja: 27インチで100ドルぐらいのものも見かけたよ。
Target_En: I've seen a twenty-seven inch go for around a hundred dollars.
Translation_En: I saw something about $100 in 27 inches.

Source_Ja: どのモニターが欲しいかEメールを送ってくれる？
Target_En: Can you send me an email on which monitor you want?
Translation_En: Which monitor do you want to send me an email?

Source_Ja: はい。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: 総務部にも送っておいてね？
Target_En: Can you also include the administration department in the email?
Translation_En: Do you send it to the headquarters?

Source_Ja: わかりました。
Target_En: Got it.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: 皆さん、こんにちは、今日はお集まりくださいましてありがとうございます。
Target_En: Hello all, thank you for gathering today.
Translation_En: Hi guys, thank you for gathering today.

Source_Ja: ユーチン、今日はサイラーがいるので、全員英語でもいいでしょうか？
Target_En: Yichin do you mind if we all speak English today as Sylar is here?
Translation_En: Youtine, today there’s a silver, so all can be in English?

Source_Ja: もちろん大丈夫です、サイラー、元気ですか？
Target_En: Of course not, how are you Sylar?
Translation_En: You’re okay, Sylvester, you’re okay?

Source_Ja: やあ、ユーチン、声が聞けて良かったよ。
Target_En: Hi Yichin, good to hear your voice.
Translation_En: Oh yeah, I am glad you heard the voice.

Source_Ja: オーストラリアはどう？
Target_En: How is Australia?
Translation_En: What about Australia?

Source_Ja: 実はうだるような暑さですよ。
Target_En: Sweltering actually.
Translation_En: In fact, it is so hot.

Source_Ja: 東京の方がまだましでした、ここに戻るのはうんざりです。
Target_En: Tokyo was much better, it sucks to be back here.
Translation_En: Tokyo is still better, and I’m tired of returning here.

Source_Ja: さて、当社に関するあなた方のファンドの考えについて、全員同じ認識だということを確認するため、今日はお2人にも電話で参加してもらいました。
Target_En: So I've got you 2 on the phone because I wanted to make sure we are on the same page regarding your fund's intentions with our company.
Translation_En: Well, to make sure that you all have the same awareness about your funds about us, today you both got to join by telephone.

Source_Ja: サイラーからは、懸念があるとのフィードバックを内々でいただいています。
Target_En: Sylar has given me some feedback in confidence as to some concerns he has.
Translation_En: Sylvester is concerned about his feedback.

Source_Ja: そう、その件に関しては、サイラーからEメールをもらっています。
Target_En: Yes, I got an email from Sylar regarding that.
Translation_En: Yes, I have received an e-mail from Sylvester.

Source_Ja: サイラーの懸念はワン フェイホン社長に伝えてあり、フェイホンは御社の今後の方向性を考えるため過去の資金繰りを確認しています。
Target_En: I've taken his concern to Wang Feihong and he has been looking at past financials to see where you may be heading.
Translation_En: Syler's concerns have been told to President One Feyhon, and Feyhon has confirmed his past funding to consider the future direction of his company.

Source_Ja: ここだけの話、もちろんサイラーもいますが、あまり良い状況ではありません。
Target_En: Just between you and me, and Syler of course, this doesn't look good.
Translation_En: There is only a story about it, and of course there is also a silver, but it’s not very good.

Source_Ja: ワン フェイホンは、恵子さんが、なんと言いましょうか、えー、慎重であることを主に気にしています。
Target_En: Wang Feihong is mostly concerned at how, what's the word, um, careful, Keiko is.
Translation_En: One Feyhon is primarily concerned about what Mr. Yuki can say, yeah, be cautious.

Source_Ja: ユーチン、いいんです、言葉を選ばなくてもいいですよ。
Target_En: Yichin, it's fine, you don't have to sugar coat.
Translation_En: Yuri, you have no choice of words.

Source_Ja: 恵子さんは頑固で時間がかかりすぎると。
Target_En: She is way too stubborn and slow.
Translation_En: Yuri is hard and takes a lot of time.

Source_Ja: フェイホンは、そろそろ何らかの変革があることを期待していたのですが、悪くはなっていないにしろ、変わってないようで。
Target_En: He was expecting some sort of change by now, but it seems to be the same, if not worse.
Translation_En: Feyhon expected that there would be some change right now, but it doesn’t seem bad, it doesn’t change.

Source_Ja: ユジーナ、役員会議は最悪でしたよ。
Target_En: Eugina, the board meeting was a disaster.
Translation_En: Joanna, the board meeting was the worst.

Source_Ja: 恵子さんはアレックスを制止して、私の質問もうやむやにしました。
Target_En: She was shutting Alex off, and dancing around my questions.
Translation_En: He stopped Alex and stopped my question.

Source_Ja: ワン フェイホンがあの会議に同席することなんて考えられません。
Target_En: I can't imagine Wang Feihong himself sitting at that meeting.
Translation_En: We can’t think that One Faithon will be attending that meeting.

Source_Ja: あの人、爆発しますよ。
Target_En: He will explode.
Translation_En: He will explode.

Source_Ja: そうですね、あなたの質問には全く答えなかったと言ってましたね。
Target_En: Yes, you told me she didn't answer any of your questions..
Translation_En: Yes, you said you did not answer your question at all.

Source_Ja: 当社は御社の最大の投資元の一つなのに、非常に失礼です。
Target_En: It's very disrespectful as we are one of your biggest investors.
Translation_En: We are one of your biggest investors, but we are very disappointed.

Source_Ja: 当社の経営陣のふるまいについては、深くお詫びを申し上げる以外に言葉もございません。
Target_En: I don't know what to say other than I deeply apologize for their behavior.
Translation_En: There is no word for the behavior of our management except to express profound apologies.

Source_Ja: 恵子さん、大丈夫ですかね？
Target_En: Is she okay though?
Translation_En: Yuki, is it okay?

Source_Ja: といいますと？
Target_En: Meaning?
Translation_En: Do you want?

Source_Ja: えーと、あの方、その、よくわかりませんが、心身衰弱かなんかでしょうかね？
Target_En: Well, is she, um, having some sort of, I don't know, breakdown?
Translation_En: I don’t know, I don’t know, but it’s a mental weakness.

Source_Ja: どうしてあそこまで自分の世界に行っちゃってるのか、理解できないんです。
Target_En: I don't understand how she can live in la-la land that long.
Translation_En: I don’t understand why you’ve gone so far into your world.

Source_Ja: 何かおかしいですよね、恵子さんの健康状態が心配ですよ。
Target_En: There seems to be something wrong and I'm worried for her wellbeing.
Translation_En: I am worried about the health of Yuri.

Source_Ja: それは新たな見方ですね。
Target_En: That's a new take.
Translation_En: That is a new view.

Source_Ja: そんなことは考えもつきませんでしたが、うん、それはありえるかも。
Target_En: I didn't think about that, but yeah, that is a possibility.
Translation_En: I didn’t think about it, but yes, it might be possible.

Source_Ja: 個人的なことや病歴などはわかりませんので、なんとも言えません。
Target_En: I don't know her personal affairs, or her medical history, so I can't really weigh in on that.
Translation_En: I don’t know personal or medical history, so I can’t say anything.

Source_Ja: ですが、当社の持続可能性のためには、策を講じる必要があることは確かで、当社の方向性はCファンドにかかっております。
Target_En: But I do believe something needs to be done for the sustainability of our company and I am counting on C Fund for direction.
Translation_En: However, we are sure that we need to take measures for our sustainability, and our direction depends on the C Fund.

Source_Ja: とにかく、私としてはまだ、R社の状況を好転させるためにご一緒に取り掛かることを約束しますが、警告として言います、ワン フェイホン自身の関心は御社から離れていくと思います。
Target_En: So I'm still committed to working with you to turn things around for Company R, but just as a heads up, Wang Feihong himself will not be focusing on you guys.
Translation_En: Anyway, I am still promising to work with you to improve the situation of the R company, but as a warning, I think the interests of One Feyhon will be away from your company.

Source_Ja: 御社と協力することは許可されていますが、今後フェイホンからのインプットはないでしょう。
Target_En: He has allowed me to work with you, but there won't be any input from him.
Translation_En: It is permitted to collaborate with your company, but there will be no input from Facebook in the future.

Source_Ja: 率直に言ってくださりありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you for being straight with me.
Translation_En: Thank you for being honest.

Source_Ja: ユジーナ、この情報はここだけにしないといけませんね。
Target_En: Eugina, I think this information should just be among us.
Translation_En: Joanna, you have to keep this information here.

Source_Ja: えー、実のところ、これはうちの経営陣への警鐘だと思いますね。
Target_En: Well, I actually think this is a good wakeup call for them.
Translation_En: In fact, this is a warning to our management.

Source_Ja: Cファンドが関心を失っていることを当社の経営陣が知ったら、きちんと対処するでしょうから。
Target_En: If they know C Fund is losing interest, they may finally get their act together.
Translation_En: If our management team knows that the C fund is losing interest, we will deal with it properly.

Source_Ja: 経営陣へ何と言うかはあなたにお任せしますよ、でも、私がここにいることを忘れないでください。
Target_En: It's up to you what you tell management, but please remember I am still here.
Translation_En: I’ll tell you what you’re saying to the management, but don’t forget that I’m here.

Source_Ja: 背水の陣は敷かない方がいいでしょう。
Target_En: It's better not to completely burn bridges.
Translation_En: It is better not to put the back of the water.

Source_Ja: お越しいただきありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you for coming in.
Translation_En: Thank you for coming.

Source_Ja: この前例のない天気に大打撃を受けて、屋根の中でパイプが溢れています。
Target_En: This unprecedented weather is wreaking havoc on us, and there has been some overflow of pipes in the roof.
Translation_En: With this unprecedented weather, the roof is filled with pipe.

Source_Ja: 周りに雨漏りが見られて、申し訳ありません。
Target_En: I apologize for the leaks you see around you.
Translation_En: I am sorry for the rainfall around me.

Source_Ja: 東京にある30％のビルでパイプの破裂があるとニュースで聞きました。
Target_En: I have heard on the news that 30 percent of Tokyo's buildings have burst pipes.
Translation_En: I heard in the news that there was a pipe break in 30% of buildings in Tokyo.

Source_Ja: 地下鉄の駅にも至るところにバケツがありましたよ。
Target_En: The subway station had buckets everywhere too.
Translation_En: There were bats everywhere at the metro station.

Source_Ja: ええ、そうですか、面接に戻り、チームにあなたのことを紹介したいと思います。
Target_En: Yes, so, I would like to get back to the interview and introduce you to our team.
Translation_En: Yes, yes, I want to go back to the interview and introduce you to the team.

Source_Ja: こちらがシルベスター コー、当社の最高財務責任者です、そしてこちらがITチームを仕切っているカリム アフージャ。
Target_En: This is Sylvester Ko, our CFO, and this is Karim Ahuja who leads the IT team.
Translation_En: This is Silvester Co, the chief financial officer of our company, and this is Karim Afja, who manages the IT team.

Source_Ja: カリムと密接に仕事してもらう予定です。
Target_En: You will be working closely with Karim.
Translation_En: I am planning to work closely with Karim.

Source_Ja: こんにちは、お二人とも初めまして。
Target_En: Hello, nice to meet you both.
Translation_En: Hi, I am happy both of you.

Source_Ja: さて、先日はビデオ面接をしていただきありがとうございます、今日は現にあなたがここで何をしていくのか、そして興味があるかどうかを実感していただく目的です。
Target_En: So thank you for doing a video interview with me the other day, today is really to get a feel of what you will be doing here, and whether you will be interested.
Translation_En: Well, thank you for having a video interview last day, and today we’re aiming to see what you’re doing here and whether you’re interested.

Source_Ja: カリムに話を任せます。
Target_En: I'll let Karim do the talking.
Translation_En: Let me talk to Karim.

Source_Ja: どうも、セルゲイ。
Target_En: Hi Sergei.
Translation_En: Thank you Sergey.

Source_Ja: それで、利永さんからあなたの履歴書を転送してもらいましたが、まさに当社に必要な人材だと思います。
Target_En: So Dr. Toshinaga forwarded me your CV and I believe you are exactly the person we need.
Translation_En: So I’ve been sending your CV from Mr. Liu, but I think it’s exactly the person we need.

Source_Ja: 基本的に前の会社でやっていたのと同じ事をしていただきます。
Target_En: Basically you will be doing what you have done at your previous company.
Translation_En: Basically, you will do the same thing that you did in the company before.

Source_Ja: 営業所のシステムの監督と問題への対処をしていただきます。
Target_En: You will be overseeing the sales office system and taking care of their issues.
Translation_En: We will be monitoring the system of the store and addressing the problem.

Source_Ja: 基幹システムの管理と同様に、必要に応じて当社のウェブサイトのバックエンドの仕事も発生します。
Target_En: There will be some backend work on our website when necessary, as well as taking care of our enterprise system.
Translation_En: Like the management of the basic system, the back-end work on our website will also occur if necessary.

Source_Ja: 基幹システムは導入したばかりのもので、学習過程は従業員にとってかなり険しいものです。
Target_En: The enterprise system is something we just installed, and the learning curve for our employees is quite steep.
Translation_En: Basic systems are just introduced, and the learning process is quite difficult for employees.

Source_Ja: たくさんの質問が出ると思うので、これらに対処できるよう基本をご案内します。
Target_En: They are going to have a lot of questions, so I will guide you through the basics so you can deal with the tickets.
Translation_En: I think there will be a lot of questions, so I will guide you to solve them.

Source_Ja: はい、できると思います。
Target_En: Yes, I think I can handle that.
Translation_En: Yes, I think you can.

Source_Ja: 前の仕事でもややこしい基幹システムがありましたが、たった数日で理解できました。
Target_En: We had a complicated enterprise system at my previous job but it only took me a few days to understand it.
Translation_En: I had a hard work system before, but I could understand it in just a few days.

Source_Ja: 何だこの割れるような音は？
Target_En: What's that cracking sound?
Translation_En: What is this broken sound?

Source_Ja: 聞こえないけど。
Target_En: I don't hear it.
Translation_En: I can’t hear.

Source_Ja: なにかが間違いなく割れている。
Target_En: Something is definitely cracking.
Translation_En: Something is definitely broken.

Source_Ja: うわ、セルゲイ危ない！
Target_En: Oh no, Sergei watch out!
Translation_En: Sergey is in danger!

Source_Ja: 何が起きたんですか？
Target_En: What just happened?
Translation_En: What has happened?

Source_Ja: セルゲイ、申し訳ない、タオルを持ってきます。
Target_En: Sergei, I'm so sorry, let me grab a towel.
Translation_En: I'm sorry, I'm going to bring you a handheld.

Source_Ja: めちゃくちゃだな。
Target_En: This place is a mess!
Translation_En: It is crazy.

Source_Ja: 私も濡れちゃったよ。
Target_En: I've been splashed as well!
Translation_En: I was wet too.

Source_Ja: 水の重さで天井のパネルが崩れ落ちたの？
Target_En: Did that ceiling panel just cave in with the weight of water?
Translation_En: Did the roof panel collapse due to the weight of water?

Source_Ja: あらら、セルゲイ、ずぶ濡れですね、大丈夫ですか？
Target_En: Oh dear, Sergei, you are all wet, are you ok?
Translation_En: Well, Sergey, it is very wet, is it okay?

Source_Ja: 当然面接は続けられませんが、オファーを延長したいです。
Target_En: Obviously we can't continue with the interview, but I would like to extend an offer.
Translation_En: Of course, I can't continue the interview, but I want to extend the offer.

Source_Ja: この状況のせいだけではありませんが、いいですか、君の履歴書は一流だしカリムも喜んでいます。
Target_En: Not just because of this, mind you, your CV is stellar and Karim is happy as well.
Translation_En: Not just because of this situation, but well, your CV is excellent and Karim is happy.

Source_Ja: 私のカシミアのスーツ濡れちゃったよ！
Target_En: My cashmere suit is wet!
Translation_En: My Kashmir dress is wet!

Source_Ja: はい、セルゲイ、ドライヤーで乾かすのでジャケットを貸してください。
Target_En: Here, Sergei, let me take that jacket so I can blow it with this dryer.
Translation_En: Yes, please borrow a jacket to dry it with a sergey, dryer.

Source_Ja: カシミアを着ているわけではないので大丈夫です、ありがとうございます、カリムさん。
Target_En: I'm not wearing cashmere so I'm ok, thank you Karim.
Translation_En: I’m not going to wear Cassia, it’s okay, thank you, Mr. Karim.

Source_Ja: めちゃくちゃなことになって申し訳ありませんでした、クリーニング代は請求してください。
Target_En: I apologize for this mess, please send us your dry-cleaning bill.
Translation_En: I'm sorry for the bad thing, please charge the cleaning fee.

Source_Ja: 必ずですよ。
Target_En: I insist.
Translation_En: It is definitely.

Source_Ja: オファーを延長したよ、カリム。
Target_En: I've extended an offer, Karim.
Translation_En: I have extended the offer, Karim.

Source_Ja: さすが、利永さん。
Target_En: That's great, Dr. Toshinaga.
Translation_En: Well Mr. Liu.

Source_Ja: あの、ありがとうございます、でも一度家に帰って考えさせてください。
Target_En: Well, thank you but let me go home and think it over.
Translation_En: Thank you, but let me go home and think.

Source_Ja: 皆さん、こんにちは。
Target_En: Hello, everyone.
Translation_En: Hello all of you.

Source_Ja: 今日はたくさんの方がいらっしゃって嬉しいです。
Target_En: I am glad to see we have a big audience today.
Translation_En: I am glad that there are many more here today.

Source_Ja: さて、今日私がお話しすることに皆さん大変興味をお持ちだと思うのですが。
Target_En: So I'm sure you guys are eager to hear more about what I have to say today.
Translation_En: I think you are very interested in what I am talking about today.

Source_Ja: でも、始める前に、まず政府機関AとA社さんに、今日のイベントを共同開催してくれたことを感謝したいと思います。
Target_En: But before I start, I'd like to thank Government Agency A and Company A for co-organizing today's event.
Translation_En: But before we begin, I would like to thank the government agency A and the company A for jointly organizing the event today.

Source_Ja: それから、この協定の実現のためにご協力くださったマイク モストウさんの仕事ぶりにもお礼を言わせてください。
Target_En: Also, I'd like to thank Mike Mostow for his work in helping the deal materialize.
Translation_En: Then thank you for the work of Mike Mostow that has helped you to implement this agreement.

Source_Ja: モストウさん、観客の皆さんに何か一言ありますか。
Target_En: Mr. Mostow, would like to say something to the audience?
Translation_En: Do you have any words to the audience?

Source_Ja: ええ、ありがとう、クリス。
Target_En: Yes, thank you Chris.
Translation_En: Thank you, Chris.

Source_Ja: 皆さんご存知かと思いますが、今年に入って貿易協定が締結されました。
Target_En: As you may all know, the trade deal was signed earlier this year.
Translation_En: You know, this year we entered into a trade agreement.

Source_Ja: その過程において問題はいくつかありましたが、係わった政府関係者たち全員が確実に物事がスムーズにいくようにしました。
Target_En: Although there were some issues along the way, all the government officials involved have made sure things went smoothly.
Translation_En: There were a number of problems during the process, but all the government officials involved made sure things went smoothly.

Source_Ja: モストウさん、大変なお仕事、ありがとうございました。
Target_En: We appreciate your hard work Mr. Mostow.
Translation_En: Mr. Moore, thank you for the hard work.

Source_Ja: そして、今日ここにいて、クリスと彼のチームが新貿易協定について発表出来るのを喜ばしく思っています。
Target_En: And I'm happy to be here today to have Chris and his team present to you the new trade deal.
Translation_En: And I am happy to be here today and Chris and his team can announce a new trade agreement.

Source_Ja: クリス、どうぞお話してください。
Target_En: Chris, I will hand the floor back to you.
Translation_En: Chris, please tell me.

Source_Ja: モストウさん、大変ありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you very much Mr. Mostow.
Translation_En: Mr. Moore, I am very grateful.

Source_Ja: さて、早速始めましょうか。
Target_En: Alright, let's get right into it then.
Translation_En: So, let’s start quickly?

Source_Ja: CPTPPは11か国間の貿易協定です。
Target_En: The CPTPP is a new trade agreement between eleven countries.
Translation_En: CPTPP is a trade agreement between 11 countries.

Source_Ja: その11のうち、7か国が正式に参加していますが、一方残りの4か国はまだ検討中の状態にあります。
Target_En: Of the eleven, seven countries have already officially joined while the remaining four are still in the discussion phase.
Translation_En: Seven of the 11 countries have officially participated, while the remaining four countries are still under consideration.

Source_Ja: 署名した7か国は、メキシコ、日本、カナダ、シンガポール、ニュージーランド、オーストラリア、ベトナムです。
Target_En: The seven countries that have signed on are, Mexico, Japan, Canada, Singapore, New Zealand, Australia, and Vietnam.
Translation_En: The seven signed countries are Mexico, Japan, Canada, Singapore, New Zealand, Australia, and Vietnam.

Source_Ja: 残りの4か国は、ブルネイ、チリ、マレーシア、ペルーとなっています。
Target_En: The four remaining are, Brunei, Chile, Malaysia, and Peru.
Translation_En: The remaining four countries are Brunei, Chile, Malaysia and Peru.

Source_Ja: この貿易協定の目玉となるのは、多数の製品にかかる関税の引き下げもしくは撤廃です。
Target_En: So the biggest feature of this trade deal will be the reduction or removal of tariffs on a large number of goods.
Translation_En: The goal of this trade agreement is to reduce or abolish the tariffs on a large number of products.

Source_Ja: カナダにとって、大きな利点の一つは、アジア市場への肉製品にかかる関税の引き下げです。
Target_En: For Canada, one of the biggest benefit is the reduction of tariffs for meat products in to the Asian market.
Translation_En: One of the major advantages for Canada is the reduction of tariffs on meat products to the Asian market.

Source_Ja: カナダの主要市場の一つが日本なので、肉製品の貿易が大幅に増えることを予測しています。
Target_En: One of Canada's key market will be Japan and we expect the trade of meat products to increase greatly.
Translation_En: As one of Canada’s major markets is Japan, we expect the trade in meat products to increase significantly.

Source_Ja: 主要製品は牛肉と豚肉になります。
Target_En: Key products will be beef and pork.
Translation_En: The main products are cow and pork.

Source_Ja: さて、関税だけでなく、協定は国々の間にその他の利益ももたらします。
Target_En: Now aside from the tariffs, the deal also brings other benefits among the countries.
Translation_En: Well, not only the customs, but the agreement will bring other benefits between the countries.

Source_Ja: 例えば、これによって他の国の他の企業が、政府との契約に入札する機会を持つことができます。
Target_En: For example, this will open up opportunities for other companies in other countries to bid for government contracts.
Translation_En: For example, this allows other companies in other countries to have the opportunity to offer contracts with the government.

Source_Ja: 典型的に、政府の契約には、地元の企業だけが入札できるのですが、これによって変わるでしょう。
Target_En: Typically, government contracts can only be bid by the local companies but this will change that.
Translation_En: Typically, government contracts can only be offered by local companies, but this will change.

Source_Ja: そして、関税引き下げもしくは撤廃によって、外国企業が海外での政府契約入札においてより競争力をもつことが出来るようになります。
Target_En: And with the reduction or removal of tariffs, it will allow foreign companies to be more competitive in bidding for government contracts abroad.
Translation_En: And by reducing or withdrawing tariffs, foreign companies will be able to become more competitive in government contracts offerings abroad.

Source_Ja: つまり、貿易協定は、単なる関税の引き下げや撤廃だけでなく、関係国の発展を促す他の機能も持つのです。
Target_En: So the trade deal is not a simple reduction or removal of tariffs but has other features to promote the prosperity of the countries involved.
Translation_En: That is, the trade agreement has not only the reduction or withdrawal of tariffs, but also other functions to encourage the development of the stakeholders.

Source_Ja: 何時間でも話すことができますが、まだまだこの先丸々一日ありますので、この辺で止めておきますね。
Target_En: I could go on for hours but since we still have a whole day ahead of us, I will stop around here.
Translation_En: You can talk about it for hours, but there’s still a whole day ahead, so I’m going to stop here.

Source_Ja: では、この後は、政府機関Aの貿易委員の方々とのパネルセッションになります。
Target_En: So after this, we will have a panel session with the trade commissioners from Government Agency A.
Translation_En: Then there will be a panel session with the government agency A’s trade committees.

Source_Ja: 彼らは貿易協定の利点に関する見通しを教えてくれ、企業が利用することのできるいくつかの政府プログラムについて説明してくれます。
Target_En: They will provide their insight on the benefits of the trade deal, and explain some of the government programs that companies could use.
Translation_En: They will show you a perspective on the advantages of trade agreements and explain some government programs that companies can take advantage of.

Source_Ja: これらは、輸出業者が新しい市場へ進出するのに利用できる可能性のあるものだと思います。
Target_En: These would be things that exporters could potentially use to expand to a new market.
Translation_En: I think these are the possibilities that exporters can use to enter a new market.

Source_Ja: パネルセッションは、私の後ろにある部屋で開かれますので、この後、どうぞそちらに向かってください。
Target_En: The panel session will be held in the room behind me so please head on over after this.
Translation_En: The panel session will be open in the room behind me, so then, please go there.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございました、そして、皆さんが今日のイベントで多くを学ばれることを願っています。
Target_En: Thank you and I hope everyone learns a lot from today's event.
Translation_En: Thank you, and I hope you will learn a lot about this event today.

Source_Ja: ねえベン、この船便がどこに行くか知ってる？
Target_En: Hey Ben, do you know where this shipment will be going to?
Translation_En: Don’t you know where this ship is going?

Source_Ja: それは上海に行くやつだよ。
Target_En: It's the one to Shanghai.
Translation_En: He is going to Shanghai.

Source_Ja: 会社について聞いてるのかい？
Target_En: Are you asking about the Company?
Translation_En: Are you listening to the company?

Source_Ja: うん、あと住所と。
Target_En: Yeah and their address.
Translation_En: And then the address.

Source_Ja: A運輸がBL指示が必要だって言ってて、今日中にコンサイニーの名前が知りたいそうなんだ。
Target_En: Freight Forwarder A is asking for the BL instruction and they need to know the name of the consignee by the end of the day.
Translation_En: A transportation says it needs a BL instructions, and I want to know the name of the consign today.

Source_Ja: 普段はエレインがやってるけど、今日は休みを取ってる。
Target_En: Elaine usually does this but she took the day off today.
Translation_En: I usually do it, but I am on vacation today.

Source_Ja: この前の上海宛の便と同じはずだけど。
Target_En: It should be the same as the last shipment to Shanghai.
Translation_En: It is the same as the previous flight to Shanghai.

Source_Ja: だからB社だね。
Target_En: So it should be Company B.
Translation_En: That is the company B.

Source_Ja: でも確実なことは言えないな。
Target_En: But don't quote me on it.
Translation_En: But I can’t say anything sure.

Source_Ja: 了解。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: to understand.

Source_Ja: あ、エレインが昨日送ってた植物検疫申請書を確認してみたら？
Target_En: Oh, why don't you check the phytosanitary application that Elaine sent out yesterday?
Translation_En: Oh, let me check the plant vaccination application I sent yesterday?

Source_Ja: 君が探してる情報が載ってるはずだよ。
Target_En: That should have the information you're looking for.
Translation_En: You must have the information you are looking for.

Source_Ja: あれ、そのメールは見なかったな。
Target_En: Oh, I didn't see that email.
Translation_En: I didn’t see that email.

Source_Ja: 彼女がいつそのメール出したか知ってる？
Target_En: Do you know when she sent the email?
Translation_En: Do you know when she sent the email?

Source_Ja: 昨日の朝のはずだけど。
Target_En: It should have been yesterday morning.
Translation_En: It should have been yesterday morning.

Source_Ja: 確認させて。
Target_En: Let me check.
Translation_En: Let me confirm it.

Source_Ja: うん、昨日の11時頃に送ってるよ。
Target_En: Yeah, she sent it out around 11 o'clock yesterday.
Translation_En: I sent it at 11 am yesterday.

Source_Ja: あれ、でも君をccに入れてなかったんだ。
Target_En: Oh, but she didn't Cc you in the email.
Translation_En: But I didn’t put you in the cc.

Source_Ja: ああ、だから。
Target_En: Oh, no wonder.
Translation_En: Oh so because.

Source_Ja: そのメール、僕に転送してくれる？
Target_En: Can you forward that email to me?
Translation_En: Will you send me this email?

Source_Ja: うん、今やるね。
Target_En: Yes, I'll do that now.
Translation_En: Yes, I will do it now.

Source_Ja: やった、ありがとう。
Target_En: Great, thank you.
Translation_En: I did, thank you.

Source_Ja: こういうメールには必ず君も入れるように言っておくよ。
Target_En: I'll send her a note to always include you in these kind of emails.
Translation_En: I will tell you that you can enter this email as well.

Source_Ja: うん、よろしく。
Target_En: Yes, please.
Translation_En: Yes and welcome.

Source_Ja: じゃないと彼女がいない時にカバーできないからね！
Target_En: Otherwise I won't be able to cover for her when she's away!
Translation_En: Otherwise, you can’t cover it without her.

Source_Ja: ねえ、ハン、ちょっと来て、インターンの仕事をチェックしてくれる？
Target_En: Hey, Han, please come and check our intern's work.
Translation_En: Don’t you, don’t you, come and check the job of the internship?

Source_Ja: 信じられないんだ。
Target_En: He's unbelievable.
Translation_En: I am unbelievable.

Source_Ja: はい、はい、今チェックしますよ。
Target_En: Yes, yes I am checking it right now.
Translation_En: Yes, I will check it now.

Source_Ja: あいつ、ひと晩かけて、ファイルを全部めちゃくちゃにしてくれたのか？
Target_En: Did he spend all night messing up all these files?
Translation_En: Did he spend a night and broke all the files?

Source_Ja: みたいですね。
Target_En: It seems that way.
Translation_En: It seems.

Source_Ja: 少なくとも、粘り強いな。
Target_En: At least he's persistent.
Translation_En: At least be strong.

Source_Ja: だが、たぶん、それだけだろうな。
Target_En: Maybe that's it though.
Translation_En: But maybe that’s all that.

Source_Ja: 何が問題か、なんで彼に言わなかったんだ？
Target_En: Why didn't you tell him what the problem is?
Translation_En: What's the problem, why didn't you tell him?

Source_Ja: どうして僕が言わないといけないんですか？
Target_En: Why should I do that?
Translation_En: Why should I say it?

Source_Ja: どっちみち、彼はここではやっていけませんよ。
Target_En: He won't survive here anyway.
Translation_En: On the other hand, he cannot do it here.

Source_Ja: うん、そうだな。
Target_En: Yeah, you're right.
Translation_En: Yes yes yes.

Source_Ja: あいつ、今プレゼンの準備してるのかな？
Target_En: Is he preparing for his presentation now?
Translation_En: Are you preparing for the presentation now?

Source_Ja: パートナーは誰がやるんですかね？
Target_En: Who's going to be his partner?
Translation_En: Who does the partner do?

Source_Ja: 知るか。
Target_En: Who knows.
Translation_En: Do you know?

Source_Ja: ところで、誰があいつを雇ったんだ？
Target_En: By the way, who hired him?
Translation_En: Who has hired him?

Source_Ja: 何かヒントはある？
Target_En: Do you have any clue about that?
Translation_En: Do you have any clues?

Source_Ja: 誰が雇ったかまったくわかりませんね。
Target_En: I have no idea who hired him.
Translation_En: I don’t know who hired it.

Source_Ja: 今、シニアマネジャーとミーティングがあるんです。
Target_En: I have a briefing with the senior manager now.
Translation_En: We have a meeting with senior managers.

Source_Ja: わかった。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: じゃあ、あとで。
Target_En: I will see you later.
Translation_En: So then after.

Source_Ja: おはようございます。
Target_En: Good morning sir.
Translation_En: Good Morning.

Source_Ja: えー、やっておきましたのは…
Target_En: I made...
Translation_En: Oh, I did what I did...

Source_Ja: もう、見たよ。
Target_En: We saw it already.
Translation_En: I have seen it already.

Source_Ja: 量をこなせるのは良くわかった。
Target_En: You surely proved it quantity-wise.
Translation_En: I knew it was good to get the quantity.

Source_Ja: だが、それだけだ。
Target_En: But, that's it.
Translation_En: But that’s all.

Source_Ja: おい、君。
Target_En: Hey, you!
Translation_En: and you.

Source_Ja: ハンさんが作ったフォルダーの階層をどうして無視したんだ？
Target_En: Why did you ignore the folder trees that Mr. Han had made?
Translation_En: Why did you ignore the flooring layers made by Mr. Han?

Source_Ja: 無視はしませんでしたけど、入りきらないファイルがたくさんありました。
Target_En: I didn't ignore them, but there were so many files that didn't fit there.
Translation_En: I didn’t ignore it, but there were a lot of files that could not enter.

Source_Ja: あれは会社の基準なんだ。
Target_En: That's the company standard.
Translation_En: This is the company’s standard.

Source_Ja: どういう意味かわかるか？
Target_En: Do you know what that means?
Translation_En: Do you know what it means?

Source_Ja: 皆それを理解して了承してるってことだよ。
Target_En: Everyone understood and agreed on it.
Translation_En: Everyone understands and agrees.

Source_Ja: すみません、覚えておきます。
Target_En: Sorry sir, I will keep that in my mind.
Translation_En: Sorry, I remember you.

Source_Ja: 謝らなくてもいいけど、次回のために覚えておくように。
Target_En: You don't have to be sorry, just try to remember that for next time.
Translation_En: I don’t want to apologize, but remember it for the next time.

Source_Ja: 皆一緒に仕事してるんだからね。
Target_En: We all work together.
Translation_En: Everyone is working together.

Source_Ja: スコット、ちょっといい？
Target_En: Scott, have you got a minute?
Translation_En: Scott, a little better?

Source_Ja: いいですよ、どうしました？
Target_En: Yes, what's up?
Translation_En: OK, what did you do?

Source_Ja: ちょっとお願いがあるんだけど、いいかしら。
Target_En: I was wondering if you could do me a favor.
Translation_En: I have a bit of prayer, but it’s good.

Source_Ja: 内容によります。
Target_En: That depends what it is.
Translation_En: according to the content.

Source_Ja: それが、新サービス宣伝用のパンフをデザインして文面を作るようにジョンに頼まれたんだけど。
Target_En: Well, John has asked me to design and write a brochure to promote the new service.
Translation_En: John was asked to design a new service advertising panel and make a text.

Source_Ja: がっかりさせたくはないんだけど、私も来週提出の売上報告書があるし、準備しなくちゃいけない展示会もあるし、今それを引き受ける暇ないのよ。
Target_En: I don't want to let him down, but with the sales reports due for next week and the trade show to prepare for, it's a bit much for me to take on at the moment.
Translation_En: I don’t want to be disappointed, but I also have a sales report to be submitted next week, and there are exhibitions to be prepared, and I don’t have time to take it up now.

Source_Ja: もし、時間があったら、何か手早くできる案がないかなと思って。
