Target_En: If you have the time, I was hoping you might be able to whip something up?
Translation_En: If you have time, I think you can get something quickly.

Source_Ja: 僕の思い違いでなければ、そのプロジェクトを指揮ってませんでしたか？
Target_En: If I remember correctly, weren't you the one who spearheaded that project?
Translation_En: Without my mistake, did you not lead the project?

Source_Ja: だったら、その過程で役に立った人の方がいい仕事をするんじゃないでしょうかね。
Target_En: Surely someone so instrumental in its development would do a better job?
Translation_En: Would it be better for those who are helpful in this process?

Source_Ja: そうだけど、グラフィックデザインは得意じゃないのよ。
Target_En: Yes, but graphic design is not my forte.
Translation_En: But graphic design is not good.

Source_Ja: それに、今は、大事に育ててきた製品をお客さんにお披露目する展示会に全力を注がないといけないの。
Target_En: Plus, I now need to put all my effort into things like the trade show, to help get my baby released to consumers.
Translation_En: In addition, we need to put all our efforts in the exhibition to showcase the products that we have grown importantly to our customers.

Source_Ja: はーい、わかりましたよ。
Target_En: Okay, I understand.
Translation_En: Oh yeah, I realized it.

Source_Ja: 大丈夫だと思います、そういう仕事は好きだし。
Target_En: It shouldn't be a problem, and I do enjoy that kind of work.
Translation_En: I think it’s okay, I like this job.

Source_Ja: そうよ、M社との契約のときにすごく良いデザインしたの覚えてる。
Target_En: Yes, I remember what a great job you did on the design work for the M contract.
Translation_En: Yes, I remember that I had a very good design during the contract with M.

Source_Ja: あなたに任せておけば、素晴らしく仕上がると思う。
Target_En: I know it will be done well if I leave it in your hands.
Translation_En: If I let you, I think it will be fine.

Source_Ja: はあ、ですが、今、僕、インフルで休んでいるマークの仕事もやっていることを忘れないでくださいよ。
Target_En: Yes, well don't forget I'm also covering for Mark while he's off with the flu.
Translation_En: Oh, but don't forget that I'm still doing the job of Mark, who's on vacation now.

Source_Ja: もし、マークの取引先から何か来たら、そちらの仕事を優先しますよ。
Target_En: If anything comes through from one of his clients, that will have to take priority.
Translation_En: If something comes from the trade point, you will prioritize your job.

Source_Ja: はい、もちろん。
Target_En: Yes, of course.
Translation_En: Yes of course.

Source_Ja: 今日、昼食後から始めらるか確認してみます。
Target_En: I'll see if I can make a start after lunch today.
Translation_En: Let’s check if it starts after lunch.

Source_Ja: ありがとうスコット、すごく助かる。
Target_En: Thanks Scott, I really appreciate it.
Translation_En: Thank you Scott, it is very helpful.

Source_Ja: 何か質問があったらいつでも聞いて。
Target_En: I'll be on hand if you have any questions.
Translation_En: Ask them whenever you have any questions.

Source_Ja: 準備でちょっと外出するから、メールで連絡してもらうことになるかも。
Target_En: I'll be out of the office for a bit with the preparations, so you might have to reach me by email.
Translation_En: I'm ready to get out, so you may be contacted by email.

Source_Ja: わかりました、大丈夫です。
Target_En: No worries.
Translation_En: I understand, it’s okay.

Source_Ja: さて、皆に集まってもらって、進捗状況を聞きたかったのです。
Target_En: So, I just wanted to touch base with everyone, and see what stage everyone is at.
Translation_En: I wanted to get together and hear about the progress.

Source_Ja: シモーヌ、メーカー探しはうまくいってるかい？
Target_En: Simone, how's it going sourcing a manufacturer?
Translation_En: Simone, are you looking for a maker?

Source_Ja: 順調です、中国に強力な見込み会社がいます。
Target_En: Pretty good, I have some promising leads in China.
Translation_En: Well, we have a strong potential company in China.

Source_Ja: 連絡をとった工場は、送ったデザインをもとにCNC装置で必要な型を作れることがかなり確実なようです。
Target_En: One factory I spoke to is pretty confident they can create the shapes we require with their CNC machines, based on the designs I sent them.
Translation_En: The contacted factory seems quite sure to be able to make the necessary type with the CNC device based on the design sent.

Source_Ja: そこの会社、デザインがかなり初期段階のものだと知ってるんだよね？
Target_En: They know the designs are a very early work in progress though, right?
Translation_En: You know that the design is a very early stage, right?

Source_Ja: 最終的なデザインはかなり違ったものになりそうだけど。
Target_En: The final design is likely to be quite different.
Translation_En: The final design will be quite different.

Source_Ja: ええ、そのことは伝えてありますし、最終的なデザインがどのような感じになりそうかわかったときに特注治具をデザインすればいいのではと提案していました。
Target_En: Yes, I made them aware of that, and they suggested we also design a custom jig when we know what the final design will look like.
Translation_En: Yes, I told you that, and I suggested that you should design special equipment when you know how the final design will feel.

Source_Ja: ふむふむ、いい案だな。
Target_En: Hmm, that's a good idea.
Translation_En: Well, it’s a good idea.

Source_Ja: そうなんです、そうすれば、向こうもすぐに生産に入れますね。
Target_En: Yeah, it would help them get the production started right away.
Translation_En: Yes, so you will be able to get into production right away.

Source_Ja: アサ、君のチームはどうなってる？
Target_En: Now, Asa, what's been going on in your team?
Translation_En: Asha, what’s going on with your team?

Source_Ja: えー、先週初めの段階で、予定より遅れていたんです。
Target_En: Well, at the beginning of last week, we fell behind schedule.
Translation_En: At the beginning of last week, it was late than planned.

Source_Ja: チームのメンバーとは既に話し合って、より良いやり方を決めましたので、金曜日には遅れを取り戻しました。
Target_En: This is something I've already discussed with my team, and we came up with some better practices, and were back on track by Friday.
Translation_En: We have already talked with the team members and decided a better way, so we came back late on Friday.

Source_Ja: 良かった。
Target_En: That's great.
Translation_En: It was good.

Source_Ja: それで、火曜日に一般客を招いて、いろいろな素材や色の組み合わせを試してもらい、いろいろな特徴も説明しました。
Target_En: Then, on Tuesday, we invited some members of the public to come and trial the different materials and color combinations, and we explained the various features.
Translation_En: So on Tuesday, we invited the general guests to try a variety of materials and colour combinations, and explained a variety of features.

Source_Ja: すごく貴重なフィードバックももらえたので、デザインチームとも共有しておきました。
Target_En: We gained some really valuable feedback, which we have shared with the design team.
Translation_En: We received a very valuable feedback, so we shared it with the design team.

Source_Ja: そう、イアンは今日は参加できなかったんだが、その件に関しては繰り返し感謝してたよ。
Target_En: Yes, Ian couldn't make it today, but he wanted to reiterate how grateful he was for that.
Translation_En: Yes, Ian couldn't participate today, but I was thankful again and again for that.

Source_Ja: フィードバックを聞いて、彼もチームも正しい方向に向かっていると確信できたと言ってたし、次に取り掛かるべきことについて指示したそうだ。
Target_En: He said the feedback gave him and his team confidence that they are moving in the right direction, and has informed them what they need to focus on next.
Translation_En: He heard the feedback and said he could be sure he and the team are going in the right direction, and he told me what to do next.

Source_Ja: 良かったです。
Target_En: Great.
Translation_En: It was good.

Source_Ja: 最後に、バネッサ、何か共有することはありますか？
Target_En: Lastly, Vanessa, do you have anything to share?
Translation_En: Finally, Vancouver, do you have anything to share?

Source_Ja: えーと、皆さんご存知のとおり、商品名についてすごく良いブレーンストーミングのセッションができまして、当社のブランドとコンセプトをとてもよく反映している候補名がいくつか上がりました。
Target_En: Well, as you all know, we had a great brainstorming session for the product name, and came up with some options that we thought reflected our brand and the concept really well.
Translation_En: Well, as you all know, there was a very good brand-stoming session about the brand name, and there were a few candidates that very well reflect our brand and concept.

Source_Ja: そうか。
Target_En: Yes.
Translation_En: And yes.

Source_Ja: ですが、残念なことに、一押しだった候補については、既に同じ商品名があるということで、その後法務部から連絡を受けて却下されました。
Target_En: Unfortunately, the legal team has since got back to us and rejected our number one candidate, as there is already a product with that name.
Translation_En: However, unfortunately, the one-pressed candidate has already the same product name and was later contacted by the Department of Justice and rejected.

Source_Ja: そして、もう一つの有力候補はスペイン語では下品とみなされるようで、振り出しに戻ってしまいました。
Target_En: Another favorite could apparently be deemed offensive in Spanish, so it looks like it's back to the drawing board.
Translation_En: And another powerful candidate appeared to be considered a low product in Spanish, and returned to the outskirts.

Source_Ja: 心配するな、まだ時間はある。
Target_En: Not to worry, it's still early days.
Translation_En: Don’t worry, there’s still time.

Source_Ja: さて、この辺で切り上げるとするかな。
Target_En: Right, let's wrap it up there.
Translation_En: So, you can cut it around here.

Source_Ja: ２週間後にまた集まって、進捗を報告してもらいます。
Target_En: We'll reconvene in 2 weeks to share what progress we've made.
Translation_En: We will meet again in two weeks to report the progress.

Source_Ja: A社からもう返事は来た？
Target_En: Did you hear back from Company A yet?
Translation_En: Have you received an answer from the company?

Source_Ja: いや、まだなんです。
Target_En: No, not yet.
Translation_En: No, it is still.

Source_Ja: メールは先週送りました。
Target_En: I sent them an email last week.
Translation_En: I sent the email last week.

Source_Ja: もし返事がなかったら今週金曜日にフォローアップする予定なんです。
Target_En: I'm planning to follow up with them on Friday this week if I don't hear back.
Translation_En: If you don’t answer, I’m going to follow you on Friday this week.

Source_Ja: 先方に電話してみるのは？
Target_En: Why don't you try calling them?
Translation_En: Do you try to call before?

Source_Ja: 実は担当者さんが今週は国外にいるので、メールに返信もらえるのを期待してたんです。
Target_En: Actually the person in charge is out of the country this week so I was hoping he'd reply my email.
Translation_En: In fact, the officer was abroad this week, so I was looking forward to receiving an email.

Source_Ja: 彼は今ヨーロッパに居て、電話で連絡するのはちょっと難しいんですよ。
Target_En: He's in Europe right now and it's a bit hard to reach him by phone.
Translation_En: He is now in Europe and it’s a bit difficult to contact by telephone.

Source_Ja: というか、自分が出張の時に誰から電話かかってきてほしくないんですよね。
Target_En: I mean, I wouldn't want someone calling me when I'm on a business trip.
Translation_En: You don’t want to call anyone when you’re on your trip.

Source_Ja: 特に寝てるときとか。
Target_En: Especially when I'm sleeping or something.
Translation_En: Especially when you sleep.

Source_Ja: そうか、それはそうだな。
Target_En: Okay, fair enough.
Translation_En: Yes, that is yes.

Source_Ja: でもこの件、フォローアップをするの忘れないように。
Target_En: Be sure to follow up on this though.
Translation_En: But don’t forget to follow this.

Source_Ja: 東京でうちのチームが返事を待ってるから、少なくとも今週末までにどうなっているか連絡したほうがいい。
Target_En: Our team in Tokyo has been waiting for a reply and we should at least let them know what is up by the end of this week.
Translation_En: Our team in Tokyo is waiting for an answer, so it is better to know what’s going on at least this weekend.

Source_Ja: はい、わかりました。
Target_En: Yes, I understand.
Translation_En: Yes I realized.

Source_Ja: どちらにしても金曜日に東京のチームに報告します。
Target_En: I'll update the team in Tokyo on Friday regardless.
Translation_En: We will report to the team on Friday.

Source_Ja: ありがとう。
Target_En: Thank you.
Translation_En: thank you.

Source_Ja: やあローラ、今ちょっといい？
Target_En: Hey Laura, can we talk for a bit now?
Translation_En: Laura, is it a bit better now?

Source_Ja: うん、いいよ！
Target_En: Yeah, sure!
Translation_En: Yes, it is OK!

Source_Ja: 良かった。
Target_En: Great.
Translation_En: It was good.

Source_Ja: あっ、そういえば、お休みどうだった？
Target_En: Oh by the way, how was your holiday?
Translation_En: So, what about your vacation?

Source_Ja: リスボン楽しめた？
Target_En: Did you enjoy Lisbon?
Translation_En: Have you Lisbon?

Source_Ja: すっごく良かった！
Target_En: Oh it was brilliant!
Translation_En: It was very good!

Source_Ja: 天気は最高、ご飯も美味しいしみんな優しくて！
Target_En: The weather was perfect, food was great, people were all so nice!
Translation_En: The weather is great, the food is delicious and everyone is gentle!

Source_Ja: ポールはエッグタルトにハマって滞在中毎日最低3個は食べてた。
Target_En: Paul got himself addicted to the egg tarts and he was eating at least 3 everyday throughout the stay.
Translation_En: Paul eaten at least three foods a day during his stay.

Source_Ja: あはは！
Target_En: Haha!
Translation_En: It is!

Source_Ja: 最近は家でも作ろうとしてレシピをひたすらググってるわ。
Target_En: He's now relentlessly googling the recipe so that he can recreate it.
Translation_En: Recently, I have been trying to make a recipe at home.

Source_Ja: いいね！
Target_En: Oh that's nice!
Translation_En: Well well!

Source_Ja: 僕の分も作ってくれるように言っといて。
Target_En: Make sure he cooks some for me too.
Translation_En: Tell me to make my part.

Source_Ja: もちろん！
Target_En: Definitely!
Translation_En: of course!

Source_Ja: オッケー、えっと、来週にT社とのミーティングをしたくて、君がいつ空いてるか知りたかったんだよね。
Target_En: Ok, so, I wanted to set a meeting with Company T next week and I was wondering when you would be available to attend.
Translation_En: Okay, yeah, I want to meet with the company next week and you want to know when you are free.

Source_Ja: 先方はいつでも大丈夫みたいだから、僕たちの都合で決めていい。
Target_En: Basically they can do any day so it's up to us.
Translation_En: We always think it’s okay, so we can choose it for us.

Source_Ja: ああ、そうだよね、外に出れる日が、ちょっと待ってね、予定確認する。
Target_En: Oh yeah, I will be able to go out, give me a sec, let me check my schedule.
Translation_En: Oh yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah.

Source_Ja: オッケー、水曜日と木曜日は外出できる。
Target_En: Ok, I can do Wednesday and Thursday.
Translation_En: OK, you can go out on Wednesday and Thursday.

Source_Ja: 金曜日も午後2時以降なら。
Target_En: Also Friday but only after 2 p.m.
Translation_En: Friday after 2 p.m.

Source_Ja: 午前中はずっと会議で、その後すぐ指導担当の後輩とランチの約束があるんだ。
Target_En: I will have a meeting all morning and a lunch appointment with my trainee right after that.
Translation_En: In the morning there is a meeting, and immediately afterwards there is a promise for lunch with the instructor's followers.

Source_Ja: 了解、ありがとう！
Target_En: Ok thanks!
Translation_En: I understand, thank you!

Source_Ja: 僕も水曜日空いてるからちょうどいいや。
Target_En: I can do Wednesday too so that's great.
Translation_En: I’m free on Wednesday, so well.

Source_Ja: 先方にメールで伝えて、時間が決まったらまた言うね。
Target_En: I will email them then set the time and let you know.
Translation_En: I'll tell you by email, and I'll tell you again when the time is fixed.

Source_Ja: 了解。
Target_En: Ok, sounds great.
Translation_En: to understand.

Source_Ja: ミーティングまでに必要な書類のリストをリマインドのために自分たち宛に送っておくね。
Target_En: I will send us the list of documents we need by then to remind us.
Translation_En: Send a list of documents you need before the meeting to Remastered.

Source_Ja: ありがとう！
Target_En: Thanks!
Translation_En: Thank you!

Source_Ja: すみません、新しい文房具がほしいんですけど。
Target_En: Excuse me, I would like to get some stationery.
Translation_En: Sorry, I want a new room.

Source_Ja: どんな種類の文房具？
Target_En: What kind of stationery?
Translation_En: What kind of room equipment?

Source_Ja: 赤い水性サインペンが欲しいんだけど。
Target_En: I want a red non-permanent marker.
Translation_En: I want a red water signature.

Source_Ja: 備品棚に在庫なかった？
Target_En: Didn't you see it on the supply shelf?
Translation_En: Do you have no stock in the warehouse?

Source_Ja: 探してみたんだけど見つからなくって。
Target_En: I looked for it but didn't find it.
Translation_En: I tried it, but I didn’t find it.

Source_Ja: 倉庫に在庫があるかもしれない。
Target_En: We might have some in the storage.
Translation_En: There may be a stock in the warehouse.

Source_Ja: すぐに必要？
Target_En: Do you need it soon?
Translation_En: Needed immediately?

Source_Ja: できれば早めに欲しいな。
Target_En: The sooner the better.
Translation_En: If you can, want it early.

Source_Ja: じゃあ、今見てくるけど。
Target_En: Ok, I will go see it now.
Translation_En: So, I will see it now.

Source_Ja: お願いします。
Target_En: Please do.
Translation_En: Please please.

Source_Ja: それと、ついでにもう一ついい？
Target_En: Can I ask you one more favor?
Translation_En: And finally another good thing?

Source_Ja: 何？
Target_En: What is it?
Translation_En: What is?

Source_Ja: こっちは急ぎじゃないんだけど、ハサミも新しいのが欲しい。
Target_En: This is no rush, but I would like a new pair of scissors.
Translation_En: I don’t have a hurry, but I want something new.

Source_Ja: ハサミも備品棚になくて。
Target_En: There weren't any scissors on the supply shelf either.
Translation_En: I don’t want to have a shelf as well.

Source_Ja: 新しいハサミは備品棚に置いてないよ。
Target_En: We don't keep new scissors on the supply shelf.
Translation_En: The new shells are not placed in the warehouse.

Source_Ja: 備品棚においてあるのは基本的に消耗品だから。
Target_En: We only keep consumable goods on the supply shelf.
Translation_En: In the warehouses, it is essentially consumption.

Source_Ja: そうなんだ、どうすればいい？
Target_En: I see, what should I do?
Translation_En: Yes, what should I do?

Source_Ja: サインペンと一緒に倉庫の在庫を見てみるよ。
Target_En: I will see if there are some along with markers.
Translation_En: Take a look at the warehouse with the signature.

Source_Ja: もしあったら、すぐに渡せるけど。
Target_En: I will get a pair for you right away if there are any.
Translation_En: If so, I can give it immediately.

Source_Ja: なかったら業者に今日発注するから、明後日届くと思う。
Target_En: If not, I will place an order from the supply company and should receive them tomorrow.
Translation_En: If not, I will order to the supplier today and I hope it will arrive later.

Source_Ja: 了解です。
Target_En: I gotcha.
Translation_En: I understand.

Source_Ja: あ、そうだ、備品棚の持ち出し表、全部の欄が埋まってたよ。
Target_En: Oh, another thing, the take-out chart was completely filled.
Translation_En: Oh yeah, the output tables, all the boxes were filled.

Source_Ja: 新しい用紙を出しておいた方がいいよ。
Target_En: You should probably get a new one out.
Translation_En: You should have a new paper.

Source_Ja: ありがとう、早速やっておくよ。
Target_En: Thank you, I will get to it right away.
Translation_En: Thank you, I will do it quickly.

Source_Ja: うちの会社のエントランスって殺風景ですよね。
Target_En: Isn't the entrance to our company a little drab?
Translation_En: The entrance of our company is a murder scene.

Source_Ja: 掃除はしているけど、シンプル過ぎるっていうか。
Target_En: It gets cleaned regularly but it is too plain.
Translation_En: I’m cleaning it, but it’s too simple.

Source_Ja: まぁ、華やかな感じじゃないよね。
Target_En: Well, it's definitely not vibrant.
Translation_En: Well, it doesn’t feel great, right?

Source_Ja: エントランス入ったら、社名があって応接セットと内線電話だけですからね。
Target_En: When you come into the entrance, all you see is the company name, the reception furniture, and the telephone.
Translation_En: If you enter the entrance, there is a company name and only the contact set and the internal phone.

Source_Ja: 一応、観葉植物もあるけどね。
Target_En: Well, a plant is there too.
Translation_En: Of course, there are also plants.

Source_Ja: でも、この観葉植物も会社が移転した時に取引先からお祝いで頂いたものですし。
Target_En: But we got this plant as a gift from our client when our office moved.
Translation_En: However, this plant is also celebrated when the company moved.

Source_Ja: ちょっと枯れてきちゃっている部分もありますよね。
Target_En: Some of the leaves are dying though.
Translation_En: Some of them are somewhat dead.

Source_Ja: 高田さんは、結構色んな会社訪問してるじゃないですか？
Target_En: Takada-san, you have visited many companies, haven't you?
Translation_En: Do you think Mr. Goethe is visiting a lot of companies?

Source_Ja: 印象に残っている会社のエントランスとかあります？
Target_En: Do you remember any company that has an impressive entrance?
Translation_En: Is there any entrance of the company that remains impressed?

Source_Ja: 会社の規模によって全然違うから、一概にうちの参考にはならないけど。
Target_En: Since it varies greatly depending on the size of a company, it might not be very useful.
Translation_En: This is completely different from the size of the company, but it is not our reference.

Source_Ja: 今までで一番インパクトがあったのは、J証券かな。
Target_En: The most impressive one by far is J brokerage.
Translation_En: The biggest impact ever was the J Securities.

Source_Ja: 外資系の大手投資銀行だから、全く参考にはならないんだけど。
Target_En: It is a large international brokerage firm, so it's not helpful to compare though.
Translation_En: As a major foreign investment bank, I don’t know anything about it.

Source_Ja: どんな感じなんですか？
Target_En: How was it?
Translation_En: How do you feel?

Source_Ja: ワンフロアすべて受付。
Target_En: The whole floor is dedicated to the reception area.
Translation_En: One floor is all accepted.

Source_Ja: しかも、東京駅隣接のビルの１８階で一面ガラス張りだから見張らしのいいこと、いいこと。
Target_En: In addition, it's 18th floor of a building that is right next to Tokyo Station with glass windows, which offers a breathtaking view.
Translation_En: Also, the 18th floor of the building near the Tokyo Station is one side of the glass, so it’s a good thing to watch, a good thing.

Source_Ja: 受付のカウンターに女性が２人座っていて、受付が終わるとホテルのロビーの用なソファーに案内されて。
Target_En: There are two female receptionists sitting at the front desk, and once you sign in, you will be guided to the sofa in an area that reminds you of a hotel lobby.
Translation_En: Two women were sitting in the reception countryside, and when the reception ended, they were guided to the sofa for the lobby of the hotel.

Source_Ja: オフィスフロアに案内されるまで、優雅に待つという。
Target_En: You can wait elegantly until you get guided to the office floor.
Translation_En: Wait elegantly until you are brought to the office floor.

Source_Ja: 高級ホテル並みのホスピタリティ。
Target_En: As hospitable as a luxury hotel.
Translation_En: A luxury hotel hospitality.

Source_Ja: それは凄すぎますね。
Target_En: That sounds awesome.
Translation_En: It is too great, right?

Source_Ja: じゃあ、もうちょっと身の丈にあったレベルで、よかったと思った会社はありますか？
Target_En: Can you think of any company that is more like our level then?
Translation_En: So, is there any company that you thought it was a good level?

Source_Ja: 外資系ヘッジファンドのH投資顧問かな。
Target_En: Foreign hedge fund managing company H might be it.
Translation_En: Investment Advisor of the Foreign Investment Fund.

Source_Ja: どんな感じでした？
Target_En: How was it?
Translation_En: How was it feeling?

Source_Ja: 日比谷のホテルに隣接しているオフィス棟に入っているんだけど。
Target_En: It's in a building adjacent to a hotel in Hibiya.
Translation_En: I am in the office building next to the hotel.

Source_Ja: そんなにエントランスが広いわけではなく、ちょうどうちの会社くらい。
Target_En: The entrance isn't that big, it's probably the same size as ours.
Translation_En: Not so large entrances, but just as large as the company.

Source_Ja: とにかく品があったよ。
Target_En: It is very classy.
Translation_En: There were goods anyway.

Source_Ja: ドアを開けると、社名のロゴが掛かっていて、ガラスのテーブルに内線電話があったよ。
Target_En: When you open the door, you see the company logo hung up and a telephone placed on a glass table.
Translation_En: When the door was opened, the company’s logo was hanged and there was an internal phone on the glass table.

Source_Ja: うちと一緒じゃないですか。
Target_En: That sounds pretty similar to ours.
Translation_En: Are you not with us?

Source_Ja: あと、大きな花瓶にいつも生花のアレンジがあって、いい香りがするんだよね。
Target_En: And there was a fresh flower arrangement in a large vase, and it smelled wonderful.
Translation_En: There is always a large flower in the bottle and it smells good.

Source_Ja: きつい香りじゃなくて、ほんのりフローラル。
Target_En: It wasn't overpowering, just enough floral scent.
Translation_En: Not a hard smell, but a flower.

Source_Ja: 嗅覚をくすぐるの、有効ですよね。
Target_En: Olfactory stimulation can be useful.
Translation_En: It makes you smell, it works.

Source_Ja: 生花のアレンジメントを飾るくらいだったら、うちも真似できるじゃないですか？
Target_En: Can we borrow their idea and add a fresh flower arrangement?
Translation_En: If we were to decorate the flowers, can we do it too?

Source_Ja: じゃあ、ちょっと片付けて試験的にやってみる？
Target_En: Then should we straighten up and do it as a trial?
Translation_En: Would you try to clean it and test it?

Source_Ja: 周りの反応を見てみようかな。
Target_En: Let's see how people react to it.
Translation_En: Let’s look at the reaction around.

Source_Ja: いいですね、やってみましょうよ。
Target_En: Sounds good, let's do it.
Translation_En: OK, let’s try it.

Source_Ja: 野田さん、ちょっとご相談なんですけど。
Target_En: Noda-san, can I ask you something?
Translation_En: Nora, I want to talk to you a little.

Source_Ja: はいはい、何でしょう？
Target_En: Yes, what is it?
Translation_En: Yes yes, what is it?

Source_Ja: 来月１５日に、A証券さんが本社移転するんだよね。
Target_En: My client, A Securities, is moving their headquarters on the fifteenth of next month.
Translation_En: On the 15th of May, the company will be transferred.

Source_Ja: 御祝を贈りたいんだけど、どうすればいい？
Target_En: I'd like to send them a gift.
Translation_En: I want to give you a gift, but what do I do?

Source_Ja: 品物と予算は決まっているんですか？
Target_En: Do you know what you want to send and how much you want to spend?
Translation_En: Are the goods and budgets fixed?

Source_Ja: いや、逆にいつも何を贈っているのかなと思って。
Target_En: I was wondering what you always send out as gifts..
Translation_En: I always wonder what you’re giving.

Source_Ja: そうですね、オフィス移転の場合は観葉植物が多いでしょうか？
Target_En: For a move, how about a decorative indoor plant?
Translation_En: Yes, if you move to the office, do you see a lot of plants?

Source_Ja: グリーンレンタルの業者を利用している会社も多いですけど、喜ばれますよ。
Target_En: There are many firms who rent potted plants for their offices, but most still seem very happy to receive something like that as a gift.
Translation_En: There are many companies that use Green Rental, but you will be happy.

Source_Ja: 特に、会議室や応接室が沢山あるオフィスだとインテリアとして重宝されますよ。
Target_En: Especially if they have many conference and meeting rooms, they are perfect as decorations.
Translation_En: Especially if there are a lot of meeting rooms and reception rooms in the office, it will be valued as an interior.

Source_Ja: それに、観葉植物だと長期間置いてもらえますからね。
Target_En: They also last for a long time.
Translation_En: You will also be able to leave it as a plant for a long time.

Source_Ja: あと、贈り主の名前が入った立て札を付けたままにしてあると、当社の名前がその会社に訪れた方の目につきますしね。
Target_En: We can also add a plaque with our company name with the gift which will show their visiting clients our relationship.
Translation_En: Then, if you keep the name of the donor on the list, the name of our company will be seen in the eyes of the person who visited the company.

Source_Ja: なるほどね。
Target_En: I see.
Translation_En: Well as well.

Source_Ja: 種類でいうと、パキラやユッカ、ベンジャミンなんかが多いですかね。
Target_En: We usually choose pachira, yucca and ficus benjamina...
Translation_En: There are many kinds of paquila, yucca, and benjamins.

Source_Ja: 予算は１万５千円から２万円くらいでしょうか。
Target_En: Our budget is usually somewhere between 15,000 and 20,000 yen.
Translation_En: The budget is about 15,000 yen to 20,000 yen.

Source_Ja: 種類を言われても想像できないけど、うちのエントランスにあるような植物って感じ？
Target_En: I'm not familiar with those plants but are they like the ones in our entrance lobby?
Translation_En: I can’t imagine the species, but it feels like a plant in our entrance?

Source_Ja: そうですね、無難な感じです。
Target_En: Yes, something pretty ordinary.
Translation_En: Yes, it feels difficult.

Source_Ja: じゃあ、予算は１万５千円で、種類は任せるよ。
Target_En: You can choose which kind and let's spend 15,000 yen.
Translation_En: The budget is 15,000 yuan, and you can do it.

Source_Ja: ちょっと大きい鉢植えを１つ贈っておいてくれる？
Target_En: Let's also choose a big planter for it.
Translation_En: Can you give me a small plant?

Source_Ja: 了解しました。
Target_En: OK, I will do that.
Translation_En: I understood.

Source_Ja: 立て札に記入する名前はどうしましょう？
Target_En: What name should I ask to put on the plaque?
Translation_En: What is the name to fill in the list?

Source_Ja: 社長名でよろしく。
Target_En: Please put the president's name.
Translation_En: Congratulations on the name of the President.

Source_Ja: わかりました、早速手配しておきます。
Target_En: Got it, I will make arrangements immediately.
Translation_En: I know, I will order it quickly.

Source_Ja: 今日からこちらでお世話になる小泉です、よろしくお願いします。
Target_En: My name is Koizumi, pleased to meet you, I am starting today.
Translation_En: I am here to help you from today, please.

Source_Ja: 新人研修担当の武藤です、よろしくお願いします。
Target_En: I am Muto, in charge of new recruits, pleased to meet you as well.
Translation_En: I am a new coach, please.

Source_Ja: ではまず小泉さん、調理場に入る前にこの帽子を被ってください。
Target_En: Koizumi san, please wear this hat before entering the kitchen.
Translation_En: Please wear this hat before you go to the kitchen.

Source_Ja: 髪の毛がはみ出ないように帽子に全部髪の毛を入れてくださいね。
Target_En: Please make sure that no hair is showing.
Translation_En: Put all your hair in the hat so that your hair doesn’t come out.

Source_Ja: 髪のピン留めは付けてて大丈夫ですか？
Target_En: Is it OK to put hair clips in?
Translation_En: Do you have a pin on your hair and is it okay?

Source_Ja: 帽子の中に入っていれば問題ありませんよ。
Target_En: As long as it's inside the hat.
Translation_En: If you’re in the hat, there’s no problem.

Source_Ja: 次に石鹸で3分間しっかり手を洗ってからアルコールを手に吹き付けてください。
Target_En: Next please properly wash your hands with soap for 3 minutes before disinfecting with alcohol.
Translation_En: Then wash your hands with soap for 3 minutes and then blow the alcohol into your hands.

Source_Ja: こんなに徹底した衛生管理を行うんですね。
Target_En: You take such care of hygiene!
Translation_En: You have such a thorough health care.

Source_Ja: 食中毒を防ぐためにはなにより衛生管理の徹底が基本ですからね。
Target_En: We basically need perfect hygiene to avoid food poisoning.
Translation_En: For the prevention of food poisoning, health care is essential.

Source_Ja: じゃあまずはお弁当のご飯から盛っていきましょう。
Target_En: Let start packing rice for the bento boxes.
Translation_En: Let us start with the meal.

Source_Ja: 炊飯器から200グラム、この計りで量ってこの容器にいれてもらえますか？
Target_En: Will you scoop 200 grams of rice, weigh it on this scale, and put it into the container?
Translation_En: Can I get 200 grams of the cooking machine, with this measurement, in this container?

Source_Ja: 200グラムぴったりって難しいですね。
Target_En: It's hard to be exactly 200 grams.
Translation_En: 200 grams is hard.

Source_Ja: 215グラム以内だったら誤差は気にしなくて大丈夫ですよ。
Target_En: As long as it's within 215 grams, don't worry about the difference.
Translation_En: If you’re less than 215 grams, it’s okay not to worry about the error.

Source_Ja: ただし少ないのは厳禁です。
Target_En: But make sure it is not less.
Translation_En: But little is strictly prohibited.

Source_Ja: たまにお客さんで家でご飯の量を量って足りないとクレーム出す人がいるんです。
Target_En: Otherwise, some customers weigh the amount of rice and complain that there isn't enough.
Translation_En: Sometimes there are people who don’t have enough food at home.

Source_Ja: わかりました、気をつけます。
Target_En: I understand and will be careful.
Translation_En: I understand, be careful.

Source_Ja: ご飯が盛れたらこの湯煎されたレトルトの具をご飯の上に載せてください。
Target_En: After the rice, put this heated the boil-in-the-bag ingredient onto the rice.
Translation_En: When the meal is filled, put the baked potato on the meal.

Source_Ja: これは何のどんぶりを作っているんでしょうか？
Target_En: What dish are we making?
Translation_En: What does this make?

Source_Ja: 中華丼ですね、うちのスーパーの人気商品です。
Target_En: A Chinese donburi which is one of the most popular product at our supermarket.
Translation_En: Chinese rice is our super popular product.

Source_Ja: 載せました、これで良いでしょうか？
Target_En: Here it is, is this good?
Translation_En: I posted it, can it be this?

Source_Ja: これだと真ん中に具が固まっているのでご飯の上に均等に載るようにしてください。
Target_En: The topping is all in the middle, make sure it's spread evenly over the rice.
Translation_En: This means that the piece is fixed in the middle, so make sure it is equally placed on the meal.

Source_Ja: 最後に右端に漬物を乗せたら蓋を閉じます。
Target_En: Please place the pickles on the right side and then put a lid on it.
Translation_En: And when you put it on the right side, it will be closed.

Source_Ja: これで完成でしょうか？
Target_En: Is this done?
Translation_En: Will this be finished?

Source_Ja: いいえ、商品シールを貼ります。
Target_En: No, we still need to put the product sticker on.
Translation_En: No, I will put the product seal.

Source_Ja: この中華弁当500円って書いたシールでしょうか？
Target_En: Is it this "Chinese bento box 500 yen" sticker?
Translation_En: Do you want to write about the 500 yen Chinese meal?

Source_Ja: いえ、これは中華弁当ではなくて中華丼です。
Target_En: No, this is a "Chinese bowl" not a "Chinese bento box".
Translation_En: This is not a Chinese meal, but a Chinese rice.

Source_Ja: シールの貼り間違いが最近多く起きているので品名と値段はしっかり確認してください。
Target_En: People have been applying the stickers inconsistently recently so please make sure that you're matching the stickers and food correctly.
Translation_En: There are many mistakes that have occurred recently, so check the name and price thoroughly.

Source_Ja: わかりました、シールは容器のどのあたりに貼るって決まってるんですか？
Target_En: I will be careful, is there a particular position for the stickers?
Translation_En: Do you know where the seal is placed around the container?

Source_Ja: 中身が見えるように、シールは邪魔にならない右端でお願いします。
Target_En: Yes, always make sure the sticker is visible the right hand side.
Translation_En: As you can see inside, the seal will not interfere with the right edge.

Source_Ja: これで出来上がりなので、出来上がったら売り場に並べます。
Target_En: So as this is done, we bring it out to the counter.
Translation_En: I’m going to go out, so when I get out, I’m going to sell it.

Source_Ja: 並べる場所は決まってるんでしょうか？
Target_En: Any place in particular?
Translation_En: Is there a place to arrange?

Source_Ja: エビチリやチャーハンの並んでいる中華コーナーに並べてください。
Target_En: Please place it with the rest of the Chinese food in the corner with the chili shrimps and fried rice.
Translation_En: Please arrange it to the Chinese corner on the side of Ebichili and Chahan.

Source_Ja: 中華コーナー内であればどこに並べても大丈夫ですよ。
Target_En: Anywhere in that section should be fine.
Translation_En: Wherever you are in the Chinese corner, it’s okay.

Source_Ja: 作ったばかりの商品は同じ商品が並んでいれば後ろに並べた方がいいんですよね。
Target_En: We just made this one so should it go to the back of the shelf?
Translation_En: If the goods you have just made are the same goods, it is better to put them on the back.

Source_Ja: 通常のスーパーなら先入先出なのでそうなると思います。
Target_En: Normally, most supermarkets apply a first in first out system.
Translation_En: If you are a regular supervisor, I think that will be the first time.

Source_Ja: うちのスーパーは作りたての新しいものを提供することで他と差別化しています。
Target_En: We differentiate ourselves from other supermarkets by providing freshly made ones.
Translation_En: Our supermarkets are discriminating with others by offering something new that we have created.

Source_Ja: なので新しいものは古いものより手前に並べてください。
Target_En: Please place the newly made items in front of the older ones.
Translation_En: So put the new things in front of the old.

Source_Ja: わかりました、並べてきました。
Target_En: I understand, I went and placed it with the rest of them.
Translation_En: I realized, I got together.

Source_Ja: では同じ中華丼をあと10個作ってください。
Target_En: OK then, please make 10 more of the same "Chinese donburi".
Translation_En: Make the same Chinese rice 10 more.

Source_Ja: わかりました。
Target_En: Alright.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: お疲れ様、田中さん。
Target_En: How are you Tanaka-san.
Translation_En: Congratulations to you, Mr. Tango.

Source_Ja: お疲れ様です、船越さん。
Target_En: How are you Funakoshi-san.
Translation_En: Congratulations to you, Shipman.

Source_Ja: あのさ、春季カタログの印刷締め切りを14日に繰り上げたいんだ。
Target_En: By the way, I'd like to advance the publishing deadline for the spring catalog to the 14th.
Translation_En: I want to start the printing deadline for the spring catalogue on 14 days.

Source_Ja: それまでに家具製品に関するページを仕上げれそう？
Target_En: Do you think you can finish up the page in regards to the furniture products by then?
Translation_En: Can you finish a page about furniture products?

Source_Ja: それは問題ないと思います。
Target_En: I don't think that will be a problem.
Translation_En: I think that is no problem.

Source_Ja: デザイン作業の大半は完了させてあります。
Target_En: Most of the design is already done.
Translation_En: Most of the design work is completed.

Source_Ja: でも、製品価格がまだ決定していなくて...。
Target_En: But the price of the product isn't decided yet.
Translation_En: The price of the product has not yet been determined.

Source_Ja: あ、岡田さん。
Target_En: Oh, Okada-san.
Translation_En: Oh my Oka.

Source_Ja: マーケティング部から最終版の製品価格表受け取りました？
Target_En: Did you get the final version of the product price list from the marketing department?
Translation_En: Have you received the final product price list from the marketing department?

Source_Ja: いや、まだですね。
Target_En: No, not yet.
Translation_En: No, it is still.

Source_Ja: 昨日が提出期限でしたよね。
Target_En: The submission deadline was yesterday, right?
Translation_En: It was a deadline yesterday.

Source_Ja: でも、まだ連絡もらっていませんね。
Target_En: Yet we haven't heard anything yet.
Translation_En: But you have not been contacted yet.

Source_Ja: んー、マーケティング部の者に連絡しておくよ。
Target_En: Hmm, I will contact someone from the marketing department.
Translation_En: Please contact the marketing department.

Source_Ja: そしたら、田中さんがカタログを仕上げられるよね。
Target_En: Then Tanaka-san will be able to finish the catalog, right?
Translation_En: And then Tandy can finish the catalogue.

Source_Ja: はい、助かります。
Target_En: Yes, that would be great.
Translation_En: Yes, I will help.

Source_Ja: うん、カタログは我々の最優先事項だからね。
Target_En: Yeah, the catalog is our top priority.
Translation_En: Yes, because catalogue is our top priority.

Source_Ja: そうですね。
Target_En: Yeah.
Translation_En: Yes is.

Source_Ja: では、よろしくお願いします。
Target_En: Okay, I'll leave that to you.
Translation_En: So please please.

Source_Ja: うん、また連絡するよ。
Target_En: Yeah, I'll contact you later.
Translation_En: Yes, I will contact you again.

Source_Ja: お電話ありがとうございます、M信託銀行証券代行部の渋谷でございます。
Target_En: Thank you for calling, my name is Shibuya from Trust Company M, Transfer Agent Department.
Translation_En: Thank you for calling, I am in the Shibuya Securities Department of M Trust Bank.

Source_Ja: いつもお世話になっております、I社の高田です。
Target_En: Thank you as always, I am Takada from Company I.
Translation_En: I’m always going to help you, I’m the company of Gaddafi.

Source_Ja: 高田様、いつもお世話になっております。
Target_En: Mr. Takada, thank you as always.
Translation_En: Goya, I’m always taking care of you.

Source_Ja: すみません、能勢さんはご在席ですか？
Target_En: Sorry, is Nose-san at his seat?
Translation_En: Sorry, can you be there?

Source_Ja: 能勢でございますね、少々お待ちください。
Target_En: You would like to speak to Nose-san, please hold wait a moment.
Translation_En: You are strong, please wait a little.

Source_Ja: お電話代わりました、能勢です。
Target_En: Thank you for holding, this is Nose.
Translation_En: I call you, I have power.

Source_Ja: あ、能勢さん、高田です。
Target_En: Oh, Nose-san, this is Takada.
Translation_En: Oh, the power, it is Gaddafi.

Source_Ja: 昨日はすみません、外出中でお電話に出れませんで。
Target_En: Sorry about yesterday, I couldn't pick up the phone as I was out.
Translation_En: I'm sorry, I can't call you outside.

Source_Ja: いや、大丈夫。
Target_En: No, it's okay.
Translation_En: No, it is okay.

Source_Ja: お願いしていた資料、送ってくれてありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you for sending the documents I asked for.
Translation_En: Thank you for sending the documents you requested.

Source_Ja: 助かりましたよ。
Target_En: It was helpful.
Translation_En: I helped you.

Source_Ja: あれでよかった？
Target_En: Was that good enough?
Translation_En: Good for that?

Source_Ja: 概略を理解するには十分でしたよ。
Target_En: It was enough to get a general understanding.
Translation_En: It was enough to understand the summary.

Source_Ja: でも、ちょっと具体的に経営陣に話を進めるとなると、少々心もとなくて。
Target_En: But I'm not that confident when it comes to actually proceeding with discussions with the management team.
Translation_En: But if you’re going to talk a little bit specifically to the management, it’s a little bit hard.

Source_Ja: 電話で相談するには際どい内容ですから、直接お会いできませんか？
Target_En: The content is pretty tricky to discuss over the phone so would it be possible to meet in person?
Translation_En: It’s a good thing to talk to you on the phone, can I see you directly?

Source_Ja: 構わないよ。
Target_En: That's fine.
Translation_En: It doesn’t matter.

Source_Ja: 急で恐縮ですが、今週中にどこかお時間いただけませんか？
Target_En: Apologies for the sudden request but could you give me some of your time sometimes this week?
Translation_En: Sorry, but can you get some time this week?

Source_Ja: 明日の午後なら御社に伺えるけど、都合はどう？
Target_En: I can visit your office if it's tomorrow afternoon, does that work with you?
Translation_En: I’m going to go to you tomorrow afternoon, but what’s going on?

Source_Ja: じゃあ、１３時に弊社でいかがでしょう？
Target_En: Okay, how about 1 o'clock in the afternoon at our office.
Translation_En: So what about at 13?

Source_Ja: 了解。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: to understand.

Source_Ja: ちょっとメールでは送れなかった資料も持っていくよ。
Target_En: I will also bring some materials that I can't really send by email.
Translation_En: I will send you some documents that I can't send in an email.

Source_Ja: 助かります、お会いするまでに相談したいことも整理しておきますよ。
Target_En: That will be helpful, I will also review what I want to discuss about by the time we meet.
Translation_En: I will help you, and I will discuss you before we meet you.

Source_Ja: それでは、明日、お待ちしております。
Target_En: Okay, I will wait for you tomorrow.
Translation_En: So tomorrow I’m waiting for you.

Source_Ja: 了解、それじゃあ、失礼します。
Target_En: Okay, alright then, bye now.
Translation_En: I understand, then I apologize.

Source_Ja: お電話ありがとうございます、I社の野田でございます。
Target_En: Thank you for calling company I, this is Noda speaking.
Translation_En: Thank you for calling, I am the company.

Source_Ja: おはようございます、営業部の今井ですが、阿川部長はお席におられますか？
Target_En: Good morning, this is Imai from sales department, is Mr. Akawa available right now?
Translation_En: Good morning, you’re in the office, but are you in the office?

Source_Ja: おはようございます、少々お待ちください。
Target_En: Good morning, hold on one second please.
Translation_En: Good morning, please wait a little.

Source_Ja: はい、阿川です。
Target_En: Hello, this is Akawa.
Translation_En: Yes, it is Achae.

Source_Ja: おはようございます、今井です。
Target_En: Good morning, this is Imai.
Translation_En: Good morning, I am in the shore.

Source_Ja: おはよう、どうした？
Target_En: Good morning, what's going on?
Translation_En: Good morning, what happened?

Source_Ja: すみません、昨晩から発熱しまして、今朝も熱が下がりません。
Target_En: I am so sorry to tell you this, I came down with a fever last night and it hasn't broken yet.
Translation_En: Sorry, I had a fever last night and I didn’t get a fever this morning.

Source_Ja: 頭痛もひどいので、今日は休ませていただきたいのですが。
Target_En: I have a terrible headache too, and I am wondering if I can take today off.
Translation_En: I have a headache, so I want you to rest today.

Source_Ja: 大丈夫なの？
Target_En: Are you alright?
Translation_En: Is it okay?

Source_Ja: 時期が時期だし、インフルエンザに罹った？
Target_En: You know it's the flu season, do you think you came down with it?
Translation_En: Is it time for you to get influenza?

Source_Ja: 数日前に息子がインフルエンザを発症したので、もしかしたらそうかもしれません。
Target_En: My son was sick with the flu a few days ago, it is possible.
Translation_En: My son had influenza a few days ago, so maybe so.

Source_Ja: 今日、病院に行ってきます。
Target_En: I am about to go to the clinic.
Translation_En: I am going to the hospital today.

Source_Ja: インフルエンザだったら、しっかり直してから出社してもらいたいし。
Target_En: If you have the flu, I need you to get completely better before coming back to work.
Translation_En: If you have flu, I want you to go out of work.

Source_Ja: 会社のガイドラインで、発症後５日、解熱後２日で出社可になっていると思う。
Target_En: According to our company policy, you can come back 5 days after the onset of the sickness and you have been fever free for 2 days.
Translation_En: According to the company’s guidelines, it is possible to get out of work within 5 days after the start of the disease and 2 days after the deforestation.

Source_Ja: わかりました。
Target_En: I understand.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: 診察結果はまた連絡してもらえるかな？
Target_En: Can you call me back about the diagnosis later?
Translation_En: Can I contact you again for the results?

Source_Ja: 了解しました、ご迷惑をお掛けします。
Target_En: I sure will, and I apologize for the inconvenience my absence may cause.
Translation_En: I know, I will bother you.

Source_Ja: 大丈夫だよ、お大事にして。
Target_En: Don't you worry about that, take care.
Translation_En: It’s okay, take care of it.

Source_Ja: ところで、今日取り急ぎの案件はあるかな？
Target_En: By the way do you have any urgent appointments?
Translation_En: Are there any urgent cases today?

Source_Ja: １件、A社の山田さんとアポイントメントがあります。
Target_En: I have one, an appointment with Mr. Yamada from company A.
Translation_En: One of them is Yama and Yama.

Source_Ja: 私が先方に伺う予定だったのですが。
Target_En: I was supposed to go visit him.
Translation_En: I was planning to go ahead.

Source_Ja: リスケジュールできるものなのか、それとも代理で先方に伺った方がいい？
Target_En: Can it be rescheduled or do we need to send a someone else there?
Translation_En: Is it possible to resume or should I ask an agent before?

Source_Ja: そこまで急ぎの案件ではなく、情報収集を兼ねたご相談ですので、スケジュール変更で大丈夫です。
Target_En: It is not that urgent, just a meeting to gather and exchange information, so it can be rescheduled.
Translation_En: It’s not an urgent case, but a gathering of information, so it’s okay with timetable changes.

Source_Ja: 了解、先方には私から事情を連絡しておくよ。
Target_En: Ok, I will let them know about your situation.
Translation_En: I know, I will contact you in the first place.

Source_Ja: お手数をお掛けします。
Target_En: I appreciate you doing that for me.
Translation_En: I will charge you.

Source_Ja: 気にしないで養生してね。
Target_En: Don't worry, just get better.
Translation_En: Don't worry and feed them.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます、何かあったらご連絡お願いします。
Target_En: Thank you so much, and please call me if something changes.
Translation_En: Thank you, if something happens, please contact me.

Source_Ja: 了解、お大事にね。
Target_En: I got it, take care.
Translation_En: I understand, it is important.

Source_Ja: はい、失礼します。
Target_En: Ok, talk to you later.
Translation_En: Yes I apologize.

Source_Ja: 友井部長、お忙しいところすみません、ちょっとよろしいでしょうか？
Target_En: Tomoi-san, sorry for bothering you but do you have a moment?
Translation_En: I'm sorry you're busy, I'm sorry you're busy.

Source_Ja: あ、野田さん、どうしたの？
Target_En: Oh, Noda-san, what's wrong?
Translation_En: Oh, Madonna, what happened to you?

Source_Ja: 今、私の携帯電話に息子が通っている保育園から電話がありまして。
Target_En: I got a call from the preschool that my son goes to on my cell phone just now.
Translation_En: I got a phone from my child’s care garden.

Source_Ja: 息子が急に発熱したそうで、すぐに迎えに来て欲しいと。
Target_En: It seems my son suddenly got a fever and they are asking me to pick him up right away.
Translation_En: My son had a fever and I wanted him to come.

Source_Ja: 本日これで早退させて頂きたいのですが、よろしいでしょうか？
Target_En: I'd like to call it a day and leave now for today but is that okay?
Translation_En: I want you to get back sooner today, can you?

Source_Ja: それは当然だよ、急いで迎えに行ってあげて。
Target_En: Of course, hurry up and go pick him up.
Translation_En: It’s obvious, go and take them quickly.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます、ご迷惑をお掛けします。
Target_En: Thank you very much and sorry for the inconvenience.
Translation_En: Thank you, I will bother you.

Source_Ja: 帰る前に、今日明日の予定を確認しておきたいんだけど。
Target_En: I'd like to check the schedule for today and tomorrow before you leave.
Translation_En: I want to check the schedule for tomorrow before I go home.

Source_Ja: 特に代理で引き継いでおくこととか、ある？
Target_En: Do you need to handover any tasks in particular?
Translation_En: Is it possible to take over, especially in the agency?

Source_Ja: 息子さんが今日から発熱したなら、明日の出社が難しいかもしれないでしょ？
Target_En: If your son got a fever today, it might be hard for you to come to work tomorrow, right?
Translation_En: If your son has a fever from today, it’s hard to get out of work tomorrow.

Source_Ja: お気遣いありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thank you for your consideration.
Translation_En: Thank you for your concern.

Source_Ja: 今日は社内での事務作業のみで、急ぎの案件はありません。
Target_En: I just have admin work to do at the office today so I don't have anything that has to be done right away.
Translation_En: Today it is only in the office and there is no urgent case.

Source_Ja: 明日は、持株会関連業務で、M証券さんのご担当者が来社予定です。
Target_En: The person in charge at Securities Company M plans on coming to our office tomorrow in regards to work related to stock ownership plan.
Translation_En: Tomorrow, the company’s shareholders are scheduled to come to the company.

Source_Ja: その予定、急ぎじゃないなら、来社予定を変更してもらった方がいい？
Target_En: If that appointment isn't in a rush, why don't you reschedule the meeting?
Translation_En: If you don’t have a hurry, do you need to change your company’s schedule?

Source_Ja: 私から日程変更のご連絡をしておきます。
Target_En: I will contact them to change the date.
Translation_En: I will contact you for the change of schedule.

Source_Ja: じゃあ、それだけ頼んでもいいかな。
Target_En: Then can I just ask you to do that?
Translation_En: So, I can ask you so much.

Source_Ja: もちろんです。
Target_En: Of course.
Translation_En: of course.

Source_Ja: 他は大丈夫そう？
Target_En: Is everything else okay?
Translation_En: The others are okay?

Source_Ja: 特にないと思います。
Target_En: Nothing in particular I think.
Translation_En: I don’t think especially.

Source_Ja: 了解、お大事にね。
Target_En: Okay, take care.
Translation_En: I understand, it is important.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます、それではこれで失礼します。
Target_En: Thank you very much, I'll be leaving now.
Translation_En: Thank you, so I apologize for this.

Source_Ja: それでは、第2回のミーティングを始めたいと思います。
Target_En: I'd like to now begin the second meeting.
Translation_En: I want to start my second meeting.

Source_Ja: 宜しくお願いします。
Target_En: Thank you.
Translation_En: Welcome to please.

Source_Ja: みんな、輸出へのプランを考えてきてくれましたか？
Target_En: Did everyone think about an exporting plan?
Translation_En: Have you thought of an export plan?

Source_Ja: 考えてきたんですが、初めてのことなので中々難しかったです。
Target_En: I did think about it but it was pretty hard as it was my first time.
Translation_En: I thought it was the first time, but it was hard.

Source_Ja: では、小宮君からお願いしてもいいですか？
Target_En: Okay, can we start with you, Komiya-kun?
Translation_En: Can I ask you for a little bit?

Source_Ja: はい、分かりました。
Target_En: Yes, okay.
Translation_En: Yes, I understand it.

Source_Ja: 僕はやはり初回の実験的な輸出であるということから、シンガポールに住む日本人をターゲットとした今日本で販売している商品の輸出が良いのではないかと思います。
Target_En: I still think the first trial export should target Japanese people living in Singapore and export the products we sell in Japan today would be good.
Translation_En: Since I am the first experimental export, I think it is good to export the goods that are now sold in Japan, targeting Japanese people living in Singapore.

Source_Ja: なるほど。

Translation_En: I think this team is not just an intentional meeting and an official team yet, do you have a budget?

Source_Ja: 今後の方向性次第で社長と総務に直談判する形になると思います。

Translation_En: If so, is it really possible that we go to Singapore and distribute samples with local research?

Translation_En: I would like to refer to what kind of thing is sold in the local area, and I would like to hear the local live voice by distributing the samples directly in addition to the Japanese.

Source_Ja: それはいい考えですね、私も賛成です。

Target_En: So we could put a large box and ask the employees to bring in some unwanted tinned or preserved food.

Source_Ja: 実は、うちに使っていないたくさんの缶詰があるんです。

Source_Ja: うちもですよ。

Source_Ja: もしもの時用に買っていて、全然使っていませんでした。
Target_En: I stocked up some for the emergency, but forgot to use them up.

Source_Ja: きっと社内でも、その様な人がたくさんいるでしょうね。
Target_En: Maybe more people in our office are similar.
Translation_En: There will probably be a lot of people like that in the company.

Source_Ja: そうだ。

Source_Ja: もう着れなくなった衣類も持って来てもらったらどうでしょう。

Source_Ja: 特に、子供服は助かると思います。

Source_Ja: 賛成！

Source_Ja: 喜んでもらえることは、間違いないと思います。
