Source_Ja: そうしましょう。
Target_En: Okay, then we'll do.
Translation_En: Let us do it.

Source_Ja: では、社内でドネーションを募るという事に決まりですね。
Target_En: So, we've agreed to ask donation of food and clothing internally.
Translation_En: So you want to get donations within the company.

Source_Ja: 早速、社内メールを作って、みんなに配布します。
Target_En: I'll work on an e-mail message and send it out to the employees.
Translation_En: Make an email quickly and distribute it to everyone.

Source_Ja: 二週間後の、月曜日から始めるというのはどうでしょうか？
Target_En: Is it okay if we start on Monday the week after.
Translation_En: What about starting on Monday after two weeks?

Source_Ja: いいと思います。
Target_En: Yes.
Translation_En: I think well.

Source_Ja: 私は、ドネーションを入れる箱を用意しますね。
Target_En: I'll find a box for the donation.
Translation_En: I’m going to get a box for donation.

Source_Ja: 助かります。
Target_En: Thanks.
Translation_En: I will help.

Source_Ja: たくさん集まるといいですね。
Target_En: I hope we will have a lot of donation.
Translation_En: I hope you will gather a lot.

Source_Ja: そうですね。
Target_En: Indeed.
Translation_En: Yes is.

Source_Ja: N社の玉元です。
Target_En: Hi this is Tamamoto from Company N.
Translation_En: The company N.

Source_Ja: 玉元さん、渋谷です。
Target_En: Hi Tamamoto-san, this is Shibuya.
Translation_En: Mr. Yuan is Shibuya.

Source_Ja: 渋谷さん、お疲れ様です。
Target_En: Hope you are well Shibuya-san.
Translation_En: Mr Shibuya, welcome to you.

Source_Ja: ちょっと頼みたいことがあるけどいいかな？
Target_En: Is it okay if I ask for a small favor?
Translation_En: I want to ask you a little but can you?

Source_Ja: はい、なんでしょうか。
Target_En: Yes, what is it?
Translation_En: Yes, what is it?

Source_Ja: 明日の東京出張の飛行機の便、変更できるならしてもらえないかな？
Target_En: Can I ask you to change my flight for my business trip to Tokyo tomorrow?
Translation_En: Can I change my flight to Tokyo tomorrow?

Source_Ja: 急に午前中に商談に行かないといけなくなってさ。
Target_En: I suddenly have to go for a business meeting in the morning.
Translation_En: You have to go to business in the morning.

Source_Ja: わかりました、予定はJ航空の8時半名古屋発でしたっけ？
Target_En: Okay, you're currently taking the one departing Nagoya at eight thirty via Airline B?
Translation_En: You know, was it scheduled to depart from Nagoya at 8:30 p.m. by J airport?

Source_Ja: いや違うな、8時ちょうど発のA航空だよ。
Target_En: No, it's the one leaving around 8 o'clock via Airline A.
Translation_En: No, it’s just 8 a.m. on the air.

Source_Ja: そうなんですね、午後の出発ならいつでもいいんでしょうか？
Target_En: Okay, will any flight departing in the afternoon work?
Translation_En: Do you want to start afternoon at any time?

Source_Ja: そうだね、商談は9時からだから2時間として12時半以降ならどの便でもいい。
Target_En: Yeah, the business meeting is from 9 o'clock and should take 2 hours so any flight after twelve thirty will be good.
Translation_En: Yes, business talks are from 9 p.m., so 2 hours after 12 p.m. any flight can be.

Source_Ja: ただ東京出張でも時間が沢山あったほうがいいので午後早めの便がいいかな。
Target_En: But it would be better if I have more time for the business trip to Tokyo so maybe an earlier flight in the afternoon would be good.
Translation_En: It is better to have a lot of time on a trip to Tokyo, so you can get a flight early in the afternoon.

Source_Ja: うーん、ANAの午後便で今見たところ1番早い空席が17時発ですね。
Target_En: Hmm, I just checked the flight for Airline A and the earliest available flight is from 5 o'clock.
Translation_En: Yes, the fastest vacancy that I have seen at ANA's afternoon flight is at 17 p.m.

Source_Ja: そんなに埋まっているのかい？
Target_En: Is it that full?
Translation_En: Are you so buried?

Source_Ja: 残念ですがそのようですね。
Target_En: Unfortunately yes.
Translation_En: Sorry, but it looks like that.

Source_Ja: JALでも見てみましょうか？
Target_En: Should I take a look at Airline B?
Translation_En: Let me look at JAL?

Source_Ja: 頼むよ、17時は流石に遅すぎる。
Target_En: Yes, please, 5 o'clock is a bit too late.
Translation_En: Please, we are too late at 17 p.m.

Source_Ja: お待たせしました、JALでもこの日は夕方まで満席ですね。
Target_En: Thank you for waiting, it seems Airline B is fully booked until the evening.
Translation_En: I have been waiting for you, but this day is full until the evening.

Source_Ja: 何かイベントでもあるんでしょうかね。
Target_En: I wonder if there is some event or something.
Translation_En: Is there any event?

Source_Ja: 困ったなあ、LCCとかでもないかな？
Target_En: That's no good, is there any with the LCC?
Translation_En: Do you have any problems with LCC?

Source_Ja: LCC便ですね、お待ちください。
Target_En: LCC flights, let me check.
Translation_En: The LCC flight, please wait.

Source_Ja: やっぱりありませんね、新幹線はどうなんですか？
Target_En: No there aren't any, how about the bullet train?
Translation_En: I don’t know, what about the new line?

Source_Ja: 新幹線は不便だからあまり好きではないんだよな。
Target_En: The bullet train isn't convenient so I'm actually not fond of it.
Translation_En: The new line is uncomfortable, so I don't like it.

Source_Ja: そうはいってもこの場合仕方ないんではありませんか？
Target_En: Yeah, but what else can we do?
Translation_En: Is it not possible in this case?

Source_Ja: うーん、先方に連絡して商談は後日にしてもらうよ。
Target_En: Hmm, I'll call the person I'm meeting and will ask to shift the business meeting to a later date.
Translation_En: I’ll contact you first and I’ll talk to you later.

Source_Ja: なので予約はこのままで大丈夫。
Target_En: So you can leave the reservation as is.
Translation_En: The reservation is okay.

Source_Ja: 承知しました。
Target_En: Understood.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: それとあと一つ頼んでいいかな？
Target_En: And can I ask you to do one more thing?
Translation_En: Can I ask for another thing?

Source_Ja: はい、なんでしょうか？
Target_En: Yes, what is it?
Translation_En: Yes, what is it?

Source_Ja: 明日の東京でのホテルなんだけど予約確認メール見たら喫煙ルームになってるんだよ。
Target_En: It's in regards to the hotel in Tokyo tomorrow, I was looking at the confirmation email and noticed that it was a smoking room.
Translation_En: Tomorrow’s hotel in Tokyo, but if you see the booking confirmation email, you’ll be a smoking room.

Source_Ja: 俺が自分で予約した時にミスったんだと思う。
Target_En: I must have made a mistake when I booked it.
Translation_En: I think I made a mistake when I booked myself.

Source_Ja: ホテルに連絡して、禁煙ルームが空いてるなら部屋変更を頼んどいてもらえないかな？
Target_En: Can you call the hotel and ask if there are non-smoking rooms available, and if so can you change the room?
Translation_En: Please contact the hotel and if there is no smoking room, can I change the room?

Source_Ja: わかりました、どこのホテルでしょうか？
Target_En: Okay, which hotel is it?
Translation_En: I know which hotel is it?

Source_Ja: 銀座のNホテルだ。
Target_En: It's Hotel N in Ginza.
Translation_En: The N hotel in Ginseng.

Source_Ja: わかりました。
Target_En: Okay.
Translation_En: I realized.

Source_Ja: ちょっと携帯の充電が切れそうなのでどうなったかメール送っておいてくれる？
Target_En: My battery on my phone is running low so can you send me an email on what you find out?
Translation_En: I'm going to get off the phone and what happens to send me an email?

Source_Ja: はい、それでは失礼します。
Target_En: Okay, I'll get back to you on this.
Translation_En: Yes, then I apologize.

Source_Ja: 緑川さんお疲れ様！
Target_En: Midorikawa-san, how are you!
Translation_En: Good luck green!

Source_Ja: 明日営業部は新入社員歓迎会なんでしょ、たくさん楽しんでおいでね。
Target_En: So tomorrow is the sales department's new employee welcoming party, go have lots of fun.
Translation_En: Tomorrow will be a new business meeting, and you can enjoy it.

Source_Ja: 私楽しみな反面ちょっと憂鬱なんですよね。
Target_En: I look forward to it but I'm also a bit depressed.
Translation_En: I am a bit depressed, right?

Source_Ja: なんでどうしたの、何か心配事でもあるの？
Target_En: What's wrong, are you worried about something?
Translation_En: Why is it happening, you are worried about something?

Source_Ja: なんか学生時代のサークルの飲み会とは違うんで粗相をしたらどうしようって。
Target_En: It will be different from a drinking party from a club in my university days so I'm worried I will get out of line.
Translation_En: What if you do not drink from a student’s cycle, what if you do?

Source_Ja: そんなこと心配してたの？
Target_En: You were worried about something like that?
Translation_En: Was you worried about that?

Source_Ja: 歓迎への感謝の気持ちを表して普通にいつもどおり楽しく過ごせばいいと思うわよ。
Target_En: I think you can just express your gratitude to the party and just enjoy it normally as usual.
Translation_En: I would like to be grateful for your welcome and enjoy it as usual.

Source_Ja: いつもどおりってそんなことだけでいいんですか？
Target_En: Normally as usual, that's all?
Translation_En: Should you just do that as usual?

Source_Ja: 歓迎会ってみんなで仲良くするものでしょ、それにお互い知り合うものでもある。
Target_En: You're supposed to have fun with everyone at welcoming parties, it's also to learn more about each other.
Translation_En: They are welcome to each other, and they are well known to each other.

Source_Ja: あんまりよそよそしかったりギクシャクしててもおかしな印象を持たれるだけよ。
Target_En: They will have a weird impression of you if you are too uptight and awkward about it.
Translation_En: If you’re so crazy or crazy, you’ll have a strange impression.

Source_Ja: そんなものなんですねー、普通が1番ってことですね。
Target_En: So just like that, being normal is the best, right?
Translation_En: That’s the best thing, that’s the most normal thing.

Source_Ja: なにか飲み会で新入社員がやらないといけないことってありますか？
Target_En: Is there anything that a new employee must do at drinking parties?
Translation_En: Do you have anything to do for a new employee to drink?

Source_Ja: そうねー、気遣いができればいいんじゃないかしら？
Target_En: Well, it would be good if you are attentive.
Translation_En: No, do you need to be worried?

Source_Ja: 例えば取り皿が足りない人はいないかとか、お酒がまだ来てない人がいないかとか。
Target_En: Like making sure everyone has an extra plate or making sure everyone has got their alcohol.
Translation_En: For example, there are people who don’t have enough dishes or there are people who don’t have enough drinks yet.

Source_Ja: グラスのお酒が減ってきたら足してあげるとか。
Target_En: Pouring some alcohol in their glass if it's getting less.
Translation_En: If you drink a glass, do you add it?

Source_Ja: あれってどれぐらいになったら注げばいいんですか？
Target_En: When should I be pouring it?
Translation_En: How long should I put it in?

Source_Ja: 3分の1とかですか？
Target_En: Like one third?
Translation_En: Is it a third?

Source_Ja: それとも完全にグラスが空になってからですか？
Target_En: Or when the glass is completely empty?
Translation_En: Or when the glass is completely empty?

Source_Ja: これ人によって好みがいろいろなのよね、私は空になってから派だけど。
Target_En: People preferences varies but I'm the type that does it when it is empty.
Translation_En: I have a lot of people like it, but I have been free.

Source_Ja: 特にどれぐらいっていうのはないのよね。
Target_En: There isn't really a set amount.
Translation_En: Especially not how much.

Source_Ja: 1回3分の1ぐらいになった時に注いでみればわかるんじゃない？
Target_En: You will probably know if you try pouring it once when it is around one third.
Translation_En: If you’re about one-third, you’ll know.

Source_Ja: 嫌な人なら断るだろうし、そうじゃない人はそのままグラスを差し出すわよ。
Target_En: People who dislike it will say no and those who are fine will just hand you their glass.
Translation_En: Whoever is bad will refuse, and whoever is not, will offer a glass.

Source_Ja: でもそこまで細かくグラスに目を光らせなくても気づいた時に注げばいいわよ。
Target_En: But I don't think you have to be that detailed and attentive, just pour it when you notice it.
Translation_En: But it should be so detailed when you don’t see the glass.

Source_Ja: なるほど、わかりました。
Target_En: I see, got it.
Translation_En: Well, I realized it.

Source_Ja: やっぱり部長とか課長の席には率先してお酒を注ぎに行ったほうがいいんでしょうか？
Target_En: Should I be pouring alcohol to managers or the section chief?
Translation_En: Would you like to go to the chairman or to the chairman’s seat and drink?

Source_Ja: まあ1回くらいは行ったほうがいいわね。
Target_En: I think it would be good to go at least once.
Translation_En: It is better to go about one time.

Source_Ja: 偉い人から順番に回るんですよね？
Target_En: So I should go around in order in terms of rank?
Translation_En: You’re going to be a great man, right?

Source_Ja: そうね、基本は序列順ね。
Target_En: Yeah, by rank in general.
Translation_En: Basically, it is a sequence.

Source_Ja: 明日の会場はどこなの？
Target_En: Where is the venue tomorrow?
Translation_En: Where is the meeting tomorrow?

Source_Ja: S駅の側のHホテルの宴会場って聞いてます。
Target_En: I heard it is at the banquet hall of Hotel H beside Station S.
Translation_En: I hear the party room of the H hotel on the side of the S station.

Source_Ja: だったら丸テーブルで6名ずつぐらいで座ると思うわ。
Target_En: Then I think there will be around 6 people sitting around a round table.
Translation_En: I think it will be about six people sitting on a whole table.

Source_Ja: 課長と同じ席になったらそこは序列気にせず課長のを先に注げばいいわ。
Target_En: If the section chief is sitting with you then you can ignore the rank and just pour it for the section chief first.
Translation_En: If you are in the same position as the chief, you should not be in line with the chief first.

Source_Ja: それとあそこだとフレンチのコースだから周りのペースに合わせて食べてね。
Target_En: Also, they serve a French course menu so make sure to eat at a pace that others are eating at.
Translation_En: It’s a French course, so you can eat around.

Source_Ja: 妙に遅かったり早かったりするとマイペースだなって捉えられかねないから。
Target_En: If you are oddly slow or fast, they may think you are the type that does things at your own pace.
Translation_En: If it’s too late or too early, you can see it as a myth.

Source_Ja: わかりました、私男兄弟の中で育って食べるのが早いんですけど気をつけます。
Target_En: Okay, I grew up with older and younger brothers so I eat fast but I will be careful.
Translation_En: I know I’m going to grow up in my brothers and sisters quickly, but I’m careful.

Source_Ja: 最後にくれぐれもこれだけは覚えておいて。
Target_En: Finally, be sure to remember this by all means.
Translation_En: Finally, remember this only.

Source_Ja: 新入社員歓迎会だけではなくて今後会社の飲み会では酔っ払いすぎないこと。
Target_En: Be sure to not get too drunk not just for new employee welcome party but for future company drinking parties.
Translation_En: Not only the new employees welcome, but also not too drunk in the company’s future drinking meetings.

Source_Ja: 酔っ払いすぎると自分が気づかないうちに変わってしまう人もいるから。
Target_En: There are people who completely change without realizing when they get too drunk.
Translation_En: Some people get too drunk until they realize that they’re changing.

Source_Ja: はい、アドバイスありがとうございます。
Target_En: Okay, thank you for your advice.
Translation_En: Thank you for the advice.

Source_Ja: でもあそこの伊勢海老のクリームソースは最高よ、楽しんできてね！
Target_En: But their lobster cream sauce is awesome, have fun!
Translation_En: But there is the greatest ice cream, enjoy it!

Source_Ja: これはこれは谷中先生、いつもお世話になってます。
Target_En: Hello Yanaka san, it's a pleasure, as always.
Translation_En: This is what Mr. Walton always takes care of.

Source_Ja: 社長、こちらこそいつもお世話になっております。
Target_En: Hello Miyajima san, the pleasure is all mine.
Translation_En: President, I’m always taking care of you.

Source_Ja: 今日は健康診断についてちょっとお話ししたかったものでお伺いしました。
Target_En: Today, I wanted to discuss the health examination situation with you.
Translation_En: I wanted to talk a little about my health diagnosis today.

Source_Ja: そうか、社員に健康診断を受けさせないといけないんだよね。
Target_En: Oh yes, we need to provide medical examinations for our employees.
Translation_En: You need to get a health diagnosis to your employees.

Source_Ja: そうなんですよ、これは労働安全衛生法で義務付けられているんです。
Target_En: That's right, it is mandated by the Labor Safety and Health Act.
Translation_En: Yes, this is required by the Labour Safety and Health Act.

Source_Ja: 長時間労働での健康障害が増えてるので、かなり厳しくなっていますね。
Target_En: It's very strict now that there's been an increase in health disorders due to long working hours.
Translation_En: The number of health disorders on long hours of work is increasing, so it is quite severe.

Source_Ja: よしわかった、やろう。
Target_En: Alright, then we must get this in order.
Translation_En: I understand, I will do it.

Source_Ja: 会社指定の病院で受けさせればいいんだっけ？
Target_En: Do we send them to one of the company approved hospitals?
Translation_En: Should you get it to the company’s appointed hospital?

Source_Ja: それもひとつの方法としてありますね。
Target_En: That is one option.
Translation_En: There is also one way.

Source_Ja: あとは、会社で集団健診を実施か従業員各自に受診させてその結果を提出させるかです。
Target_En: Or the company can organize a group health examination, or allow each employee to take an exam and submit results.
Translation_En: Afterwards, the company will conduct a collective health care or the employees will consult themselves and submit the results.

Source_Ja: いろいろあるんだね、うちはどれがいいんだろうか？
Target_En: I see, there are many options, which would you recommend?
Translation_En: There’s a lot of things, which one is better?

Source_Ja: 御社であれば、加入してあるG県健保組合の指定医療機関での受診が望ましいですね。
Target_En: I recommend using one of the G prefectural health insurance association approved medical institutions for your company.
Translation_En: If you are the company, you will be advised to attend the appointed medical institution of the G Prefecture Health Association.

Source_Ja: 一番手間がかからずにできる方法です。
Target_En: That would be the easiest option.
Translation_En: It is the hardest way to do it.

Source_Ja: それって健保組合の指定した医療機関じゃないとダメなのかい？
Target_En: Would it have to be a medical institution approved by the health insurance association?
Translation_En: Is it not a healthcare institution that has been appointed by the healthcare association?

Source_Ja: そうですね、原則そうなります。
Target_En: As a general rule, yes.
Translation_En: Yes, the principle is that.

Source_Ja: 実はうちのクライアントにL病院があってね。
Target_En: We have an L hospital as our client.
Translation_En: In fact, my client has a hospital.

Source_Ja: できたらそこで受けさせたらいいんじゃないかと思ったわけよ。
Target_En: I was hoping we can use the hospital, if possible.
Translation_En: I thought I would like you to get it there if you could.

Source_Ja: 今リストを持っていますので調べてみます。
Target_En: Let's see, I will check the list right now.
Translation_En: I have a list now, I will check it out.

Source_Ja: うーん、L病院ですね。
Target_En: Well, L hospital is...
Translation_En: The L Hospital.

Source_Ja: 残念ながらリストには入っていないようですね。
Target_En: Unfortunately is not on the list.
Translation_En: Unfortunately, it does not appear to be on the list.

Source_Ja: そうか、ここで受けさせるにはどうしたらいいかな？
Target_En: Hum, how can we use this hospital?
Translation_En: So what can I do to get it here?

Source_Ja: この健康診断は会社が全ての費用を負担しないといけません。
Target_En: The company would have to cover the costs for the health examinations.
Translation_En: This health diagnosis must be charged by the company for all costs.

Source_Ja: なので私がL病院に事前に話をして社員さんから費用徴取をしないように伝えます。
Target_En: I can contact L hospital and tell them not to charge the fees from the employees ahead of time.
Translation_En: So I'll talk to the hospital in advance and tell you not to charge the staff.

Source_Ja: ただ各自に受診させるので健康診断の必要項目以外を受診希望することもあります。
Target_En: There might be incidences where they might request something other than what's required when the exams are done individually.
Translation_En: It is possible for each person to receive a medical examination, in addition to the necessary medical examination.

Source_Ja: 例えばどういうケース？
Target_En: Can you give me an example?
Translation_En: For example, what case?

Source_Ja: バリウムではなく胃カメラ検査を希望したりするケースですね。
Target_En: For example, in a case when an employee chooses a gastroscopy procedure, rather than taking barium.
Translation_En: You want to check the stomach camera instead of the valve.

Source_Ja: この差額でプラス2万円になったりすることもあります。
Target_En: The cost difference will be an additional 20,000 yen.
Translation_En: This difference can also be up to 20,000.

Source_Ja: なるほどね。
Target_En: I see.
Translation_En: Well as well.

Source_Ja: その場合はオプションになることを事前に社員さんに伝えておく必要があります。
Target_En: We would need to inform the employees in advance that there are different options.
Translation_En: In this case, you need to inform the employee prior to being an option.

Source_Ja: 私の方で、健康診断のお知らせのようなものを作りましょう。
Target_En: I will draw up a memo for the health exam.
Translation_En: Let me make something like a health diagnosis.

Source_Ja: よろしく、頼んだよ。
Target_En: That would be great, thank you.
Translation_En: Welcome, I asked you.

Source_Ja: 受ける時期は皆一緒じゃないといけないのかい？
Target_En: Would we need to get all of them to take the exam around the same time?
Translation_En: Should we all have time to get together?

Source_Ja: なかなか現場の都合もあって、皆一緒には難しいと思うんだよね。
Target_En: I think it will be difficult for all of them to go around the same time due to site constraints.
Translation_En: It’s a good place, and you think it’s hard to get together.

Source_Ja: それは構いませんよ、皆さんで揃えなくても問題ありません。
Target_En: I  agree and  they won't need to do it at the same time.
Translation_En: It doesn’t matter, you don’t have any problem.

Source_Ja: それとこれは法律上、受診時間中の賃金支払い義務はありません。
Target_En: Also, it is not required by law to pay employees during the examination.
Translation_En: And this is legally not obligatory to pay the salary during the receipt time.

Source_Ja: ただし、労働時間として取り扱い、賃金を支払うことが望ましいとされています。
Target_En: But it is recommended that the company treat that time as work, and provide pay.
Translation_En: However, it is desirable to be treated as working hours and pay the salary.

Source_Ja: 社員からすれば、会社からの命令で健康診断に行くという形になりますので。
Target_En: Most employees consider it as a company requirement that they do the exam.
Translation_En: The employee will be given an order from the company for a health diagnosis.

Source_Ja: わかった、勤務時間扱いにしよう。
Target_En: I understand, we will treat it as working hours.
Translation_En: I know, I’m going to deal with working hours.

Source_Ja: では私は健康診断のお知らせができましたらまたご連絡します。
Target_En: OK, I will let you know when I prepare the memo for the health exam.
Translation_En: If I have a medical diagnosis, I will contact you again.

Source_Ja: ご苦労さん、よろしく頼むよ。
Target_En: That would be great, thank you.
Translation_En: Thank you very much, please.

Source_Ja: 新人だからってどうして電話を率先して取らなくちゃいけないんですか？
Target_En: Just because we're new, why do we have to take the initiative in picking up calls?
Translation_En: Why do you need to be a new phone?

Source_Ja: 手が空いている人が取ればいいだけじゃないですか。
Target_En: Why can't whoever is available pick it up?
Translation_En: Do you want to take someone with empty hands?

Source_Ja: 確かにそうですね。
Target_En: That's true.
Translation_En: Surely that is.

Source_Ja: でも率先して電話を出る事によって先様に新しい人が入ったんだなと名前を覚えてもらえます。
Target_En: But if you take the initiative and pick up, it will be a chance for the other party to know that a new person joined and to remember your name.
Translation_En: But you can remember the name of a new person before calling out.

Source_Ja: そして電話対応が良いとあなたの評価が回りまわって社外からも社内からも上がります。
Target_En: And if the way you handled the call was good, your reputation will get better from outside and inside the company.
Translation_En: And if the phone responds well, your rating will rise from outside and from within the company.

Source_Ja: おお、それはいいですね。
Target_En: Oh, that'd be nice.
Translation_En: Oh, that is good.

Source_Ja: ということで、電話対応お願いしますね。
Target_En: So, please do pick up the calls.
Translation_En: Please respond to the phone.

Source_Ja: ではどうして僕たちが資料集めや必要な情報の選定をしなくてはいけないんですか？
Target_En: Then why is it that we have to gather reference materials and pick out information?
Translation_En: So why do we need to collect and select the necessary information?

Source_Ja: これは作家先生本人がするべきことですよね？
Target_En: Isn't this something that the author should do?
Translation_En: This is what the writer should do, right?

Source_Ja: そうですね、アマチュアの作家さんはもちろんプロの作家先生でも自分でされる方はおられます。
Target_En: Well, there are amateur authors and of course professional authors who do it themselves.
Translation_En: Yes, the amateur writer can, of course, be a professional writer.

Source_Ja: でも私は作家先生に今目の前にある物語に集中してほしい。
Target_En: But I want the author to focus on the story in front of them now.
Translation_En: But I want the writer to focus on the story that is in front of me.

Source_Ja: 資料集めは地味に時間がかかるものです。
Target_En: Gathering reference materials does take some time to do.
Translation_En: The collection of documents takes time.

Source_Ja: だからその時間を執筆に使ってほしいと、私は思っています。
Target_En: So, I'd rather have the author spend that time writing.
Translation_En: So I want to spend that time writing.

Source_Ja: それに違う目線で資料を集め選定することは、作家先生の想像力を刺激する事にも繋がります。
Target_En: Also, gathering materials and picking out the information from a different perspective can bring about a new idea for the author too.
Translation_En: Moreover, collecting and choosing materials from a different perspective will also stimulate the writer’s imagination.

Source_Ja: ただ資料を集めるだけじゃないんです。
Target_En: So it's not just simply gathering materials.
Translation_En: It’s not just collecting documents.

Source_Ja: そういった事も編集者の仕事だと、私は考えています。
Target_En: I believe that things like that are part of an editor's job.
Translation_En: I think that’s the job of the editor.

Source_Ja: なるほど、そういう意味もあるんですね。
Target_En: I see, there is such a meaning behind that too.
Translation_En: Yes, it also means that.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます、佐々木さん。
Target_En: Thank you very much Sasaki-san.
Translation_En: Thank you, Mr. Sasuke.

Source_Ja: 木檜さん、おはようございます！
Target_En: Good morning, Satoru!
Translation_En: Good Morning Mr. Moore!

Source_Ja: おお、ピーターソンさん、朝から随分元気だね。
Target_En: Hi, Ron, you're pretty hyper today.
Translation_En: Mr. Peterson, you’re well in the morning.

Source_Ja: なんかあったの？
Target_En: What's up?
Translation_En: Has something happened?

Source_Ja: 今度ウチの生体認証センサーがテレビに出るって知ってる？
Target_En: Have you heard that our biometric sensor will be on TV soon?
Translation_En: Do you know that our bio-recognition sensors will be on television?

Source_Ja: ああ、なんかそんな事誰かが言ってたっけ。
Target_En: Ah, I've heard someone was saying something about that, I guess.
Translation_En: Oh, something that someone said.

Source_Ja: 木曜夜にやってるT放送のニュース番組に出るんだ。
Target_En: We'll be on the news show for T Station every Thursday night.
Translation_En: I'm going to get to the news show on Thursday night.

Source_Ja: あの番組の中で「今週の最先端技術」って紹介するコーナーあるじゃない？
Target_En: You know "State of the Art Technology of the Week" section in that show, don't you?
Translation_En: There’s a corner in that program that’s presenting “the most advanced technology” this week, right?

Source_Ja: あ、それ私も結構見てますよ！
Target_En: Oh, I watch that quite often, too!
Translation_En: Oh, I’m watching it too much!

Source_Ja: ああ、そういえばこの間、AI使ったサイバー攻撃防御システムとかってF株式会社が取り上げられてたな。
Target_En: Oh, yeah, F Corporation was on that show the other day, showing their cyber security system that uses AI or something.
Translation_En: Oh, that’s, for example, the AI used cyber-attack defense system for the past time.

Source_Ja: そうね、あの時出てたFの人、話が上手かったわ。
Target_En: That's right, that person from F was pretty good at talking.
Translation_En: Yes, the people who came out at that time were good to talk.

Source_Ja: 実はあのコーナーって、一発撮りなんだって。
Target_En: I've heard that section is actually shot in one go.
Translation_En: In fact, that corner is a shot.

Source_Ja: えー、でも結構突っ込んだ質問とかしてくるよね？
Target_En: Wow, but they often ask some sharp questions, don't they?
Translation_En: Yes, but you’re getting a lot of questions, right?

Source_Ja: この研究所って、機密保持契約のプロジェクト多いから何言うか気を付けないとだね。
Target_En: This laboratory has quite a few of projects with non-disclosure agreement, so we have to be careful what we say, huh?
Translation_En: This laboratory has a lot of confidentiality contracts, so you have to be careful about what you say.

Source_Ja: ウチのラボからは誰が出るの？
Target_En: Who's going to be on the show from our lab?
Translation_En: Who comes out of our laboratory?

Source_Ja: 多分長澤さんじゃないかな。
Target_En: I guess Kaname would be the one.
Translation_En: Per it’s Nagoya.

Source_Ja: 彼、開発部長だし。
Target_En: He's our Chief of the Development, too.
Translation_En: He is the Development Director.

Source_Ja: あのセンサーの事一番良く知ってるでしょ。
Target_En: And he knows everything about our sensor.
Translation_En: You know the best of that sensor.

Source_Ja: 彼なら安心してテレビの前に座ってられるね。
Target_En: Then I can relax in front of the TV if he'll be on air.
Translation_En: He can be calm and sitting in front of the TV.

Source_Ja: あ、噂をすれば...。
Target_En: Oh, speaking of the devil...
Translation_En: If you have rumors...

Source_Ja: 長澤さん、おはようございます！
Target_En: Good morning, Kaname!
Translation_En: Mr. Nagoya, good morning!

Source_Ja: おはよう。
Target_En: Good morning.
Translation_En: Good Morning.

Source_Ja: みんな朝から集まって何の話？
Target_En: What are you all chatting about gathering together?
Translation_En: What do you talk about in the morning?

Source_Ja: 私は仲間はずれなのかな？
Target_En: Am I missing on something here guys?
Translation_En: I am a friend away, right?

Source_Ja: いえ長澤さん、ウチのセンサーがテレビで紹介されるって話をしてたんです。
Target_En: Well, we were just talking about our sensor being introduced on TV, Kaname.
Translation_En: No, Mr. Nagoya, I told you that our sensor will be presented on TV.

Source_Ja: ああ、あれか、みんな耳が早いね。
Target_En: Oh, that, you guys have sharp ears, huh?
Translation_En: Everyone has a quick ear.

Source_Ja: 長澤さん、それっていつ放送されるんですか？
Target_En: When is it going to be on air, Kaname?
Translation_En: Mr. Nagoya, when will it be broadcast?

Source_Ja: うーん、３週間くらい先のオンエアだったかな。
Target_En: I think it'll be on about three weeks from now.
Translation_En: It was an on-line three weeks ago.

Source_Ja: もう撮ったんですか？
Target_En: Have they shot already?
Translation_En: Have you already photographed?

Source_Ja: いや、来週火曜日の午後のはずだ。
Target_En: Not yet, it's supposed to be next Tuesday afternoon.
Translation_En: No, it should be Tuesday afternoon.

Source_Ja: テレビ局の撮影班がここに来るよ。
Target_En: A camera crew is coming here from the TV station.
Translation_En: The TV show is coming here.

Source_Ja: うわー、何処で撮るんですか？
Target_En: Wow, where are they shooting?
Translation_En: Oh, where do you take a picture?

Source_Ja: 第一会議室だと思うよ。
Target_En: I believe they'll shoot it in Meeting Room 1.
Translation_En: I think it is the first meeting room.

Source_Ja: 先方がなるべく広くて明るい部屋がいい、って言ってたからね。
Target_En: They said they'd prefer a spacious room with lots of light.
Translation_En: He said that the room should be as wide and bright as possible.

Source_Ja: じゃあ、ボードとか少し片付けた方がいいですか？
Target_En: Well then, should we put away some of the stuff like the whiteboard in the room?
Translation_En: Would you like to clean the board or a bit?

Source_Ja: 大丈夫だよ、いつも通りが良いらしいから。
Target_En: It's okay, they want to shoot in our usual setting.
Translation_En: It’s okay, because it’s always good.

Source_Ja: 散らかってる研究室じゃなくて良かったね。
Target_En: I'm relieved that they won't go into the messy lab.
Translation_En: Fortunately it wasn’t a laboratory.

Source_Ja: あー、なんでよりによってその日なんだ、僕出張なのにー！
Target_En: Argh, why does it have to be on that day, I'll be gone on a business trip!
Translation_En: Oh, why it's more than that day, I'm traveling!

Source_Ja: ピーターソンさん、撮影関係ないでしょ。
Target_En: You have nothing to do with shooting, though.
Translation_En: Mr. Peterson, it has nothing to do with filming.

Source_Ja: だって、あのレポーターの女の子、ファンなんだよ！
Target_En: Well, I'm a fan of that reporter girl!
Translation_En: The girl of the reporter is a fan.

Source_Ja: お喋りしたいのは分かるけど、みんなあと10分で朝ミーティング、始めるよ。
Target_En: I know you want to chat a bit more, but we have a morning meeting in 10 minutes, all right?
Translation_En: I know I want to talk to you, but everyone will start a meeting in 10 minutes.

Source_Ja: じゃ、今朝のミーティングはこれくらいかな？
Target_En: Well, so that's about it for the morning meeting today?
Translation_En: Is this the meeting this morning?

Source_Ja: あ、あと１点だけ、確認させてください。
Target_En: Oh, I'd like to confirm one more thing.
Translation_En: Just 1 point, please check it.

Source_Ja: 来週のテレビ取材ですけど、どのセンサー出すんですか？
Target_En: About the TV coverage next week, which sensor are we showing them?
Translation_En: I'm going to get a TV interview next week, but what sensors are you going to get?

Source_Ja: 社長は最新のやつ出したがったんだけど...。
Target_En: Well, Kentaro wanted to put out the latest ones, but....
Translation_En: The president wanted to get the latest...

Source_Ja: 静脈認証のはまだテスト完全に終わってないですよ？
Target_En: We haven't completed testing for the one with vein authentication yet, you know?
Translation_En: The test is not completed yet, right?

Source_Ja: ウチの３D顔認証の方はまだ開発中だし。
Target_En: We're still developing 3D sensors for face recognition, too.
Translation_En: Our 3D face recognition is still in development.

Source_Ja: だから、今F社のSフォンに乗せてる虹彩認証センサーを見せる事にしたんだよ。
Target_En: So, we've decided to show our iris authentication sensor currently mounted on F Corporation's S phone.
Translation_En: So now I have to show you the rainbow certification sensor on the F company’s Sphone.

Source_Ja: 最新のセンサーに関しては、ちょっと最後に話入れるくらいが安全かなって。
Target_En: As for our latest sensors, it's probably safer to mention a little at the end of the coverage.
Translation_En: As for the latest sensors, it’s safe to talk about the last one.

Source_Ja: ふー、あの指紋認証の時みたいになったらって、心配してたんです。
Target_En: Phew, I was worried if something went wrong like that time with that fingerprint sensor.
Translation_En: I was worried that it would be the time of fingerprinting.

Source_Ja: 私はまだトラウマですよ。
Target_En: I still carry that trauma, you know?
Translation_En: I am still traumatic.

Source_Ja: あーあれはヤバかった、生放送の番組だったしね。
Target_En: Oh, that was chilling, and it was a live show, too!
Translation_En: It was bad, it was a live broadcast.

Source_Ja: 私、何の話か分からないんですけど。
Target_En: I don't know what you guys are talking about.
Translation_En: I don't know what I am talking about.

Source_Ja: 指紋認証、ですか？
Target_En: About fingerprint authentication?
Translation_En: Is it fingerprint?

Source_Ja: ああ、かなり前の話だから三居さんはまだ居なかったかも。
Target_En: Oh, yeah, it was quite a while ago so maybe you weren't around then, Anna.
Translation_En: Well, it was a long time ago, and the three might not be there yet.

Source_Ja: 10年くらい前でしたっけ？
Target_En: About 10 years ago, I believe?
Translation_En: Was it about 10 years ago?

Source_Ja: そう、当時ウチが開発したばかりの指紋認証センサー、今回みたいなテレビ番組が取り上げられたんだけど。
Target_En: Yes, like this time, a TV show covered our fingerprint recognition sensor which we had just developed at the time.
Translation_En: Yes, the fingerprint recognition sensor we just developed at that time, a television show like this was taken over.

Source_Ja: 残念ながら、生放送の取材中にちゃんと作動しなくてね、その場でフォローも出来なくて。
Target_En: Unfortunately, it didn't work out properly during the live report, and we couldn't cover for the trouble on the fly either.
Translation_En: Unfortunately, it doesn’t work properly during the live broadcast interview, and you can’t follow it.

Source_Ja: そう、それでこの研究所の評判ガタ落ちして、回復すんのに数年かかったんだ！
Target_En: Yeah, this lab's reputation took a nosedive then, and we had to spend few years to recover!
Translation_En: Yes, so this laboratory’s reputation has fallen down and it took a few years to recover!

Source_Ja: あの時も大塚社長が一番新しいの出したいって言ったんだよね。
Target_En: Kentaro insisted that he'd show the latest product at the time as well.
Translation_En: At that time, the president said he wanted the newest.

Source_Ja: 今回と違って、説得しきれなくて。
Target_En: Unlike this time, I couldn't convince him not to.
Translation_En: Unlike this time, I can’t convince you.

Source_Ja: でも、あれは田淵所長がセンサーの使い方も良く知らないのに色々触りまくってたのが大きな要因だよね。
Target_En: But I think the big part of it was that Toru fiddled around with the sensor, even though he didn't know much about how to use it.
Translation_En: But that’s a big factor that Tanja Director didn’t know how to use the sensor well.

Source_Ja: あの人、研究所所長っていっても、肩書きだけの元お役人でしょ？
Target_En: He's the director of this laboratory, but just a figurehead, a retired official, isn't he?
Translation_En: He’s the director of the laboratory, but he’s only the title officer, right?

Source_Ja: おいおい、言葉に気を付けなさいよ、ピーターソン君。
Target_En: Whoa, you should watch your mouth, Ron.
Translation_En: Be careful with your words, Mr. Peterson.

Source_Ja: だって真面目な話、田淵さん色々わかってないプロジェクトにいっつも口出して、迷惑かけるんですもん。
Target_En: Well, seriously, he always intervenes in projects he doesn't really understands, and gets us into troubles.
Translation_En: Because it’s a serious story, Mr. Tanja, you don’t know a lot about the project, and you’re troubled.

Source_Ja: 先週だって僕のF社でのプレゼン見るって、ついて来たんですけど。
Target_En: Last week too, Toru followed me to see my presentation at F Corporation, though.
Translation_En: Last week I saw the show at my F company.

Source_Ja: いらん事ばっかり言うから、後から全部細々説明しなきゃいけなくて、スゴく余計な時間かかったんですよ。
Target_En: He just kept telling them unnecessary things, so I had to spend so much extra time to follow up with explanations for each and every aspect.
Translation_En: I have to tell you all about it, and it took a lot of time to explain it.

Source_Ja: あー、それ私も先月の展示会でやられたわー！
Target_En: Oh, he did that to me, too, at an exhibition last month!
Translation_En: Oh, I did it in the exhibition last month too!

Source_Ja: 全部知ってるフリして来場者に話しちゃうでしょ？
Target_En: He spoke to participants as if he knew everything, you know?
Translation_En: You know everything and you’re going to talk to the visitors, right?

Source_Ja: ずっと気にして横からフォローいれなきゃいけなくて、ほんと疲れた!
Target_En: I had to be on the watch and cover for him throughout the event, made me super exhausted!
Translation_En: I have to look after it all the time, I’m really tired!

Source_Ja: 表に出て話したいなら、もう少し勉強してからにして欲しいよねー。
Target_En: He should learn more about our products if he wants to go speak in public.
Translation_En: If you want to talk to the table, then let me learn a little more.

Source_Ja: まあまあ、みんなちょっと落ち着いて、そんなに彼を責めないで。
Target_En: Well, everybody, calm down a bit, don't be so hard on him.
Translation_En: Be calm and don’t blame him so much.

Source_Ja: 田淵さんも今度はちゃんとやろうって考えているみたいだから、きっと大丈夫だよ。
Target_En: Toru is thinking of how he'd do better this time, so he should be okay.
Translation_En: I think Mr. Tango is going to do it right now, so it’s okay.

Source_Ja: え、ちょっと待ってください、大丈夫って何がですか？
Target_En: Wait, wait a sec, what do you mean he'd be okay?
Translation_En: Wait a while, what’s okay?

Source_Ja: あれ、さっき皆話してたでしょ？
Target_En: Well, you were all talking about it, weren't you?
Translation_En: Everybody has talked about it before, right?

Source_Ja: テレビに出るって、田淵さんが。
Target_En: About Toru's appearance, on TV.
Translation_En: Going on TV, Mr. Tatiana.

Source_Ja: まさか、今回の虹彩認証センサーも田淵所長が出るんじゃあないですよね？
Target_En: You're not saying that Toru will be on the show this time with our iris recognition sensor, are you?
Translation_En: It’s not going to be the rainbow sensor that’s going to go out, right?

Source_Ja: そうだよ、知らなかったの？
Target_En: Yes, you didn't know?
Translation_En: Yes, did you not know?

Source_Ja: いやいや、それは絶対無理ですって！
Target_En: No, no, no, that's definitely impossible!
Translation_En: No, no, that’s not possible!

Source_Ja: イヤだ、あんな悪夢はもう嫌だー！
Target_En: No, way, no more of that nightmare!
Translation_En: I don’t like this nightmare anymore!

Source_Ja: 所長、今度はラボ全体をトラウマに陥れる気なんですか？
Target_En: Is he trying to traumatize the whole Lab now?
Translation_En: Do you want to put the whole lab into a trauma?

Source_Ja: では、本日の会議を始めます。
Target_En: Hello everyone, let's get started with today's meeting.
Translation_En: We will start today’s meeting.

Source_Ja: 岡田と申します。
Target_En: My name is Okada.
Translation_En: I say to Oakland.

Source_Ja: よろしくお願い致します。
Target_En: Nice to meet you all.
Translation_En: Please please.

Source_Ja: 今日は第1回目の会議ですので、まずは簡単にそれぞれの自己紹介をしましょう。
Target_En: Since this is our first meeting, let's begin with a quick introduction around the table.
Translation_En: Today is our first meeting, so let us first easily present each one of us.

Source_Ja: その後、私から今回のプロジェクトの概要を簡単にお話しします。
Target_En: Then, I am going to give you a brief introduction of our new project.
Translation_En: Then I will give you a brief summary of this project.

Source_Ja: 私はこのプロジェクト期間チームを主導させて頂きます。
Target_En: I am going to be leading this team for the duration of this project.
Translation_En: I will lead the team during this project.

Source_Ja: 普段は営業1課におります。
Target_En: I normally work at unit one in the Sales Department.
Translation_En: Usually I am in 1 business class.

Source_Ja: 何かございましたら、1課のデスクにおりますのでお越しください。
Target_En: Please come and talk to me at my desk in unit one, if you have any questions or suggestions.
Translation_En: If you have something on the table, please come.

Source_Ja: よろしくお願い致します。
Target_En: It's nice meeting you all today.
Translation_En: Please please.

Source_Ja: 次に岸田さん、自己紹介をお願いできますか？
Target_En: Would you like to introduce yourself next, Ms. Kishida?
Translation_En: And then, Mr. Tatiana, can you present yourself?

Source_Ja: はい。
Target_En: Sure.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: 皆さんはじめまして、岸田です。
Target_En: Nice to meet you all, I'm Kishida.
Translation_En: Congratulations to you, Shandong.

Source_Ja: 普段は営業2課におります。
Target_En: I am at unit two in the Sales Department.
Translation_En: It is usually in 2 business classes.

Source_Ja: みなさんと一緒に働けるのを楽しみにしています。
Target_En: I look forward to working with you all.
Translation_En: I am looking forward to working with you all.

Source_Ja: 岸田さん、よろしくお願い致します。
Target_En: Nice meeting you too, Ms. Kishida.
Translation_En: Mr. Shandong, please please.

Source_Ja: 私は宮本です。
Target_En: My name is Miyamoto.
Translation_En: I am a palace.

Source_Ja: 普段は販売促進部におります。
Target_En: I work in the Sales Promotion Department.
Translation_En: Usually in the sales promotion department.

Source_Ja: お二人と共に働けることが楽しみです。
Target_En: I look forward to collaborating with you both.
Translation_En: I am looking forward to working with you both.

Source_Ja: それではこの新プロジェクトの概要について話します。
Target_En: We are now going to talk about the outline of this project.
Translation_En: Then we will talk about the summary of this new project.

Translation_En: In addition, it is intended to gain different new users than expected.

Source_Ja: 良いご質問ですね、通常の小売店や飲食店だけではなくその他にもということです。
Target_En: Good question, it means we are aiming to attract not only retail shops or restaurants but also any other potential opportunities.
Translation_En: It’s a good question, not just the regular retail stores, food stores, and so on.

Source_Ja: なるほど。

Target_En: We want to get various type of users.
Translation_En: You want to get a variety of uses.

Source_Ja: その通りです。
Target_En: That's right.

Source_Ja: だからそれぞれ違う営業部署や担当からプロジェクトチームが構成されたんですね。
Target_En: That's why our team comprises different sales departments and divisions.

Translation_En: I think the style of sales in each department and department is different, but it will be strong.

Target_En: Anyway, we should close the meeting here as we are running out of time.

Source_Ja: うん。
Target_En: Sure.
Translation_En: and yes.

Source_Ja: 日本に船便で身の回り品を送りたいと言っている学生さんがいるんです。
Target_En: There is a student who wants to send his personal belongings to Japan by sea.
Translation_En: There are students who want to send their ships to Japan.

Source_Ja: 来月出国予定で、昨日事務所に質問に来ました。
Target_En: He's leaving the country next month, and he came to the office yesterday asking for advice.
Translation_En: I was scheduled for the next month and I came to the office yesterday.

Source_Ja: 普段荷物を送るのにはY社を使っていると思うんですが、今朝電話で見積もりをお願いしたら1000ポンド以上かかると言われたんです。
Target_En: I understand that we usually use Company Y for the shipment, but when I called them this morning to get a quote, they basically told me it would cost more than 1000 pounds.
Translation_En: I usually use the Y company to send my luggage, but if I ask for an estimate on the phone this morning, I said it would cost more than £1,000.

Source_Ja: 学生さんの予算をかなりオーバーしているので、他のやり方がないか探しているんですよね。
Target_En: Since that is way out of his budget, I am trying to find other ways of doing it.
Translation_En: You’re looking for a student’s budget, so you’re looking for a different way.

Source_Ja: なるほど。

Target_En: Company Y offers the service as one whole package, and while it is very convenient, it tends to be a bit overpriced.
Translation_En: It’s easy for the company to make the process with one package plan, but it’s a bit expensive.

Source_Ja: もし自分たちで国内の船会社と、日本で通関業者と運送会社をそれぞれ見つけられれば合計の費用は安く済むはず。
Target_En: If we can find a shipping company here, and a custom broker and a delivery company in Japan separately by ourselves the total fee should be cheaper.
Translation_En: If we can find a domestic shipping company and a shipping company each in Japan, the total cost would be cheaper.

Source_Ja: なるほど。
Target_En: I see.
Translation_En: So much.

Target_En: We had a similar case a few years ago.
Translation_En: There was the same case a few years ago.

Source_Ja: 確かここに記録があったような、ちょっと待ってね。
Target_En: I think I can find the record here, give me a sec.
Translation_En: I’m sure there’s a record here, wait a while.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thanks.
Translation_En: Thank you.

Source_Ja: あった。
Target_En: Here it is.
Translation_En: was there.

Source_Ja: 貨物の引き取りと日本の港への送付はW社にお願いして、税関業務はE社にお願いして、そしたら輸送もE社が手配してくれているね。
Target_En: We asked Company W to collect the cargo and ship to the Japanese Port in Tokyo, then for the custom paperwork we asked Company E and they arranged the delivery for us as well.
Translation_En: The pickup of goods and shipping to the Japanese port is requested by the W company, the customs operations are requested by the E company, and then the shipping is also ordered by the E company.

Source_Ja: 費用は全部で500ポンド。
Target_En: The total fee was 500 pounds.
Translation_En: The total cost is £500.

Source_Ja: もちろん、費用の部分は貨物のサイズや重量と、あと内容物の価値によって変わってくる。
Target_En: Obviously, the fee will change depending on the size and the weight of the cargo as well as the value of the contents.
Translation_En: Of course, the cost part varies according to the size and weight of the cargo and the value of the material.

Source_Ja: この時には関税はかからないですんだから良かった。
Target_En: We could avoid getting any custom charge for this case, so that was good.
Translation_En: I’m glad I don’t pay taxes at this time.

Source_Ja: その学生さんはどのぐらいの量送ろうと思ってるのかな？
Target_En: How much stuff is he going to send?
Translation_En: How much does the student want to send?

Source_Ja: この方と同じぐらいの量のはずです。
Target_En: It should be about the same as hers.
Translation_En: It should be as much as this.

Source_Ja: オッケー、まあもちろん全く同じ金額になるとは限らないけど、今回も前回と同じように進めていいと思う。
Target_En: Ok, well obviously we shouldn't expect it to be exactly the same, but I'd say we can do it in the same way this time.
Translation_En: Okay, of course it will not be the same amount, but I think this time we can go the same as the previous time.

Source_Ja: そうですね、W社に電話します。
Target_En: Yeah, I will call Company W.
Translation_En: I call the W company.

Source_Ja: 荷物のだいたいの量と内容の価値を聞かれると思うから、学生さんに先に確認した方がいいかもね。
Target_En: They would need a rough amount of the package and a value of the contents so maybe check with the student first.
Translation_En: If you want to know the amount and value of your baggage, you should check the student first.

Source_Ja: あっ、そうですね。
Target_En: Ah, yes.
Translation_En: Oh yeah yes.

Source_Ja: メールします。
Target_En: I will email him.
Translation_En: I will email.

Source_Ja: そうだ、W社はもしかしたらCMSを導入したかもしれないから、聞いておいた方がいいよ。
Target_En: Oh, also Company W may have introduced CMS so check that with them too.
Translation_En: Yes, the company may have introduced CMS, so you should hear it.

Source_Ja: CMSって何ですか？
Target_En: What is CMS?
Translation_En: What is CMS?

Source_Ja: 「コンテナー・マネジメント・サーチャージ」っていうんだけど。
Target_En: It's "container management surcharge".
Translation_En: It’s a “containers management charger”.

Source_Ja: 実際ちゃんとした費用なのかはわからない部分もあるんだけど、船会社によっては港で荷下ろしするときに通関業者に請求する所があるみたいなんだよね。
Target_En: It is a little unclear if that is really a thing, but some shipping companies charge the broker when they unload the cargos at the port.
Translation_En: I don't know if it's really a good cost, but it's like a shipwreck company has a place to charge the carrier when it loads in the port.

Source_Ja: 手数料みたいなものかな。
Target_En: It's like a handling fee.
Translation_En: It is like a fee.

Source_Ja: なるほど。
Target_En: I see.
Translation_En: So much.

Source_Ja: 前回W社からは請求されなかったから、今回も同じだといいんだけど。
Target_En: Company W did not charge us the last time so hopefully it still is the case.
Translation_En: We didn’t pay for the previous time, so I hope this time is the same.

Source_Ja: そうですね。
Target_En: Yeah.
Translation_En: Yes is.

Source_Ja: 前の時のファイルを送っていただいてもいいですか？
Target_En: Can I ask you to send me the file of the previous case?
Translation_En: Can I send you the previous file?

Source_Ja: 目を通したいです。
Target_En: I want to go through it.
Translation_En: I want to go through the eyes.

Source_Ja: もちろん。
Target_En: Of course.

Source_Ja: というか、匿名にして共有のデータベースにあげておくね。
Target_En: Actually, I am going to make it anonymous and upload it on our shared database.
Translation_En: You will be able to share it anonymously in a database.

Source_Ja: これからも同じような案件が出てくるかもしれないし。
Target_En: We may have similar cases in the future.
Translation_En: Maybe the same case will come from now on.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます！
Target_En: Thank you!
Translation_En: Thank you!

Source_Ja: どういたしまして。
Target_En: You're welcome.

Source_Ja: プレゼンのお手伝いをしてくださるそうで、ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thanks for offering to help me with my presentation.
Translation_En: Thank you for helping with the presentation.

Source_Ja: 私は今回のように大勢の前でプレゼンしたことがないんですよ。
Target_En: I've never given a presentation in front of such big audience before.
Translation_En: I have never presented before so many people this time.

Source_Ja: お手伝いできて嬉しいです！
Target_En: I'm glad I could help!
Translation_En: I am glad to help you!

Source_Ja: どんなプレゼンにするつもりですか？
Target_En: What are you planning?
Translation_En: What kind of presentation are you going to present?

Source_Ja: スライドショーをしようかと考えています。
Target_En: I'm thinking about using a slide show.
Translation_En: I want to make a slide show.

Source_Ja: 我が社の購買層を示すのには円グラフが良いですよね。
Target_En: I'll probably include a pie chart showing our demographic.
Translation_En: It’s a good way to show our company’s buyers.

Source_Ja: そして地域別の販売高を示すのに棒グラフを使おうと思います。
Target_En: Then I'll use a bar graph to show our numbers for each region.
Translation_En: And I will use a graffiti to show a different local sales rate.

Source_Ja: グラフはただ見せるより説明した方が良いですよ。
Target_En: I would suggest explaining the graph rather than just showing.
Translation_En: It is better to explain the graph than just show it.

Source_Ja: それぞれの座標軸がなにを意味するのか忘れずに指し示してくださいね。
Target_En: Be sure to point out what each axis means.
Translation_En: Do not forget to indicate what each coordinate axis means.

Source_Ja: そうすれば、あなたが説明したいことを皆さんが確実に理解してくれます。
Target_En: That way, you can make sure everyone understands what you're trying to show.
Translation_En: So you will be sure that you will understand what you want to explain.

Source_Ja: それから、グラフの各領域の色を目立つようにすること。
Target_En: Also, make sure the colors between the sections of the graph stand out easily.
Translation_En: Then make sure that the colors of each area of the graph are clear.

Source_Ja: でも、あまり派手すぎないように。
Target_En: Don't make it too fancy, though.
Translation_En: But let’s not be too good.

Source_Ja: ごくシンプルにした方が良いですよ。
Target_En: It's better to keep it pretty simple.
Translation_En: It is better to make it very simple.

Source_Ja: はい！
Target_En: Okay!
Translation_En: and yes!

Source_Ja: 分かりました。
Target_En: That makes sense.
Translation_En: I understood.

Source_Ja: この題目はどうでしょうか？
Target_En: How does this theme look?
Translation_En: What about this topic?

Source_Ja: これはちょっと複雑すぎますね。
Target_En: That one is a bit too complicated.
Translation_En: This is a bit too complicated.

Source_Ja: 表示の内容が読みにくいです。
Target_En: It's hard to read what the labels say.
Translation_En: The content is difficult to read.

Source_Ja: 代わりにこうしてみたら良いと思います。
Target_En: I think you should try this one instead.
Translation_En: I would like to try this instead.

Source_Ja: ありがとうございます。
Target_En: Thanks.
Translation_En: Thank you.

Source_Ja: プレゼン自体についてなにか秘訣はありますか？
Target_En: Do you have any tips for the actual presentation?
Translation_En: Do you have any secrets about the presentation itself?

Source_Ja: 事前に何度か練習することでしょうか。
Target_En: I would say practice a few times before.
Translation_En: Do you have to practice several times in advance?

Source_Ja: 前日に練習してストレスを感じるより、何日か余裕を持って練習したほうが良いですよ。
Target_En: Space out your practice between a few days, so you won't be too stressed by practicing on the last day.
Translation_En: It is better to exercise for a few days rather than to feel stressed on the first day.

Source_Ja: ナーバスになりすぎず、ホワイトボードを見ずに会場を見渡すようにすること。
Target_En: Just don't be too nervous, and make sure to look around the room rather than at the white board.
Translation_En: Don’t be too narcissistic and make sure you look at the meeting without seeing the White Board.

Source_Ja: プレゼンを暗記すればするほど、簡単に皆さんと目線を合わせられるようになりますよ。
Target_En: The more you have your presentation memorized, the easier it will be to make eye contact with people.
Translation_En: The more you make the present, the easier you will be to match your eyes with you.

Source_Ja: ちゃんと練習します。
Target_En: I'll be sure to practice.
Translation_En: I practice properly.

Source_Ja: その点を一番心配しているんです。
Target_En: That's the part I'm most worried about.
Translation_En: I am most concerned about that.

Source_Ja: ご協力ありがとうございました。
Target_En: Thank you for your help!
Translation_En: Thank you for your cooperation.

Source_Ja: どういたしまして。
Target_En: No problem.
Translation_En: How to go.

Source_Ja: 上手く行きますように！
Target_En: Good luck!
Translation_En: Let it go well!
